prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To determine whether the patent is infringed, Sandos is required to provide Amgen with data on the manufacturing process and manufacturing method of Zaccio, according to BPCIA regulations.
answer: BPCIA의 규정에 따르면 산도스는 작시오의 제조 공정과 제법에 관한 자료를 암젠에 제공해 특허 침해 여부를 판단하도록 되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to the regulations of the BPCIA, the submission of the manufacturing method and manufacturing method data could be interpreted as optional which resulted in the submission of the data being rejected.
answer: BPCIA의 규정을 보면 제조 공법과 제법 자료의 제출이 선택사항이라고 해석할 수 있기 때문에 자료 제출을 거부한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The sale of Zakcio began in September 2015 after the Federal Circuit Court recognized that the patent dispute is a civil matter between the parties and the ambiguity of the BPCIA regulations.
answer: 연방순회법원이 특허 분쟁은 당사자간의 민사적인 문제이며 BPCIA 규정의 모호성을 인정하여서, 2015년 9월부터 작시오의 판매가 개시되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Regarding the licensing of biosimilars, legal issues related to BPCIA regulations are not completely resolved.
answer: 바이오시밀러의 허가와 관련해 BPCIA 규정에 관한 법적 문제가 완전히 정리된 것은 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A patent invalidation lawsuit is filed first at the same time as applying for a biosimilar, and a countervailing lawsuit for patent infringement is how the original drug company responds.
answer: 바이오시밀러 신청과 동시에 특허 무효 소송부터 내기도 하고, 원조 신약 기업은 특허 침해 소송이라는 맞불로 대응하기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It seems likely that it will have to go through several legal disputes in the future in order for the biosimilar approval process through the BPCIA to be stabilized.
answer: BPCIA를 통한 바이오시밀러의 허가 절차가 안정화되려면 앞으로도 여러 차례의 법률 분쟁을 거쳐야 할 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the trend of biosimilars will not be stopped.
answer: 그러나 바이오시밀러 대세는 막을 수 없을 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Anyone can make a generic drug when the patent of the original drug expires.
answer: 원조 신약의 특허가 만료되면 누구나 복제약을 만들 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of course, it must be checked and proved that the generic drug is chemically and pharmacologically identical to the original drug.
answer: 물론 복제약이 원조 신약과 화학적·약리학적으로 동일하다는 것을 증명해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, it is difficult to prove that it is chemically identical to the original drug in the case of a bio-new drug.
answer: 그러나 바이오신약의 경우에는 원조 신약과 화학적으로 완벽하게 동일하다는 것을 증명하기가 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Compared to chemical synthetic drugs, it has a larger size and more complex structure.
answer: 화학 합성 약품에 비해 크기가 크고 구조가 복잡하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even it may not be the same pharmacologically, a biologic drug could be chemically the same, and even if the chemical structure is slightly different, the drug effect may be the same.
answer: 바이오 복제약은 화학적으로 같아도 약리학적으로는 같지 않을 수 있고, 심지어는 화학적 구조가 조금 달라도 약효는 동일할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, to distinguish them from generic drugs, clones of bio-new drugs are called biosimilars.
answer: 따라서 바이오신약의 복제품은 제네릭과 구분하여 바이오시밀러라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Until the patent expires, biosimilars cannot be approved.
answer: 바이오시밀러도 특허가 만료되어야 허가를 받을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the patents for blockbuster bio-new drugs expire by 2020, so naturally this is the reason biosimilars are receiving a lot of attention recently.
answer: 바이오시밀러가 뜨거운 관심을 받는 이유도 블록버스터 바이오신약의 특허가 대부분 2020년까지 만료되기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of the current top eight bio-new drugs, the sum of sales in 2014 is $65.9 billion.
answer: 현재 상위 바이오신약 8종의 2014년 판매액의 합은 659억 달러이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There would be a $23.1 billion the United States market assuming that a biosimilar sells at 70% of the original drug price and erodes 50% of the market.
answer: 바이오시밀러가 원조약의 70% 가격에 팔리고 시장을 50% 잠식한다고 가정하면, 231억 달러의 미국 시장이 생기는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. How quickly biosimilars will replace the existing drug market is not yet known.
answer: 바이오시밀러가 기존의 신약시장을 얼마나 빠르게 대체해 나갈 지는 아직 알 수 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is not known whether there will be a limit to market entry due to the characteristics of biopharmaceuticals, or whether existing products will be replaced as quickly as generic drugs after the Hatch-Waxman Act.
answer: 해치-왁스만 법 이후에 제네릭 약품처럼 빠르게 기존 제품을 대체할 것인지, 혹은 바이오의약품의 특성으로 인해 시장 진입에 한계가 있을지는 알 수가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, biosimilars have already become a business target for several companies as several consulting groups are offering rosy prospects.
answer: 그러나 여러 컨설팅 그룹이 장밋빛 전망을 제시하고 있고, 이미 바이오시밀러는 여러 회사들의 사업 목표가 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Biosimilars are already approved in some countries, and sold as pharmaceuticals.
answer: 바이오시밀러가 이미 의약품으로 허가되어 판매되는 나라도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a copy of a bio-new drug whose patent has not been applied for at all or has expired.
answer: 특허가 만료되었거나 아예 출원되지 않은 바이오신약을 복제한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In case the biosimilar market expands, it has the advantage of stabilizing the manufacturing process and securing clinical data.
answer: 바이오시밀러 시장이 확대될 때를 대비해 제조 공정을 안정화시키고 임상 자료를 확보할 수 있는 장점이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The European market, which accounts for half of the US pharmaceutical market, has biosimilars that have already entered.
answer: 의약품 시장 규모가 미국의 절반에 해당하는 유럽시장에도 이미 바이오시밀러가 진출했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For the purpose of lowering drug prices through competition, the European Union also approved the sale of biosimilars.
answer: 유럽연합도 경쟁을 통한 약가 인하를 목적으로 바이오시밀러의 판매를 허가했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Lipitor which is a cure for hyperlipidemia was recorded the highest sales by far a few years ago, but currently the best-selling drug in Europe is Humira.
answer: 몇 년 전만 해도 고지혈증 치료제인 리피토가 단연 1위의 판매액을 기록했지만, 현재 유럽에서 가장 많이 팔리는 약은 휴미라다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bio-new drugs are eight out of the top ten pharmaceutical sales.
answer: 의약품 판매액 상위 10위 중에 8개가 바이오신약이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is due to bio-new drugs being expensive, not because the ranking of the best-selling drugs has changed because of the rapid change in the patients numbers.
answer: 환자 수가 급변해서 많이 팔리는 약의 순위가 변한 것이 아니라 바이오신약이 비싸기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The approval process similar to generics has been shortened by the European Medicines Agency, leading to the introduction of biosimilars.
answer: 유럽 의약국에서는 제네릭과 비슷하게 허가 과정을 단축시켜 바이오시밀러의 도입을 유도했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The mecca of original new drugs, the biosimilar market in the United States, is about to open.
answer: 원조 신약의 메카인 미국의 바이오시밀러 시장은 개장 직전이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because as part of Obamacare the BPCIA program was established in 2010, paving the way for biosimilars to be introduced into the United States market later than Europe.
answer: 오바마케어의 일환으로 2010년 BPCIA 프로그램이 마련되어, 유럽보다 늦게 바이오시밀러가 미국 시장에 도입될 수 있는 길이 열렸기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2014, the FDA finally accepted an application for approval for Saxio, the first Sandos biosimilar, and in September 2015 was approved for sale.
answer: 2014년 마침내 최초로 산도스의 바이오시밀러 작시오의 허가 신청을 받아들였고, 2015년 9월에 판매가 허가되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Amgen is also pursuing a counter-action with biosimilars, which increases risks of cannibalizing the market for biosimilars.
answer: 바이오시밀러에 시장을 잠식당할 위기에 처한 암젠도 바이오시밀러로 맞불 작전을 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From Abbee and Herceptin, Amgen is also developing biosimilars of Humira and Avastin from Roche is in phase 3 clinical trials.
answer: 암젠도 앱비의 휴미라와 로슈의 허셉틴과 아바스틴의 바이오시밀러를 개발하고 임상 3상을 진행 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the United States, which accounts for half of the global pharmaceutical market, the opening of the biosimilar market is imminent.
answer: 전 세계 의약품시장의 절반을 차지하고 있는 미국에서 바이오시밀러 시장의 개장이 바야흐로 임박했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are also global pharmaceutical companies such as Novartis, Sanofi and Pfizer with generic divisions.
answer: 노바티스와 사노피, 화이자처럼 제네릭 사업부가 있는 글로벌 제약사도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are more competitors when the barrier to entry is lowered, and the drug price is lowered.
answer: 진입장벽이 낮아지면 경쟁회사도 많아지고 약가도 낮아지는 것이 특징이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the drug price does not fall below 20% if the number of generics increases by more than 5.
answer: 그러나 제네릭의 수가 5개 이상 많아져도, 약가는 20% 이하로는 떨어지지 않는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because of their high manufacturing costs, some predict that biopharmaceuticals will not lower their prices as much as generic drugs.
answer: 바이오의약품은 제조비용이 높기 때문에 제네릭만큼 약가가 낮아지지 않는다고 예측하기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the same time, some have the opinion that due to the limitations of drug price cuts the market expansion of biosimilars is limited.
answer: 동시에 약가 인하의 한계 때문에 바이오시밀러의 시장 확대가 제한적이라는 의견도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sometimes global pharmaceutical companies have subsidiaries of generic pharmaceutical companies.
answer: 제네릭 전문 제약회사들은 글로벌 제약회사의 자회사인 경우도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are many opinions that Pfizer acquired Hospira in 2015 just to enter the biosimilar market.
answer: 화이자는 2015년 호스피라를 인수했는데 바이오시밀러 시장에 진출하기 위한 것이라는 의견이 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With the United States rights to Remsima, Celltrion's biosimilar, Hospira is pushing for FDA approval, which is called the KOSDAQ stock market.
answer: 호스피라는 코스닥 대장주라고 불리는 셀트리온의 바이오시밀러 렘시마의 미국 판권을 가지고 FDA 허가를 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Biosimilars are also being developed by Biotech companies like Amgen.
answer: 암젠과 같은 바이오텍 기업도 바이오시밀러를 개발하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With Samsung Bioepis, Biogen IDEC is jointly entering the European biosimilar market.
answer: 바이오젠 아이덱은 삼성바이오에피스와 공동으로 유럽의 바이오시밀러 시장에 진출하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Intensifying competition and developing in a very complex manner, all major global pharmaceutical companies to biotech companies are expected to enter the biosimilar market.
answer: 메이저 글로벌 제약회사부터 바이오텍 기업까지 모두 바이오시밀러 시장에 뛰어들어 경쟁이 심화되고 매우 복잡한 양상으로 전개될 것으로 예상된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Production facilities with a scale of about 10, 000 liters are required based on the cultured solution because Humira is an antibody drug, and the production concentration is around 1.5g/L.
answer: 휴미라는 항체의약품인데 생산농도는 약 1.5g/L 전후이므로 배양액 기준으로 약 1만 리터 규모의 생산설비가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 15, 000 liters are required when assuming an efficiency of 66.7% in the separation and purification process.
answer: 분리정제 과정에서 효율을 66.7%로 가정하면 1만 5,000리터가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2007, it invested $450 million to build a plant of about 33, 000 square meters (about 10, 000 sq.) when the production capacity of the manufacturing plant in Massachusetts reached its limit.
answer: 매사추세츠 주에 있던 생산 공장의 생산 능력이 한계에 도달하자, 2007년에 4억 5,000달러를 투자해 약 3만 3,000제곱미터 규모의 공장을 짓고 휴미라를 생산해 시장 수요를 충족시켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The sales volume is large compared to facility investment which is a characteristic of bio-new drugs.
answer: 설비투자 대비 매출 규모가 큰 것이 바이오신약의 특징이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Compared to the ROI of general manufacturing it is prohibitively high even though it is a simplified calculation.
answer: 단순화시킨 계산이지만, 일반 제조업의 ROI와 비교하면 엄청나게 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of course, development costs and clinical trial licensing costs are not taken into account and as a result, it is bound to be high.
answer: 개발비와 임상시험 허가 비용을 고려하지 않았기 때문에 당연히 높을 수밖에 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Generic drug business can reduce clinical licensing costs and development.
answer: 복제약 사업은 개발비와 임상 허가 비용을 줄일 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Biosimilars can also be a business with very high investment efficiency for the same reason.
answer: 같은 이유로 바이오시밀러 역시 투자효율이 매우 높은 사업이 될 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Global pharmaceutical companies and biotech companies, such as Amgen, are participating in the biosimilar business for exactly this reason.
answer: 이 점이 바로 글로벌 제약회사부터 암젠과 같은 바이오텍 기업까지 바이오시밀러 사업에 참여하는 이유다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through Bioepis, a joint investment with Samsung Biologics and Biogen IDek, Samsung Group also entered the biosimilar business.
answer: 삼성그룹도 삼성바이오로직스와 바이오젠 아이덱과 공동출자한 바이오에피스를 통해 바이오시밀러 사업에 진출했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since 2014, being well-known as a major stock in the KOSDAQ, Celltrion, has been selling two biosimilars in the Europe market as well as in Korea.
answer: 코스닥 대장주로 잘 알려진 셀트리온은 2종의 바이오시밀러를 국내뿐만 아니라 유럽 시장에서 2014년부터 판매하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The biosimilar business has a high proportion of R&D and is a large-scale manufacturing industry.
answer: 바이오시밀러 사업은 연구개발의 비중이 높은 대규모 제조업이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Based on cultured solution in Songdo, Celltrion has a production facility of 50, 000 liters.
answer: 셀트리온은 송도에 배양액 기준으로 5만 리터의 생산설비를 갖추고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, each with a capacity of 90, 000 liters, the second and third plants, are being expanded.
answer: 여기에 각각 9만 리터 규모의 제2공장과 제3공장을 증설하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. About to complete a 150, 000-liter production plant in 2016, Samsung Biologics has also completed a 30,000-liter production facility in 2012.
answer: 삼성바이오로직스도 2012년에 3만 리터 생산설비를 완공하고 2016년에 15만 리터 규모의 생산 공장 준공을 앞두고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A factory 10 to 20 times larger than Humira's production facility is what they are building.
answer: 휴미라의 생산시설보다 10~20배 큰 규모의 공장을 짓고 있는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Other domestic companies including Binex, Hanwha Chemical, and Isu Abgis, operate production facilities for antibody medicines and cell culture machines of less than 10,000 liters.
answer: 이외 1만 리터 이하의 세포배양기 및 항체의약품 생산설비를 운영하고 있는 국내회사는 바이넥스, 한화케미칼, 이수앱지스 등이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Roche acquired a leading American biotech company, Genentech, along with Amgen, in 2009.
answer: 암젠과 함께 미국의 대표적 바이오텍 기업인 제넨텍은 2009년 로슈가 인수했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Including Genentech's bio-new drugs production facility, the world's largest production facility is owned by Roche.
answer: 제넨텍의 바이오신약 생산시설을 포함해 세계 1위의 대규모 생산시설은 로슈가 소유하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2015, Roche is building in Singapore a new production facility.
answer: 로슈는 2015년 싱가포르에 생산시설을 새로 건설 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As experienced in the generic drug market in the past, why are leading biotech companies investing in large-scale production facilities? The reason is if there are many market entrants, the price will drop and the productivity competition will unfold.
answer: 과거 제네릭 의약품 시장에서 경험한 것처럼 시장 진입자가 많으면 가격이 내려가고 생산성 경쟁 구도가 펼쳐진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While the market is expected to expand, biosimilars are also expected to come down in price.
answer: 바이오시밀러 역시 가격이 낮아지고 반면에 시장은 확대될 것으로 예상된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To the law of economies of scales, the production price of biosimilars is no exception.
answer: 바이오시밀러의 생산 가격도 규모의 경제 법칙에서 예외가 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It applies to equipment investment in bio products without exception as this is an empirical rule learned from statistical data on equipment investment in chemical plants in the past.
answer: 과거 화학공장의 설비 투자 통계자료로부터 알게 된 경험적 법칙인데, 바이오제품의 설비투자에도 예외 없이 적용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It can be estimated, since 10 to the 0.6 power is about, that the investment cost of a biosimilar facility with 100,000 liters of cultured solution is four times that of 10,000 liters.
answer: 10의 0.6승은 약 4인데, 배양액 기준 10만 리터의 바이오시밀러 설비는 1만 리터의 4배의 투자비용이 소요된다고 추정할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the other hand, biosimilars must compete with each other to expand the market to maximize profits and lower prices.
answer: 반면 바이오시밀러는 서로 경쟁하면서 가격을 낮추고 시장을 확대해야 수익을 극대화할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If the production scale is 10 times, even if the price of a biosimilar drops to 30% of the original drug, sales will triple.
answer: 바이오시밀러의 가격이 원조약의 30% 수준까지 낮아져도, 생산 규모가 10배면 매출이 3배가 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A simple comparison with Humira can, from an optimistic point of view, achieve $360 billion in sales from a 100,000-liter plant.
answer: 낙관적인 관점에서 휴미라와 단순 비교하자면 10만 리터 공장에서 360억 달러의 매출을 달성할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of course, assuming that everything is sold as soon as it is made and the factory utilization rate is 100%.
answer: 물론 공장 가동률이 100%이고 만드는 대로 모두 팔린다고 가정하면 그렇다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, a conservative estimate is that a plant can expect sales of up to KRW 4 trillion with a capacity of 100,000 liters.
answer: 따라서 보수적인 전망치는 10만 리터의 공장에서 최대 4조 원 정도의 매출을 기대할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The clinical cost of a new drug increases exponentially as stated earlier in 'Irum's Law.’.
answer: 신약의 임상비용이 기하급수적으로 증가한다는 ‘이룸의 법칙’을 앞에서 소개했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the contrary, the market will expand accordingly, providing the most growth potential business opportunity and the price of biosimilars will decrease exponentially like 'Moore's Law.’.
answer: 이와는 반대로 바이오시밀러의 가격은 마치 ‘무어의 법칙’처럼 기하급수적으로 감소하고 이에 따른 시장 확대를 통하여 가장 성장성이 높은 사업 기회를 제공할 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While developing a new drug, most of the cases do not generate sales for a long time.
answer: 신약을 개발하는 오랜 시간 동안 매출이 발생하지 않는 경우가 대부분이기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is no wonder that the germination time of a jackpot vine takes a significant amount of time.
answer: 대박넝쿨이 싹을 틔우는 데 오랜 시간이 걸리는 것은 어쩌면 당연하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because most biotech companies, even if they have no sales, are listed on the Nasdaq due to the fact they are evaluated only on the future value predicted by experts.
answer: 바이오텍 기업은 대부분 매출이 없더라도 전문가들이 예측하는 미래가치만으로 평가받아 나스닥에 상장되기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It may grow into a jackpot vine, or it may not sprout at all.
answer: 아예 싹을 틔우지 못할 수도 있고 대박넝쿨로 자랄 수도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, until it sprouts, it is difficult to know, and even after it sprouts, it is difficult to predict which kind of sprout will become a jackpot vine.
answer: 다만 싹을 틔우기 전에는 알 수 없고 싹을 틔워도 어떤 싹이 대박넝쿨이 될지 예측하기가 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From 2010 and over 20 years, GDP in the BRIC countries will increase by 300% and European Union will increase by 50%.
answer: 2010년부터 20년 동안 유럽연합의 GDP는 50% 증가하지만 BRIC 국가는 300% 증가할 것으로 예측하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Structural weaknesses of the existing petroleum-based chemical industry and energy problems will inevitably be exposed by anything that is growth dependent on fossil fuels.
answer: 화석연료에 의존하는 성장은 필연적으로 에너지 문제와 기존의 석유 기반 화학산업의 구조적 취약점을 드러낼 수밖에 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although it is not possible to accurately predict the future, in relation to the megatrend of the next 10 years, we selected a bio-new technology industry that has the potential to become a jackpot.
answer: 미래를 정확하게 예측할 순 없지만 향후 10년간의 메가트렌드와 관련되어 대박넝쿨의 가능성이 보이는 바이오신기술 산업을 골라보았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If the rice of industry are semiconductors, then the seeds of personalized medicine are genes.
answer: 반도체가 산업의 쌀이라면 유전자는 개인 맞춤의료의 씨앗이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Over the past decade, there have been breakthroughs in genetic analysis technology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now, I wonder what it will look like, the kind of jackpot vine the budding genetic analysis business can make.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At present, the most probable seems to be the development of personalized medical care based on genetic information.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The production of several cloned human films has been caused by excessive expectations for human cloning in the past.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are difficulties in distribution, storage, and procedures considering that living cells are used as therapeutic agents, as well as problems in mass production as pharmaceuticals.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. But isn't there a saying that a mature tree recognizes the cotyledon first? Stem cell therapy will be an idea that will grow into a vine with strong stems.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I just hope that the responsibility for our old age health will be taken by stem cell therapy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Energy diversification has become a vague word even in memory now that oil prices have fallen to half of what they were at the time.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only after a few years, the investment in technology to develop bioenergy at the time began to show little light.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Rather than bioenergy, it performed better in the field of improving enzymes or microorganisms.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For the next several years the prices of energy are expected to remain stable.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, bio-new technology will re-emerge, if energy prices become unstable again in a few years, as a means of solving the sustainability of the chemical industry.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The cost of the examination will increase significantly if you do a CT or MRI scan.
answer: 영상진단이라고 부르는 CT나 MRI 검사라도 하게 되면 검사비는 크게 늘어난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The cost will also increases if you have multiple blood and urine tests.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Urine or blood is collected and the components in it are analyzed when undergoing a health checkup.
answer: 건강검진을 받을 때도 소변이나 혈액을 채취하여 그 속에 있는 성분을 분석한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It tells you if your blood sugar, liver levels, electrolytes, cholesterol, etc. are within the normal range, but you suddenly feel heavy if even one item is out of the normal range.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Expensive health checkups have emerged for several years, in which if you pay more, the number of items to be tested significantly increases.
answer: 수년 전부터 돈을 더 내면 검사항목이 대폭 늘어나는 비싼 건강검진이 생겨났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Like in vitro diagnostics, in order to have early diagnosis of various types of cancer, blood or urine is collected and analyzed, but a cancer gene test and a tumor marker test are added.
answer: 체외진단처럼 혈액이나 오줌을 채취하여 분석하지만, 여러 종류의 암을 조기 진단하는 암유전자 검사나 종양 표지자 검사가 추가된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Relatively recently, diagnostic technology to detect oncogenes or tumor markers has been introduced and it is different from the existing clinical chemistry analysis that analyzes blood or urine components, it is called molecular diagnosis or immunodiagnosis.
answer: 암유전자나 종양 표지자를 찾아내는 진단기술은 비교적 최근에 도입되었고 기존의 혈액이나 소변의 성분을 분석하는 임상화학 분석과는 다르기 때문에 분자진단이나 면역진단이라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the past, molecular diagnosis tests the genes of white blood cells, blood tests measured the number of white blood cells.
answer: 예를 들자면 과거의 혈액검사에서는 백혈구의 수를 측정했다면 분자진단에서는 백혈구의 유전자를 검사하는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By using immune antibodies, immunodiagnosis examines the appearance of white blood cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Molecular diagnostics reads information recorded in the biomolecules, such as genes or antibodies, within them versus in the past when clinical and chemical in vitro diagnostics examined the components of blood or urine.
answer: 과거 임상화학적 체외진단은 혈액이나 소변의 성분을 검사했지만, 분자진단은 그 속의 유전자나 항체와 같은 생체분자에 기록된 정보를 읽어낸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Just like the saying ignorance is medicine and knowledge is disease, molecular diagnostic technology can make our minds uncomfortable.
answer: 모르는 게 약이고 아는 게 병이라는 말처럼, 분자진단기술은 우리의 마음을 불편하게 만들기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A few years ago, the news that made headlines was that actress Angelina Jolie, for fear of developing breast cancer, had to have her breast removed.
answer: 수년 전 영화배우 안젤리나 졸리가 유방암 발병 우려로 유방 제거 수술을 받았다는 뉴스가 화제가 되기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When researched through a cancer gene test, the cancer incidence rate was 87%.
answer: 암유전자 검사를 통해 유방암 발생 확률이 87%로 진단되었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By comparing genetic information, a cancer gene test only tells the probability, in a statistical way, of developing cancer.
answer: 암유전자 검사는 유전정보를 비교해 통계적인 방법으로 암 발생 가능성만 알려줄 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The probability could be high of developing cancer, but it might not actually develop, and vice versa.
answer: 암 발병 확률이 높아도 실제 발병하지 않을 수도 있고, 그 반대의 상황도 발생할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In that the probability varies from individual to individual, it has high preventive medicine value, although the probability of cancer occurrence may be just a number.
answer: 이처럼 암 발생 확률이 단지 숫자에 불과할 수도 있지만, 개인에 따라 확률이 다르다는 점에서 예방의학적인 가치가 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, the most effective drug for each individual can be found by a cancer gene test.
answer: 뿐만 아니라 암유전자 검사는 개인별로 어떤 항암제가 가장 치료효율이 좋은지 알려줄 수도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, the era of personalized medicine is expected to advance from the development of molecular diagnostic technology.
answer: 때문에 분자진단기술의 발전이 개인 맞춤의학시대를 앞당길 것으로 예상하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Knowledge may have been a disease, in the past, when there was no proper treatment, but now knowledge is power.
answer: 적당한 치료 방법이 없던 과거에는 아는 게 병이었을 수 있지만, 지금은 아는 게 힘이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A primitive immune diagnosis is also a blood type test, and the pregnancy diagnosis kit uses immunodiagnostic technology, and even I have used that at least once.
answer: 혈액형 검사도 원시적인 면역진단이고, 한번쯤은 사용해 본 임신진단키트도 면역진단 기술을 이용한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibodies look like the English alphabet Y and are immunoprotein in our body.
answer: 항체는 우리 몸에 있는 면역 단백질인데, 영어 알파벳 와이처럼 생겼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A property of antibodies is that of sticking to other substances with symmetrical concavo-convex regions.
answer: 항체는 대칭 모양의 요철 부위를 가진 다른 물질에 달라붙는 성질을 가진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An antibody that matches the surface irregularities of the pathogen sticks when an infectious disease invades.
answer: 만일 병원균이 침입하면, 병원균의 표면의 요철에 맞는 항체가 달라붙는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An antigen is the infectious disease or surface molecule to which the antibodies binds.
answer: 이렇게 항체가 결합하는 병원균이나 표면의 분자를 항원이라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Y-shaped upper part is slightly different for each immune antibody just as the unevenness of the key groove is different for each key.
answer: 열쇠 홈의 요철이 열쇠마다 서로 다르듯 면역항체마다 Y 모양의 윗부분이 조금씩 다르다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are different irregularities in the numerous antibodies of our body.
answer: 우리 몸은 요철 부분이 다른 수많은 항체를 가지고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Substances present in trace amounts in the blood, due to an antibody’s precise bind only antigens, can be identified or measured.
answer: 항체는 항원에만 정확하게 결합하기 때문에, 혈액에 극소량 존재하는 물질을 확인하거나 측정할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even if there are other similar proteins, the advantage of immunodiagnosis is that it can be accurately diagnosed without being disturbed.
answer: 비슷하게 생긴 다른 단백질이 있어도 방해 받지 않고 정확하게 진단 가능한 것이 면역진단의 장점이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Depending on the type of virus or infectious disease, if there is an antibody that distinguishes and adheres to the uneven pattern, immunodiagnosis is possible.
answer: 바이러스나 병원균의 종류에 따라 요철 무늬가 다르고 이를 구분하여 달라붙는 항체가 있으면 면역진단이 가능해진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If the right antibodies are used, even in the case of an invisible virus, we can tell whether or not the virus is present in the blood.
answer: 눈에 보이지 않는 바이러스도 맞는 항체를 사용하면 혈액 속에 바이러스가 있는지 없는지 알 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The presence of trace amounts of protein in the blood are also diagnosed.
answer: 혈액 속에 극미량 존재하는 단백질의 존재 여부도 진단한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The test for prostate cancer is done by measuring the concentration of PSA in the blood using an antibody that only binds to PSA.
answer: PSA에만 달라붙는 항체를 이용해 혈액 속의 PSA 농도를 측정하여 전립선암 검사를 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Biopsies shows that about 25% have prostate cancer if the PSA level is 4 or higher.
answer: PSA 수치가 4 이상인 경우 조직검사를 하면 약 25%가 전립선암을 가지고 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the value of tumor marker are threatened because some prostate cancer patients have PSA levels below 4.
answer: 그러나 전립선 암환자 중에도 PSA 수치가 4 이하인 경우도 있어 종양 표지자의 가치를 위협받고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, compared to anti-PSA antibodies, there are new markers, such as EPCA2 and PCA, 3 that can detect prostate cancer more accurately being developed.
answer: 그래서 항PSA 항체보다 좀 더 정확하게 전립선암을 검사할 수 있는 EPCA2와 PCA3와 같은 새로운 표지인자가 개발되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. That is why it is important to find antibodies that can be used for diagnosis.
answer: 때문에 진단에 사용 가능한 항체를 찾아내는 것이 중요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If markers and antibodies that can be used for immunodiagnosis are developed, because the basic principle of immunodiagnosis is the same, it has the advantage that it can be applied to diagnosis immediately.
answer: 면역진단의 기본 원리는 같기 때문에, 면역진단에 사용할 수 있는 표지인자와 항체를 개발하면 바로 진단에 적용할 수 있다는 장점이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From various infectious diseases to tumor markers, the number of subjects to which immunodiagnosis can be applied continues to increase.
answer: 면역진단을 적용할 수 있는 대상도 각종 감염성 질환부터 종양 표지인자까지 계속 늘어나고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From simple disposable kits to large-scale immunodiagnostic systems, by applying nanotechnology and medical engineering technology, various immunodiagnostic products have been developed.
answer: 나노기술, 의공학기술 등이 적용되어 간단한 일회용 키트부터 대형 면역진단 시스템까지 다양한 면역진단 제품이 개발되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The development of markers for diseases such as Alzheimer's disease, in addition to diagnosing cancer, continues.
answer: 암 진단 외에도 알츠하이머와 같은 질환의 표지인자 개발이 계속되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using the activity of NK cells, ATIGEN developed a cancer disease biomarker.
answer: 에이티젠은 NK세포의 활성도를 이용한 암 질환 바이오마커를 개발하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The concentration of patients in large hospitals is severe in our country therefore, the number in hospitals of in vitro diagnostic samples is high.
answer: 대형병원으로의 환자 쏠림이 심한 우리나라에서는 병원 내 체외진단 검체 수가 많이 발생한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Every year, the import of in vitro diagnostic devices cost our country more than 500 billion won.
answer: 우리나라는 매년 5,000억 원 이상의 체외진단기기를 수입하는 데 쓰고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reagents and consumables required for the operation of the diagnostic system, in this structure, are supplied all at once.
answer: 진단 시스템의 운전에 소요되는 시약 소모품 등이 일괄 공급되는 구조다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Companies provide diagnostic services or that manufacture antibodies and antibody diagnostic kits are intricately connected with each other in the immune diagnosis business.
answer: 면역진단사업도 항체와 항체진단키트를 제조하거나 진단서비스를 대행하는 기업들이 서로 복잡하게 연결되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Automated immunodiagnostic systems that can process large amounts of samples are usually what major diagnostic companies mainly deal with.
answer: 메이저 진단 기업은 대량의 시료를 처리할 수 있는 자동화된 면역진단 시스템을 주로 취급한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Korea, the automated immune system market for major diagnostic companies is large, because the proportion of medical services centered on large hospitals is high.
answer: 대형병원 위주의 의료 서비스 비중이 높은 우리나라는 메이저 진단기업의 자동화 면역 시스템 시장이 크다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the other hand, in foreign countries where small-scale primary care institutions are active, on-site diagnosis using disposable immunodiagnostic kits has high demand.
answer: 반면 소규모의 1차 진료기관이 활성화된 외국에서는 일회용 면역진단키트를 사용한 현장 진단 수요가 많은 편이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Doctors perform both diagnosis and treatment with a simple immunodiagnostic kit in the examination room in small scale hospitals and countries with well-developed family doctor systems.
answer: 소규모 병원이나 가정의 제도가 잘 발달된 나라에서는 진찰실에서 의사가 간단한 면역진단 키트로 진단과 치료를 병행한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, in our country, where in a short period of time one or two doctors have to see many patients, there is not much use of diagnostic kits or blood collection for in vitro diagnosis.
answer: 그러나 한두 명의 의사가 단시간 내 많은 환자를 보아야 하는 우리나라에서는 체외진단을 위한 혈액 채취나 진단키트의 사용이 많지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is common knowledge for the patients, that the tests are done in general hospitals.
answer: 환자도 검사는 종합병원에서 하는 것으로 으레 알고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, because there are many cases where they are equipped with prominent medical devices such as ultrasonic Imaging diagnostic device, it is not natural, even in local hospitals.
answer: 그렇지만 동네 병원이라도 초음파영상 진단장치 같은 눈에 띄는 의료기기를 갖추고 있는 경우는 많아 자연스럽지 못하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At pharmacies, the pregnancy diagnostic kits that are available for purchase are also POC products.
answer: 약국에서 살 수 있는 임신진단키트도 바로 POC 제품이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When you put blood or urine in it and you can see the results right away after a few minutes, which is why it is called a rapid kit.
answer: 혈액이나 오줌을 넣으면 몇 분 후에 바로 결과를 알 수 있기 때문에 래피드 키트라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most infectious diseases such as hepatitis diagnosis, AIDS, malaria, syphilis, and tsutsugamushi can be diagnosed with the use of a rapid kit, and they have been developed and used worldwide.
answer: 간염 진단부터 에이즈나 말라리아, 매독, 쓰쓰가무시 등 대부분의 감염성 질환을 진단할 수 있는 래피드 키트가 개발되어 전 세계적으로 사용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In India alone, annually 100 million malaria rapid kits are used.
answer: 말라리아 래피드 키트는 인도에서만 연간 1억 개가 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Our country’s KOSDAQ listed companies, Access Bio and SD, are the ones who manufactured and exported in large quantities.
answer: 우리나라 코스닥 상장기업인 엑세스바이오와 에스디에서 대량으로 제조하여 수출하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, the emerging markets for rapid diagnostic kits that are coming forward are China and India.
answer: 때문에 중국과 인도가 래피드 진단키트의 신흥시장으로 부상하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The septicemia that caused singer Shin Hae-chul's death has a rapid kit that quickly diagnoses it, and this has also been sold in Korea for several years.
answer: 가수 신해철을 죽음으로 몰고 간 패혈증을 신속하게 진단하는 래피드 키트도 국내에서 수년 전부터 판매되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are only fever symptoms, in the early stages of septicemia, that are difficult to distinguish from a cold.
answer: 패혈증은 초기에는 감기와 구분하기 어려울 정도로 발열 증세만 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is an emergency situation in which due to an excessive inflammatory response bacteria penetrate through the wall of dilated blood vessels, and immune cells struggle to defend.
answer: 과도한 염증 반응으로 확장된 혈관 벽을 통하여 세균이 침투하고, 면역세포들은 힘겹게 방어하고 있는 긴급 상황이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Measuring the amount of a substance involved in the inflammatory response, called prolactin, reveals the nature of the fight.
answer: 염증 반응과 관계된 물질인 프로락틴의 양을 측정하면 싸움의 양상을 알 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is considered that the invasion of germ has started, if the level of prolactin in the blood exceeds 0.05.
answer: 혈중 프로락틴의 값이 0.05를 넘으면 세균의 침입이 시작된 것이라고 보면 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It becomes an urgent situation if the value exceeds 2. It becomes as if the walls are collapsing and enemies are rushing in.
answer: 값이 2를 넘으면 마치 성벽이 무너져 적들이 물밀듯이 쳐들어오는 것과 같은 급박한 상황이 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Blood pressure and respiration weaken, and next the organ failure can lead to death if prompt treatment is not started.
answer: 신속하게 치료를 시작하지 않으면 혈압과 호흡이 약해지고 장기부전으로 사망에 이르게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most often Septicemia starts with pneumonia, pyelonephritis, or inflammation of the hepatitis, but it can also occur as a post-operative infection.
answer: 패혈증은 수술 후 감염으로도 발생하지만 폐렴이나 신우신염, 간담도염에서 시작되는 경우가 대부분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A lot of lives will be saved just by the proper use of rapid kits alone.
answer: 래피드 키트만 적절하게 사용하더라도 생명을 구할 수 있는 여지가 많이 생길 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The limitations of rapid kits are that they mainly tell only the presence or absence of antigens.
answer: 래피드 키트는 주로 항원의 존재 여부만을 알려주기 때문에 한계가 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Necessity is the mother of invention as the saying goes, therefore the improvement of being able to measure the amount of antigen by using it as a miniature meter was developed for the rapid kit.
answer: 필요는 발명의 어머니라는 말처럼, 그래서 래피드 키트를 개선해 소형측정기와 같이 사용하여 항원의 양을 측정할 수 있도록 개발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By developing portable measuring instruments and quantitative rapid kits, Boditech Med, a domestic bio venture, is making a lot of money in the China market.
answer: 국내 바이오벤처인 바디텍메드는 정량 래피드 키트와 휴대용 측정기를 개발하여 중국시장에서 많은 수익을 올리고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even in local hospitals that cannot be equipped with the automated immunodiagnosis system common in general hospitals, can use these because it’s a quantitative rapid kit that detects prolactin, a hormone that can diagnose septicemia or biomarkers for myocardial infarction or pulmonary embolism.
answer: 패혈증을 진단할 수 있는 호르몬인 프로락틴이나 심근경색이나 폐색전증 바이오마커를 검출하는 정량 래피드 키트는 종합병원에서 사용하는 자동화 면역진단 시스템을 갖출 수 없는 동네 병원에서도 사용할 수 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The parent company of Bio Focus, K-Mac, Infopia, and Medisensor, a semiconductor equipment company, are manufacturing immunodiagnostic kits and measuring instruments, in addition to Body Tech Med, Nano Entech.
answer: 바디텍메드 외에도 바이오포커스의 모회사인 나노엔텍, 반도체 장비회사인 케이맥, 인포피아, 메디센서가 면역진단키트와 측정기를 제조하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By analyzing various components of blood, in vitro diagnostics mainly measure the amount.
answer: 체외진단은 주로 혈액의 여러 성분을 분석하여 양을 측정하는 경우가 대부분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A value that indicates the amount of glucose in the blood is blood sugar which is a more familiar word to our ears.
answer: 우리 귀에 익은 단어인 혈당은 혈액 속의 포도당의 양을 나타내는 값이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the amount of genetic material is not determined by molecular diagnostics.
answer: 그러나 분자진단은 유전물질의 양을 알아내는 것이 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As if reading letters from a book, they are used to read genetic information from molecules.
answer: 마치 책에서 글자를 읽듯이 분자에서 유전정보를 읽어내는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The location where the genetic information is stored, DNA, is like a beaded string using only four beads.
answer: 유전정보가 기록된 DNA는 마치 4가지 구슬로 꿰어 만든 염주와 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Just as the contents of a sentence change when the order of letters is changed, genetic information is recorded according to the sequence of bases.
answer: 글자의 순서가 달라지면 문장의 내용도 변하듯, 염기의 배열 순서에 따라 유전정보가 기록된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Whereas written text includes more than a few letters, genetic information only has four types of bases to arrange.
answer: 글은 여러 글자로 기록하지만, 유전정보는 단지 4종의 염기배열일 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. No wonder computers only store information as 0's and 1's.
answer: 그러나 컴퓨터가 0과 1로 정보를 저장하는 것을 생각해 보면 이상할 것도 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The life phenomena of a cell is programmed using an arrangement of bases in its genes, just as a computer operates with programs stored as 0's and 1's.
answer: 컴퓨터가 0과 1로 저장된 프로그램으로 움직이는 것처럼, 세포의 생명 현상도 유전자에 염기배열로 프로그램되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are 30 billion arrangements of bases in human genetic information.
answer: 인간의 유전정보는 30억 개의 염기배열로 기록되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It takes a lot of time and money to read all 30 billion pieces of genetic information, just as it takes time to read all the letters in a huge book.
answer: 방대한 분량의 책에서 글자를 다 읽으려면 시간이 걸리듯, 30억 개의 유전정보를 다 읽어내려면 상당한 시간과 비용이 든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can easily find the part you want quickly if you use the search function for files on your computer or the Internet.
answer: 그런데 컴퓨터나 인터넷에 있는 파일은 검색 기능을 사용하면 손쉽게 빨리 원하는 부분을 찾을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A fragment of a gene has the capability to find a partner gene.
answer: 유전자 조각은 짝 유전자를 찾아내는 능력이 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If we compare the human genome to a book, then a fragment of a gene corresponds to a short passage of about one verse.
answer: 인간의 유전자가 책 한 권에 해당한다고 보면, 유전자 조각은 한 구절 정도의 짧은 글귀에 해당한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. What a fragment of a gene does, is that it finds a pair of gene fragments on the opposite side of the original double helix and then remakes a double strand again.
answer: 유전자 조각은 원래 이중나선의 반대쪽에 있는 짝 유전자 조각을 찾아가 다시 2중 가닥을 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A special mystical ability to find a mate is not something genes have.
answer: 유전자라고 특별히 신비한 능력을 가져서 짝 유전자를 찾아내는 것은 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As molecules are colliding with each other by constantly moving at high speeds, if they happen to encounter a fragment of a gene pair, they will stick together and do not fall apart again.
answer: 분자는 끊임없이 빠른 속도로 움직이고 서로 충돌하는데, 우연히 짝 유전자 조각을 만나면 붙어서 다시 잘 떨어지지 않기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A fragment of a gene finds its partner for no other reason than simply because of the constant and fast-moving motion of molecules.
answer: 유전자 조각이 짝 유전자를 찾아내는 이유는 단순하게도 끊임없이 빠르게 움직이는 분자의 운동 때문인 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The paired bases are pulled together so therefore it is the reason that when a fragment of a gene meets the matching paired base arrangement and exists as a double-strand.
answer: 유전자 조각이 짝 염기배열을 만나 2중 가닥으로 존재하는 이유는 짝 염기끼리 잡아당기기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They are pulled more strongly and are not easily separated when all the arrangement of bases are paired.
answer: 염기배열상의 모든 염기가 짝을 이루면 더 강하게 잡아당기고 잘 분리되지 않는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So, in our metaphorical book the text is one line, but the genetic information in DNA is recorded in two lines.
answer: 그래서 책에 쓰인 글은 한 줄이지만, 유전정보는 두 줄로 기록되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Along with their base arrangement, genes have pairs of opposite bases to form two strands.
answer: 유전자는 염기배열을 따라 짝 염기가 반대쪽에 배열되어 두 가닥을 형성한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can see the pair of base arrangement on the other side and correct it if one side of base arrangement is wrong.
answer: 만일 염기배열의 한쪽이 잘못되더라도 반대쪽의 짝 염기배열을 보고 고쳐 넣을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It can be said that the core of molecular diagnosis are gene fragments.
answer: 유전자 조각은 분자진단의 핵심이라 할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Molecular diagnostics and a base arrangement are impossible without gene fragments.
answer: 유전자 조각 없이는 분자진단이나 염기배열을 알아내는 것도 불가능하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Similar to computer searches using keywords, a fragment of a gene uses a keyword that corresponds with a nucleotide base arrangement.
answer: 컴퓨터에서 키워드를 사용해 검색을 하듯이, 키워드에 해당하는 염기배열을 가진 유전자 조각을 사용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is possible to duplicate only the gene in the vicinity or read the nucleotide base arrangement when a fragment of a gene finds a pair of nucleotide base arrangement and combines them.
answer: 유전자 조각이 짝 염기배열을 찾아 결합하면, 그 부근의 유전자만을 복제하거나 염기배열을 읽어낼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In molecular diagnosis, it uses keyword fragments of a gene to quickly read only the necessary genetic information instead of reading all of the vast amount of genetic information.
answer: 분자진단에서는 방대한 유전정보를 모두 읽는 대신 키워드 유전자 조각을 이용해서 필요한 부분의 유전정보만 신속하게 읽어낸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With the development of bio-new technology, by finding a niche in the in vitro diagnostic market with molecular and immunodiagnostic technologies, bio ventures that enter the diagnostic market are continuously emerging.
answer: 바이오신기술의 발전으로, 분자진단과 면역진단 기술로 체외진단 시장의 틈새를 찾아내 진단시장으로 진입하는 바이오벤처가 계속 생겨나고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The niche market locations where the market size is still small for large diagnostic companies to enter, is where bio-venture companies that provide molecular diagnostic materials and services or manufacture diagnostic kit rapid kits are located.
answer: 거대 진단기업이 들어오기에는 아직 시장 규모가 작은 틈새시장에 분자진단 재료 및 서비스를 제공하거나 진단키트 래피드 키트를 제조하는 바이오벤처 기업들이 자리 잡고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As diagnosis is a prerequisite for treatment, it seems that bio-diagnostic technology can grow into big fruit from the jackpot vine that grows on the manure of medical expenses.
answer: 진단이 치료에 전제되는 만큼, 의료비라는 거름을 먹고 자라는 대박넝쿨에서 바이오 진단기술이 큰 열매로 자랄 수 있을 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As if searching for a keyword, when the synthesized a fragment of a gene is added to the sample, it finds a pair of genes and creates a double strand.
answer: 합성된 유전자 조각은 시료에 첨가하면 마치 키워드로 검색하듯이 짝 유전자를 찾아 2중 가닥을 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Then, the nucleotide arrangement of bases near the double strand is chain-replicated through a polymerase chain reaction.
answer: 이어서 중합효소 연쇄 반응을 통해 2중 가닥 부근의 염기배열을 연쇄 복제한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It cannot become double-stranded if there is no gene to be replicated, when the viral gene is not present in the sample.
answer: 만일 시료에 바이러스 유전자가 존재하지 않는다면 2중 가닥을 만들지 못하고, 복제되는 유전자도 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A fragment of a gene can detect the presence of a viral gene just like a keyword search.
answer: 마치 키워드 검색처럼 유전자 조각으로 바이러스 유전자의 존재 여부를 알아낼 수 있는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The MERS virus was also diagnosed using fragments of a gene and polymerase chain reaction, which threw us into confusion in 2015.
answer: 2015년 우리를 혼란 속에 몰아넣었던 메르스 바이러스도 이렇게 유전자 조각과 중합효소 연쇄 반응을 이용해 진단했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Genetic information was soon revealed after the MERS virus was first discovered in Saudi Arabia, and thus revealing the nucleotide arrangement of bases that exists only in the MERS virus.
answer: 사우디아라비아에서 메르스 바이러스를 처음 발견했고, 곧 유전자 정보가 공개되어 메르스 바이러스에만 존재하는 염기배열을 알게 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It became possible to diagnose viral infections by synthesizing keyword fragments of a gene.
answer: 키워드 유전자 조각을 합성하여 바이러스 감염을 진단할 수 있게 된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The death toll from pneumonia of unknown cause may have frightened us if the method of molecular diagnosis had never been developed.
answer: 분자진단이라는 방법이 개발되지 않았으면 원인 모를 폐렴으로 인한 사망자가 급증하면서 우리를 공포에 떨게 했을지도 모른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Many fields besides infectious diseases can apply molecular diagnostics.
answer: 분자진단은 감염성 질환 외에도 많은 부분에 응용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Angelina Jolie has benefited from molecular diagnostics in how it is also used to predict the likelihood of a disease.
answer: 질병의 가능성을 예측하는 데도 사용되는데, 안젤리나 졸리가 분자진단의 혜택을 본 경우다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Angelina Jolie had a problem with the BRCA1 gene which led to her having her breast removed to rule out cancer.
answer: 암 가능성을 배제하기 위해 유방 제거 수술을 받은 안젤리나 졸리는 BRCA1 유전자에 문제가 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The normal BRCA1 gene cane repair the gene by making a certain protein.
answer: 정상인 BRCA1 유전자는 유전자를 수리하는 단백질을 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The more cells that divide, the higher the probability of genetic errors, and the cell division necessary for lactation occurs actively.
answer: 수유에 필요한 세포분열이 활발하게 일어나는데, 세포가 많이 분열할수록 유전자에 오류가 발생할 확률이 높아진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The probability of developing cancerous cells increases if there is no protein that finds the errors and repairs them.
answer: 이를 찾아서 고쳐주는 단백질이 없으면 암세포가 생겨날 확률이 높아진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The likelihood of developing certain cancers can be predicted by using molecular diagnostics.
answer: 분자진단은 특정한 암의 발생 가능성을 예측하는 데 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hereditary diseases, such as multiple sclerosis, can also be identified by this method.
answer: 이외에도 다발성 경화증 같은 유전성 질환을 확인하는 데 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sovaldi, which was introduced as an expensive drug to treat hepatitis C, can be administered alone in the case of type 2 or 3 hepatitis C virus, and can be administered in combination with interferon when the hepatitis C virus is type 1 or 4.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Living organisms that are used for energy are generically called biomass.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is present in small amounts in the blood and is not made by other tissues of the body.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If only a part of the base sequence is known, even if there is only a very small amount of a gene, a large amount of fragments of genes with the same base sequence can be obtained by chain reaction with a polymerase.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. PCR is used in molecular diagnostics to amplify a specific region of a human gene to confirm the presence of an infectious disease or virus that is the cause of an infectious disease or to confirm a hereditary disease.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. My body has about 5, 000 times more cells than the world's population although it varies from person to person.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Our cells are getting old and getting sick which can be seen when we look at how our bodies get old or get diseased.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A hairy cell is what causes hair thinning and baldness with age.
answer: 나이가 많아지면서 머리숱이 적어지고 대머리가 되는 것은 모근세포에 원인이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The idea that cells are the source of life and that injecting healthy cells will be effective in curing diseases, which due to that idea, it has taken hold in people's minds.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By linking the blood vessels of young and old mice, it promotes rejuvenation of the hippocampus based on recent studies, which is responsible for the recovery of wounds and memory in old mice.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only with the beginning of the 20th century, however, blood transfusion became common when blood types were learned and substances that prevent blood clotting were developed.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Essential for surgery blood transfusions, during World Wars I and II, saved many lives.
answer: 1차와 2차 세계대전 동안 외과수술에 필수적인 수혈은 많은 사람의 생명을 구했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A blood transfusion can be viewed as a cell therapy in that it supplies red blood cells, white blood cells, or platelets although its common use is to replenish lost blood.
answer: 수혈은 손실된 혈액을 보충하기 위해 사용되었지만 적혈구나 백혈구 혹은 혈소판을 공급한다는 점에서 세포 치료라고 볼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When all hematopoietic stem cells in the bone marrow are destroyed by radiation or chemotherapy, and another person's hematopoietic stem cells are then transplanted is a method we call bone marrow transplantation.
answer: 항암제나 방사선으로 골수의 조혈모세포를 모두 사멸시킨 후에 타인의 조혈모세포를 이식하는 골수이식은, 급성백혈병이나 다발성 골수종 등의 악성 종양 및 재생불량성 빈혈 같이 조혈모세포에 암이 생겼을 경우에 치료하는 방법이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Blood cells such as red blood cells and white blood cells are made by hematopoietic stem cells.
answer: 조혈모세포는 말 그대로 적혈구나 백혈구 같은 혈액세포를 만드는 세포다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you receive a hematopoietic stem cells transplant, it is different from a blood transfusion because a blood transfusion is temporarily supplied with other people's blood cells, but with a hematopoietic stem cell transplant you will live with someone else's blood cells forever.
answer: 수혈은 일시적으로 타인의 혈액 세포를 공급받지만, 조혈모세포를 이식받으면 영원히 타인의 혈액 세포를 가지고 살아가게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because the transplanted hematopoietic stem cells share their fate with my body by continuing to proliferate or partly change into blood cells.
answer: 이식된 조혈모세포는 계속 증식하거나 일부는 혈액세포로 변화되면서 내 몸과 운명을 같이 하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The blood type of the person receiving the hematopoietic stem cells may be different since hematopoietic stem cells can be transplanted if the histocompatibility antigen is the same.
answer: 조혈모세포는 조직적합성항원이 같으면 이식이 가능하기 때문에 조혈모세포를 이식받은 사람의 혈액형이 달라질 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You don't have to worry about side effects like a sex change because it only changes blood type.
answer: 혈액형이 바뀔 뿐이지 성전환이 되는 것은 아니므로 걱정할 필요는 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After the atomic bomb was dropped on Nagasaki, Japan, even without trauma, many people died a week or two later.
answer: 일본의 나가사키에 원자폭탄이 떨어진 후에 외상이 없어도 1~2주일 후에 사망한 사람이 많았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because the genes of hematopoietic stem cells were destroyed by the radiation emission when the atomic bomb exploded.
answer: 원자폭탄이 폭발할 때 방출된 방사선이 조혈모세포의 유전자를 파괴했기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hematopoietic stem cells do not proliferate and they cannot make blood cells in the body of a person exposed to radiation.
answer: 방사선에 노출된 사람의 몸에서는 조혈모세포가 증식하지 못하고 혈액세포도 만들지 못하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Blood cells gradually decrease, leading to death.
answer: 결국은 적혈구와 백혈구 같은 혈액세포가 서서히 줄어들어 사망에 이르게 되는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, scientists have discovered that rats won't die even when exposed to radiation if a part of the rat's bones are covered with lead.
answer: 그런데 과학자들이 실험쥐 뼈의 일부분을 납으로 가려주면 방사선을 쪼여도 죽지 않는다는 사실을 발견했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From this, he found out that blood cells are made from stem cells in the bone marrow, and this led to the bone marrow transplant theories being born.
answer: 이로부터 적혈구나 백혈구 같은 혈액 세포는 뼛속 골수의 줄기세포에서 만들어진다는 것을 알게 되었고, 골수이식 치료법이 탄생하게 된 계기가 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, for a long time, it can be said that stem cell therapy has already started.
answer: 따라서 이미 한참 전부터 줄기세포 치료가 시작되었다고 볼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All cells in our body are made from stem cells, just as there are hematopoietic stem cells that make blood cells.
answer: 혈액세포를 만드는 조혈모세포가 존재하듯이, 우리 몸의 모든 세포는 모세포에서 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You will find an embryo where sperm and egg meet, if you go back to find the mother cell of the mother cell.
answer: 모세포의 모세포를 찾아 거슬러 올라가면 정자와 난자가 만나 만들어지는 배아를 만난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The embryonic stem cells located inside the embryo are the progenitor stem cells, which correspond to the mother cells of the mother cells.
answer: 모세포의 모세포에 해당하는 시조 줄기세포가 바로 배아의 내부에 있는 배아줄기세포다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Stem cells make ordinary cells, and embryonic stem cells divide to become stem cells.
answer: 배아줄기세포가 분열해 줄기세포가 되고, 줄기세포는 보통 세포를 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To form our bodies, ordinary cells divide several times and grow exponentially.
answer: 보통 세포는 또 여러 차례 분열해서 기하급수적으로 늘어나 우리의 몸을 형성한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, our body is composed of very few stem cells and mostly normal cells.
answer: 그 결과로 우리 몸은 대부분의 보통세포와 극소수의 줄기세포로 구성되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To distinguish them from embryonic stem cells, the remaining stem cells are called adult stem cells.
answer: 남아 있는 줄기세포를 배아줄기세포와 구분해 성체줄기세포라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They have to keep making new cells which is the reason why adult stem cells remain.
answer: 성체줄기세포가 남아 있는 이유는 새로운 세포를 계속 만들어야 하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, only when stem cells continue to produce normal cells, is our body is maintained.
answer: 그래서 줄기세포가 계속 보통세포를 만들어야 우리 몸이 유지된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sparsely located deep in the skin, for example, are skin stem cells.
answer: 피부의 예를 들자면, 피부줄기세포는 피부의 깊은 곳에 드문드문 존재한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the other hand, skin cells usually cover most of the skin.
answer: 반면 대부분의 피부는 보통 피부세포로 덮여 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the vicinity of the stem cells, there are many young skin cells just created from the stem cells.
answer: 줄기세포와 가까운 곳에는 줄기세포에서 막 생성된 어린 피부세포들이 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After dividing several times, the older skin cells are pushed up to the surface of the skin, keratinized, and fall off.
answer: 몇 차례 분열한 늙은 피부세포는 피부 겉으로 밀려 올라오고 각질화되어 떨어져 나간다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Quick repair of the damaged body is another reason adult stem cells exist.
answer: 성체줄기세포가 존재하는 또 다른 이유는 손상된 신체를 빨리 복구하기 위해서다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For example, new blood vessels are created, for example, when a blood vessel is blocked.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hidden here and there without doing anything normally, vascular stem cells start to make vascular cells, and newly created vascular cells are connected to each other to form blood vessels.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Thanks to the adult stem cells, even if the bones are broken or the flesh falls off, they are the reason that our body recovers to some extent.
answer: 뼈가 부러져도 혹은 살점이 떨어져 나가도 우리 몸이 어느 정도는 복구되는 이유는 바로 성체줄기세포 덕분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The number of cells decreases and the proportion of old cells increases because adult stem cells do not proliferate well.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As adult stem cells age, they also become unable to produce normal cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A if entering an aging society, the proportion of young cells in the tissue is low and the number of old cells increases.
answer: 조직 내 어린 세포의 비율은 낮고 늙은 세포는 늘어나 마치 고령사회에 진입한 것과 같아진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are cases where they do not disintegrate and even when dead cells increase, they remain like zombies.
answer: 심지어는 죽은 세포도 많아지는데 분해되어 없어지지 않고 좀비처럼 남아 있는 경우도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even after scarring, if a tissue has a lot of old cells, they lose their vitality and take longer to heal.
answer: 늙은 세포들이 많은 조직은 활력이 떨어지고 상처가 생겨도 회복되는 데 오래 걸린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Degenerative diseases that decrease muscle mass are frequent and damaged cartilage is not restored, or presbyopia occurs.
answer: 손상된 연골이 회복되지 않거나, 노안이 생기거나, 근육량이 줄어드는 퇴행성 질환이 빈발하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Just like encouraging childbirth and immigration to escape an aging society, it is only natural that the idea of using stem cells to treat degenerative diseases came to the fore front.
answer: 고령사회를 벗어나기 위해 출산과 이민을 장려하는 것처럼, 퇴행성 질환을 치료하기 위해 줄기세포를 이용하려는 생각을 가지게 된 것은 당연한 일이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The development of stem cell therapy begins in earnest, as we enter the 21st century and understand the existence of stem cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is mesenchymal stem cells that are actually being developed as cell therapy products, although embryonic stem cells derived from embryonic eggs have become famous thanks to Dr. Hwang Woo-seok.
answer: 황우석 박사 덕분에 발생란에서 유래한 배아줄기세포가 유명세를 탔지만, 실제로 세포치료제로 개발되는 것은 중간엽줄기세포다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To refer to parts other than the skin or internal organs, mesenchymal is the used term.
answer: 중간엽은 피부나 내장이 아닌 부분을 지칭하는 말이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When our body is born from an embryo, the part that becomes the blood vessels and intestines is called the endoderm, and the part that becomes the skin is called the ectoderm.
answer: 배아에서 우리 몸이 생겨날 때 피부가 되는 부분을 외배엽, 혈관과 내장이 되는 곳을 내배엽이라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The name mesenchymal comes from how the mesenchymal stem cells are derived from the mesoderm between the endodermal lobe and the ectoderm.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포는 내배엽과 외배엽 사이의 중배엽에서 유래하여 중간엽이라는 명칭이 붙게 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We often mean that we are in the middle lobe, when we say that we are gaining weight.
answer: 흔히 살이 찐다고 할 때 살이 바로 중간엽에 해당하는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, if appropriate conditions are met, they can be converted into bone, chondrocytes, or adipocytes while culturing mesenchymal stem cells in vitro.
answer: 실제로 시험관에서 중간엽줄기세포를 배양하면서 적당한 조건을 갖추어주면 뼈나 연골세포로 혹은 지방세포로 변환시킬 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Not only that, it finds the wounded area and changes into muscle cells or nerve cells in the body as needed when injected into a blood vessel.
answer: 뿐만 아니라 혈관으로 주입하면 상처 부위를 알아서 찾아가기도 하고, 필요에 따라 몸속에서 근육세포나 신경세포 등으로도 바뀐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They decrease with aging, but originally mesenchymal stem cells are evenly distributed throughout the body.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In reality, it is preferred to use a large syringe with a screw-shaped needle and collect it from the bone marrow of the pelvic bone, even if mesenchymal stem cells can be obtained from subcutaneous fat, placenta, or umbilical cord.
answer: 물론 피하지방이나 태반 혹은 탯줄에서도 중간엽줄기세포를 얻을 수 있지만, 현실적으로는 나사못 모양의 주사바늘이 달린 큰 주사기를 사용해 골반 뼈의 골수에서 채취해 사용하는 방법을 선호된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because to obtain the most bone marrow, it is a relatively safe way.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By removing small bone debris and other cells from the collected bone marrow fluid using a centrifuge, a mesenchymal stem cell concentrate can be obtained immediately.
answer: 채취된 골수액에서 원심분리기를 사용해 작은 뼈 부스러기와 다른 세포를 제거하면 바로 중간엽줄기세포 농축액을 얻을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When considering the diseases that they can treat, the therapeutic efficacy of mesenchymal stem cells is gradually being revealed through animal experiments and clinical trials.
answer: 동물실험이나 임상시험을 통해 중간엽줄기세포의 치료 효능이 점차 밝혀지고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The rate of mesenchymal stem cell therapy for regenerating heart muscle damaged by myocardial infarction is the highest among the clinical trials registered so far.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is natural to differentiate into cardiac muscle cells and repair damaged heart muscle due to the characteristics of mesenchymal stem cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Another high proportion of clinical trials is for the treatment of diabetes or liver cirrhosis.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through research it has been found that the mesenchymal stem cells’ ability to be transformed into cells that secrete insulin and that they have an effect on hepatic fibrosis.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포가 인슐린을 분비하는 세포로 변환될 수 있고 간섬유화에 효과가 있다는 사실이 연구를 통해 밝혀졌기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most are in clinical trials therefore mesenchymal stem cells are still being studied for treatment.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포는 아직 치료법을 연구 중이거나 대부분 임상시험 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Nevertheless, many hospitals in Korea that operate mesenchymal stem cells already.
answer: 그럼에도 불구하고 이미 국내에도 중간엽줄기세포를 시술하는 병원이 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In magazines and the Internet, it is easy to see advertisements about autologous stem cell therapy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The patient's own mesenchymal stem cells are isolated from the bone marrow and then injected into the lesion in most cases.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even if other cells are mixed, currently there is no medical problem in re-injecting the mesenchymal stem cell concentrate that have been separated by centrifugation in the treatment room, inside the hospital into the same patient.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because for use on the same patient, the extraction of bone marrow from a patient falls within the scope of medical practice of doctors.
