prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, autologous stem cell therapy providing hospitals are increasing, and they do not even realize exactly what they are providing.
answer: 때문에 알게 모르게 자가 줄기세포치료를 제공하는 병원도 늘어나고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ironically, stem cell therapy for impotence appears as a related search term when you search for stem cell treatment on a parent search portal site.
answer: 아이러니하게도 모 검색 포털사이트에서 줄기세포 치료를 검색하면 연관검색어로 발기부전 줄기세포 치료가 등장한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is no way to know whether stem cells are just a gimmick or truly have excellent therapeutic ability.
answer: 줄기세포의 탁월한 치료 능력인지 단순한 상술인지 알 길이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On Youtube, there are also advertisements for foreign hospital that say to regenerate the skin, that mesenchymal stem cells are injected into the skin.
answer: 유튜브에는 중간엽줄기세포를 피부에 주사해 피부를 재생시키는 시술을 한다는 외국의 병원 광고도 등장한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is unknown to what extent it is true, but the video shows the skin regeneration or hair growth effect close to rejuvenation.
answer: 회춘에 가까운 수준의 피부 재생이나 발모 효과를 영상으로 보여주지만 어디까지가 사실인지는 알 수 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It's frustrating, but there is no other way than to wait until the safety and efficacy are verified by waiting for the results of the clinical trial.
answer: 답답하지만 임상시험 결과를 기다려보고 안전성과 효능이 검정될 때까지 기다리는 수밖에는 다른 방법이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the amount is insufficient for treatment, such as muscular dystrophy or pneumonia, with systemic administration or intravenous administration.
answer: 그러나 근위축증이나 폐렴같이 전신에 투여해야 하거나 정맥을 통해 투여하여 치료하기에는 부족한 양이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2008, a treatment method was tried in the United States to restore the heart muscle necrotic due to myocardial infarction that directly injects stem cells into the damaged heart muscle.
answer: 심근경색으로 괴사된 심장근육을 회복시키기 위해서 손상된 심장 근육 근처에 직접 줄기세포를 주사하는 치료법이 2008년 미국에서 시도되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A catheter with a micro-injector was inserted into the heart and stem cells were treated inside the heart in that case.
answer: 그것도 미세주사기가 달린 카테터를 심장 속으로 넣어 심장 내부에서 줄기세포를 시술한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sufficient amounts of stem cells from the bone marrow were not possible to be obtained.
answer: 골수에서 충분한 양의 줄기세포를 얻을 수 없었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To see the effect of administering stem cells into the body or blood vessels, more than 10 million stem cells are needed.
answer: 전신이나 혈관 내에 줄기세포를 투여하여 효과를 보기 위해서는 1,000만 개 이상의 줄기세포가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, only after approval as a therapeutic agent can cultured mesenchymal stem cells be used.
answer: 그리고 배양된 중간엽줄기세포는 치료제로 허가를 받아야 사용할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They use a method that pretends that the cells are in the blood to proliferate the cells.
answer: 세포를 증식시키기 위해서는 세포가 혈액 속에 있는 것처럼 속이는 방법을 쓴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Commercially available bovine serum is used instead because human serum cannot be used.
answer: 사람의 혈청을 사용할 수는 없으므로 대신 상업적으로 판매되는 소의 혈청을 사용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mesenchymal stem cells divide and grow knowing that our body needs them when growth-promoting hormone is added.
answer: 여기에 성장 촉진 호르몬을 첨가하면 중간엽줄기세포는 우리 몸이 필요로 하는 줄 알고 분열하고 자란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through repeated culture, it is theoretically possible to obtain as many mesenchymal stem cells as needed for treatment.
answer: 이론적으로는 반복 배양을 통해 치료에 필요한 수만큼의 중간엽줄기세포를 얻을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are many areas to improve productivity as cultivation cost is also a problem.
answer: 배양 비용도 문제이고 생산성도 향상시켜야 할 부분이 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is also a developing cultivation method that does not use bovine serum.
answer: 소의 혈청을 사용하지 않는 배양 방법도 개발 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even a small amount of bovine serum many people are sensitive to therefore it should be used as an injection.
answer: 주사제로 사용해야 하는데, 소량의 소 혈청에도 민감하게 반응하는 사람도 많기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only mesenchymal stem cells should be isolated in order to finally use it as a therapeutic agent.
answer: 최종적으로 치료제로 사용하기 위해서 중간엽줄기세포만 분리해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because all the substances added for cultivation must be removed in order to inject it back into the human body.
answer: 사람의 몸에 다시 주입하기 위해서는 배양을 위해 첨가한 물질들을 모두 제거해야 하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Freeze preservative is required for cryopreservation of mesenchymal stem cells, and the complete removal of this freeze preservative is also needed.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포를 냉동 보관하기 위해서는 동결보존제가 필요한데, 이 동결보존제도 완전히 제거되어야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, it should be checked that during the cultivation process, cell transformation or bacterial contamination did not occur.
answer: 이외에도 배양 과정에서 세균의 오염이나 세포의 변형이 발생하지 않았는지도 확인해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For this reason, strict management of the manufacturing process as well as clinical trials is essential to store or cultivate mesenchymal stem cells and use them as cell therapy products.
answer: 이러한 이유로 중간엽줄기세포를 보관하거나 배양하여 세포치료제로 사용하려면 임상시험뿐만 아니라 제조 과정에 대한 엄격한 관리가 반드시 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, they must be separately approved as pharmaceuticals even if autologous mesenchymal stem cells are to be cultivated and used as therapeutics.
answer: 따라서 자가 유래 중간엽줄기세포라 하더라도 배양하여 치료제로 사용하려면 따로 의약품으로 허가를 받아야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Technology and facilities are needed to completely separate and cultivated mesenchymal stem cells from bone marrow extracted from the patient's body in order for mesenchymal stem cells to be used as therapeutic agent.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포가 치료제로 사용되기 위해서는 환자의 몸에서 추출된 골수에서 중간엽줄기세포를 완전히 분리하고 배양하는 기술과 시설이 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is also necessary to manufacture them into products after examining the cultivated cells.
answer: 배양된 세포를 검사하고 제품으로 제조하는 과정도 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mesenchymal stem cell therapy has entered the business area of biotech companies, in which strict manufacturing technology is required.
answer: 따라서 엄격한 제조기술이 요구되는 중간엽줄기세포 치료제가 바이오텍 기업의 사업 영역으로 들어오게 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the same time, so that the entire nation can use it as a safe treatment it is necessary to regulate the drug license.
answer: 동시에 안전한 치료제로 전 국민이 사용할 수 있도록 의약품 허가라는 규제가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Development as a treatment takes a long time as mesenchymal stem cells are new and did not exist before, but it is expected that the approval criteria that guarantee stability and efficacy as a treatment will take a considerable period of time to establish.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포가 이전에 존재하지 않던 새로운 것이라 치료제로의 개발도 오래 걸리지만, 안정성과 치료제로서의 효능을 담보하는 허가 기준을 정하는 데도 상당 기간이 소요될 것으로 예상된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reality is that autologous stem cells are being cultivated secretly in foreign countries where there are no regulations, and I don't know if it's because of the amazing therapeutic effect of stem cells or if it's premature expectations.
answer: 줄기세포의 놀라운 치료 효과 때문인지 혹은 섣부른 기대감인지 모르겠으나, 규제가 따로 없는 외국에서 암암리에 자가 줄기세포의 배양 시술을 하고 있는 것이 현실이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From wealthy seniors who vaguely believe that they are effective in preventing aging to patients suffering from intractable diseases that have only a treatment that relieves symptoms, there are people who experience stem cell procedures abroad.
answer: 증상을 완화시키는 수준의 치료법밖에 없는 난치성 질환으로 고생하는 환자부터 막연히 노화 방지에 효과가 있다고 믿는 부유층 노인까지 해외 줄기세포시술을 경험하는 사람들이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the United States, to receive treatment for muscular dystrophy or Parkinson's disease, there are many cases each year who go to Panama or China.
answer: 미국에서도 매년 파나마나 중국으로 가서 근위축증이나 파킨슨병을 치료받는 케이스가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even though there are many criticizing comments saying that he only spent money, there are publicity videos circulating on the Internet saying that he has improved after treatment.
answer: 치료 후 호전되었다는 홍보성 동영상이 인터넷에 돌아다니지만, 돈만 쓰고 말았다는 비난성 댓글도 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In our country, there are also domestic companies that actually operate cultured mesenchymal stem cells and set up stem cell storage banks in Japan or China.
answer: 우리나라에도 일본이나 중국에 줄기세포 보관은행을 세워놓고 실제로는 배양된 중간엽줄기세포를 시술하는 국내 업체도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is difficult to understand how effective it is or what disease it can be applied to since it is conducted without a systematic clinical trial.
answer: 체계적인 임상시험 없이 진행되기 때문에, 어느 정도 효과가 있는지 혹은 어떤 질환에 적용할 수 있는지 잘 파악하기가 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is said that the cultivation process or the clinically necessary amount is unclear, the side effects are severe, and the cost is considerable.
answer: 비용도 상당하고 배양 과정이나 임상적으로 필요한 양을 시술하는지도 불분명하고 부작용도 심하다고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is also worrisome that there is a large-scale storage of Korean stem cells abroad.
answer: 더구나 해외에 우리나라 사람의 줄기세포가 대규모로 보관되고 있는 것 자체도 우려스럽다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because there is a risk that the stored stem cells with the records of those who have undergone the procedure will be sold.
answer: 보관된 줄기세포가 시술받은 사람들의 기록과 함께 통째로 팔릴 위험성이 존재하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Except for some countries with poor medical conditions, clinical trials are being conducted mainly in hospitals in most countries.
answer: 의료 환경이 열악한 일부 국가를 제외한 대부분의 국가에서 병원을 중심으로 임상시험이 진행되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The cumulative number of clinical trials using mesenchymal stem cells already exceeded 600 in mid-2015, according to the clinical trial information database operated by the National Institutes of Health of the United States.
answer: 미국 국립보건원이 운영하는 임상시험정보 데이터베이스에 따르면 중간엽줄기세포를 사용하는 임상시험 누적 건수는 2015년 중반에 이미 600건을 넘겼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 46 clinical trials are underway in Korea which are following the 49 cases in the Middle East, 128 cases in the United States, 108 cases in China and 146 cases in Europe.
answer: 유럽 146건, 미국 128건, 중국 108건, 중동국가 49건에 이어 국내에서도 46건의 임상시험이 진행되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cultivating autologous stem cells and using them as therapeutics accounts for about 70% of these are clinical trials.
answer: 이 가운데 70% 정도가 자가 유래 줄기세포를 배양하여 치료제로 사용하기 위한 임상시험이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Korea, with approval from the Food and Drug Administration, starting with Pharmicell's Heartycelgram in 2011, Antrogen's Cupistem and Quincel, and Corestem's Neuronataal, a treatment for Lou Gehrig's disease, are already being sold.
answer: 국내에서는 이미 2011년에 파미셀의 하티셀그램을 시작으로 안트로젠의 큐피스템과 퀸셀 그리고 코아스템의 루게릭병 치료제인 뉴로나타알이 식약청의 허가를 받아 판매되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hearty Cellgram, which helps to repair heart muscle damaged by myocardial infarction, is a cultivation of bone marrow-derived autologous stem cells.
answer: 하티셀그램은 골수 유래 자가줄기세포를 배양한 것으로, 심근경색으로 손상된 심장근육을 복구하는 데 도움을 준다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, clinical trials for various treatable diseases, including cerebral infarction, are being conducted by Hearty Cellgram.
answer: 이외에 하티셀그램은 뇌경색을 비롯한 치료 가능한 여러 질환에 대한 임상시험을 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By culturing mesenchymal stem cells obtained from subcutaneous fat, Cupistem was approved as a treatment for Crohn's fistula.
answer: 큐피스템은 피하지방에서 얻은 중간엽줄기세포를 배양하여 크론성 누공치료제로 허가받았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is necessary to visit a hospital in advance to collect stem cells since all of these products are autologous cell therapy products.
answer: 이 제품들은 모두 자가 유래 세포치료제이기 때문에 미리 병원을 방문하여 줄기세포를 채취해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After about a month is when the actual stem cell therapy takes place.
answer: 실제 줄기세포 치료는 약 한 달 후에 이루어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because by culturing them in external organs it takes time to proliferate cells as much as necessary for treatment.
answer: 주로 외부기관에서 배양하여 치료에 필요한 만큼 세포를 증식시키는 데 시간이 걸리기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Also, because living cells are the main component of the treatment it is difficult to store.
answer: 또 살아 있는 세포가 치료제의 주성분이기 때문에 보관도 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Within 36 hours of manufacture is when Hearty Cellgrams must be used.
answer: 하티셀그램은 제조 후 36시간 내에 사용해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A limitation for them is that the date of manufacture determines the date of treatment.
answer: 따라서 제조일에 맞추어 치료받는 날짜를 정해야 하는 제한도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. in 2014, Neuronataal was approved by the Food and Drug Administration as a cell therapy for ALS.
answer: 뉴로나타알은 2014년에 루게릭병을 적응증으로 식약청으로부터 세포 치료제로 허가를 받았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Well-known as the disease of the world-famous astrophysicist Stephen Hawking, Lou Gehrig's disease is a disease in which motor neurons are damaged, eventually leading to muscle degeneration and death.
answer: 세계적인 천체물리학자인 스티븐 호킹이 걸린 병으로 잘 알려진 루게릭병은 운동신경세포가 손상되어 결국에는 근육이 퇴화되어 사망하는 병이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are thousands of patients with Cron star fistula.
answer: 크론성 누공 환자는 몇 천 명 수준이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hearty Cellgram also has a complicated limitation of onset of chest pain and were reperfused with acute myocardial infarction patients who underwent coronary angioplasty within 72 hours.
answer: 하티셀그램도 흉통 발현 후 72시간 이내에 관상동맥 성형술을 시행하여 재관류된 급성심근경색 환자라는 복잡한 제한 조건을 가지고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For diseases that are still difficult to treat with conventional drugs, this is because stem cell therapy has been approved.
answer: 아직까지는 기존의 약으로 치료하기 어려운 질환을 대상으로 줄기세포 치료제가 허가되었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For bio ventures that develop stem cell therapy there are high expectations.
answer: 줄기세포 치료제를 개발한 바이오벤처에 대한 기대도 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. One of the stem cell therapy characteristics is that they have a wide range of indications, which is a reason for this expectation.
answer: 그 이유로 줄기세포 치료제의 특성 중의 하나가 적응증이 넓다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is expected to cover various immune diseases and degenerative diseases, and even cosmetic treatments such as removing scars, promoting hair growth, and treating burns.
answer: 각종 퇴행성 질환이나 면역질환을 망라하는 것은 물론이고, 심지어는 발모 촉진이나 화상 치료, 흉터 제거 같은 미용 치료까지 가능할 것으로 예상되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, to reconstruct intractable burns which had limitations with surgical procedures, Heartycelgram, a treatment for myocardial infarction, was used.
answer: 실제로 심근경색 치료제인 하티셀그램은 외과적 수술로는 한계가 있는 난치성 화상 재건에 사용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As the right to treatment and prescription are the sole authority of the doctor, it is safe to use Hearty Cellgram for burn treatment.
answer: 진료권과 처방권은 의사의 고유 권한이므로 하티셀그램을 화상 치료에 사용해도 무방하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. if an indication that can be treated with stem cell therapy increase one by one, and it will take time, but the market will naturally expand.
answer: 시간은 걸리겠지만 줄기세포 치료제로 치료할 수 있는 적응증이 하나하나 늘어나게 되면 자연스럽게 시장도 확대될 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Just because the indications are different, there is no need to develop new stem cell therapy.
answer: 적응증이 다르다고 줄기세포 치료제를 새로 개발할 필요는 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The manufacturing method for stem cell therapy is the same and the component of the treatment is only one stem cells, although the manufacturing methods and facilities for cold medicines and digestive medicines are different.
answer: 감기약이나 소화제는 제조하는 방법이나 시설이 다르지만, 줄기세포 치료제는 제조하는 방법도 동일하고 치료제의 성분도 줄기세포 한 가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, a business that has a big advantage as a leading company is stem cell therapy.
answer: 그래서 줄기세포 치료제는 선두기업의 장점이 큰 사업이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is difficult for latecomers to follow, if you develop a hospital business while accumulating know-how and also are equipping a batch process from stem cells harvesting, cultivation, manufacturing and supply of therapeutic agents.
answer: 줄기세포의 채취, 배양, 치료제 제조 및 공급까지 일괄 공정을 갖추면서 노하우를 쌓아가며 병원사업을 개척하면, 후발기업은 따라오기 어려운 구조다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We can easily expand our business to the heterologous stem cell market, based on our experience in manufacturing and hospital marketing, using donor stem cells.
answer: 제조 및 병원 마케팅의 경험을 바탕으로 공여자의 줄기세포를 사용하는 타가 줄기세포 시장으로도 용이하게 사업을 확장할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cellontech's autologous cartilage cells treatment, the Condrone, was marketed with approval from the Food and Drug Administration in 2001, but that was before stem cell therapy appeared.
answer: 줄기세포 치료제가 등장하기 이전인 2001년 셀론텍의 자가연골세포 치료제인 콘드론이 식약청의 허가를 받아 시판되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was the first cell therapy in our country and it was a groundbreaking product at the time, but in the medical market it did not have much success.
answer: 당시로서는 획기적인 제품이었고 우리나라 최초의 세포 치료제였지만 의료시장에서는 크게 성공을 거두지 못했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It’s cost grew to nearly 10 million won in the complicated process of testing at the hospital, collecting chondrocytes, cultivation outside, and performing the surgical procedure again at the hospital which is what caught Condrone’s ankle.
answer: 병원에서 검사하고, 연골세포를 채취하고, 외부에서 배양하고, 다시 병원에서 시술하는 복잡한 과정에서 발생하는 1,000만 원에 가까운 비용이 콘드론의 발목을 잡은 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An appropriate positioning marketing strategy is needed since cell therapy is also a product.
answer: 세포 치료제도 상품이니 만큼 적절한 포지셔닝 마케팅 전략이 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From various joint injections that require tens of thousands of dollars, antibody treatments that cost hundreds of thousands of won, and artificial joint surgery costing millions of won there are various treatments for joint diseases out there.
answer: 관절 질환에는 몇 만 원하는 각종 관절주사부터 수십만 원의 항체 치료제를 비롯하여 수백만 원이 드는 인공관절 수술까지 다양한 치료법이 존재하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Tegoscience also released cell therapy for burn treatment, but due to the inconveniences of having to go through a procedure that separates autologous cells, waiting during the cultivation period and the resulting high cost, the number of surgical procedure was not as high as expected.
answer: 테고사이언스도 화상치료용 세포 치료제를 출시했지만 모두 자가 세포를 분리하는 시술을 거쳐야 하고 배양 기간 동안 기다려야 하는 불편함과 이에 따른 고비용 때문에 시술 건수가 예상보다 높지 않았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It may not be easy to expand the market, even for autologous stem cell therapy, due to the cost of cultivation and hospital testing and treatment.
answer: 자가 줄기세포 치료제의 경우에도 배양 및 병원에서의 검사와 처치 비용 때문에 시장 확대가 쉽지 않을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Autologous stem cell therapy is likely to be commercially viable for the time being, as it is limited to incurable diseases that have high cost-effective treatment or no other treatment.
answer: 따라서 당분간은 특별히 비용 대비 치료 효과가 높거나 다른 치료법이 없는 난치성 질환인 경우에 한정되어 자가 줄기세포 치료제가 사업적으로 가능할 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In spite of that, clinical practice reports of incurable diseases that cannot be treated with drugs using mesenchymal stem cell therapy are increasing.
answer: 그러나 약으로는 치료할 수 없는 난치성 질환을 중간엽줄기세포 치료제를 사용해 치료한 임상보고가 증가하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, we cannot underestimate the potential of autologous stem cell therapies.
answer: 때문에 자가 줄기세포 치료제의 잠재력을 과소평가할 수는 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using mesenchymal stem cells may open a path of treatment for degenerative neurological disease known to us as dementia.
answer: 우리에게 치매로 알려진 퇴행성 신경질환도 중간엽줄기세포를 이용해 치료할 수 있는 길이 열릴 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Recently in preclinical examination studies using mice, a number of research papers have been published that mesenchymal stem cells are effective in reducing memory associated with neurodegenerative diseases.
answer: 실험쥐를 이용한 전임상시험에서 퇴행성 신경질환과 연관된 기억력 감소에 중간엽줄기세포가 효과가 있다는 연구논문이 최근 많이 발표되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since it has been found that at the same time stem cells are secreting hormones that promote nerve cell activity, stem cells also play a role in differentiating or protecting nerve cells.
answer: 줄기세포가 신경세포로 분화하거나 보호하는 역할을 하고 동시에 신경세포의 활성을 촉진시키는 호르몬을 분비하기 때문인 것으로 밝혀졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The development of treatment is slow in the United States, a developed country for new drugs, even though there is a lot of scientific data that mesenchymal stem cells are supposed to be effective in degenerative neurological diseases such as Parkinson's disease and Alzheimer's dementia.
answer: 중간엽줄기세포가 파킨슨병이나 알츠하이머성 치매 같은 퇴행성 신경질환에 당연히 효과가 있을 것으로 판단되는 과학적인 자료가 많음에도 불구하고 정작 신약 선진국인 미국에서는 치료제 개발이 느린 편이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2014, a phase 1 clinical trial was completed as a safety examination of autologous stem cell therapy administered to patients with neurodegenerative diseases in the United States.
answer: 미국 내에서는 자가 줄기세포 치료제를 퇴행성 신경질환 환자에게 투여했을 때 안정성을 검사하는 임상 1상이 2014년 완료되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even if it takes time, due to the nature of the United States healthcare system to adhere to the principle of confirming safety and efficacy, this is thought to be to avoid the risk of medical litigation that may arise.
answer: 시간이 걸리더라도 안전성과 효능을 확인하는 원칙을 고수하고, 만일에 발생할 수 있는 의료 소송의 위험성을 회피하려는 미국 의료 시스템의 속성 때문이라고 생각된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is not uncommon for Americans to receive treatment by going on stem cell tourism to neighboring countries of the United States like Costa Rica or Panama.

answer: 그리고 이식편대숙주병 외에도 크론병, 1형 당뇨, 심근경색, 골관절염 및 뼈 재생 분야로 적응증을 확대하는 15건의 임상시험을 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In our country, Medipost’s Cartistem is another person’s stem cell treatment, along with other mesenchymal stem cells therapies that are approved and used.
answer: 우리나라에서도 타인 중간엽줄기세포 치료제가 허가되어 사용되고 있는데, 메디포스트의 카티스템이 바로 타인 줄기세포 치료제이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To treat a defect in the cartilage of the knee, cord blood-derived mesenchymal stem cells are used in osteoarthritis patients.
answer: 제대혈 유래의 중간엽줄기세포를 사용하는데, 골관절염 환자의 무릎연골결손 치료제이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a treatment that directly transplants mesenchymal stem cells through a treatment equivalent to surgery into the cartilage area of the incised knee. Long-term follow-up clinical practice results were recently, announced to be excellent.
answer: 수술에 준하는 처치를 통해 절개된 무릎의 연골 부위에 직접 중간엽줄기세포를 이식하는 치료법으로 최근 장기 추적 임상 결과도 탁월한 것으로 발표되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To cultivate the 10 million or 100 million mesenchymal stem cells required, 10 to 100 Petri dishes are needed for use as therapeutics.
answer: 치료제로 사용하는 데 필요한 1,000만 개 혹은 1억 개의 중간엽줄기세포를 배양하려면 배양접시가 10개에서 100개가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mass production using cultivation dishes is not realistic when the number of patients increases.
answer: 환자가 많아지면 배양접시를 사용해 대량생산하는 방법은 현실적이지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, several bio ventures are attempting the development of technology to mass-proliferate mesenchymal stem cells.
answer: 그래서 중간엽줄기세포를 대량 증식하는 기술 개발도 현재 여러 바이오벤처에 의해 시도되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Currently, the used methods of proliferating mesenchymal stem cells are by using microbeads called microcarriers or multi-layered cultivation dishes like apartments.
answer: 아파트처럼 여러 층의 배양접시를 사용하거나 마이크로케리어라는 미세 구슬에 부착한 상태로 중간엽줄기세포를 증식시키는 방법이 현재 사용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. various mass cultivation methods are in development that can be industrialized, and they are also studying mesenchymal stem cells that grow in a non-adherent state.
answer: 이외에도 공업화가 가능한 다양한 대량 배양 방법이 개발되고 있으며 아예 부착하지 않은 상태로 자라는 중간엽줄기세포도 연구되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Autologous mesenchymal stem cells therapy and stem cell therapy from other people are still both quite expensive.
answer: 타인 줄기세포 치료제도 아직은 자가 중간엽줄기세포 치료만큼 비싸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is a high possibility products that can be used as therapeutic agents can be developed from other stem cell therapies.
answer: 그래서 타인 줄기세포 치료제가 바로 현실적으로 치료제로서 사용할 수 있는 제품으로 발전할 수 있는 가능성이 가장 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only when bio-new technology is added, cosmetics seem to gain popularity, just as food needs to be seasoned in moderation.
answer: 양념이 적당히 있어야 음식이 완성되듯이 화장품도 바이오신기술이 첨가되어야 인기를 끄는 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So they do not tell in detail how they are different from existing cosmetics, rather just advertise as bio cosmetics.
answer: 그래서 바이오화장품이라고 내세워 광고하지만 기존의 화장품과 어떻게 다른지는 자세하게 알려주지 않는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The worrisome advertisements are those that contain a mixture of bio-new technology and mysticism.
answer: 바이오신기술과 신비주의가 반반씩 섞여 있는 광고 카피가 우려스러울 때가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. How medicinal herbs or herbal extracts can improve skin condition is hard to understand.
answer: 약초나 허브 추출물이 어떻게 피부 컨디션을 좋게 만드는지 이해하기가 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The marketing strategy that grafts the technology of making alcohol, soybean paste, and soy sauce called fermentation, into cosmetics is surprising.
answer: 술이나 된장, 간장을 만드는 기술인 발효를 화장품에 접목시키는 마케팅 전략이 놀라울 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Stem cells cosmetics do not contain stem cells, just as there is no crucian carp in bungeoppang.
answer: 붕어빵에 붕어가 없듯이 줄기세포 화장품에는 줄기세포가 들어 있지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The rhetoric, which has been overused and has long since faded, that leads to whitening, moisturizing, antioxidant, wrinkle improvement, collagen production, skin regeneration, and anti-aging, which appears regularly in cosmetic advertisements.
answer: 화장품 광고 문구에 단골로 등장하는 미백부터 보습, 항산화제, 주름 개선, 콜라겐 생성, 피부 재생, 노화 방지로 이어지는 미사여구는 너무 남용해서 이제는 빛이 바랜 지 오래다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Perhaps the stem cells cultivation which is effective in skin regeneration or anti-aging epithelial cell growth factor is included in the appearance of the descent.
answer: 아마도 피부 재생이나 노화 방지에 효과가 있다는 상피세포성장인자나 줄기세포 배양물이 포함되었다는 정도는 되어야 지름신이 강림하는 모양이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through advertisements or word of mouth manufacturer's claims win the hearts of consumers.
answer: 제조사의 주장이 광고로 혹은 입소문으로 소비자의 마음을 사로잡는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unlike pharmaceuticals, cosmetics do not have a system that permits sales and verifies the efficacy.
answer: 화장품은 의약품처럼 효능을 검증하고 판매를 허가해 주는 제도가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Also, objectively revealing the efficacy is reflected in the price of the product and often incurs a lot of cost.
answer: 뿐만 아니라 객관적으로 효능을 밝히는 데는 많은 비용이 발생하고 제품의 가격에도 반영된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is only a limited functions certification system for whitening, moisturizing, and wrinkle improvement in our country.
answer: 때문에 우리나라에서는 미백, 보습, 주름 개선의 제한된 기능에 대한 인증제도만 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Scientific evidence for skin regeneration and anti-aging has increased with the development of bio-new technology.
answer: 바이오신기술의 발전으로 피부 재생이나 노화 방지에 관한 과학적인 증거가 많아졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The functions of protecting the skin and preventing aging are also emphasized now in Cosmetics advertisements, not only makeup anymore.
answer: 화장품 광고도 화장뿐만 아니라 피부를 보호하고 노화를 방지하는 기능을 강조하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cosmetics that cover the skin and make it look beautiful are much more sparse than the ones that treat and rejuvenate the skin.
answer: 피부를 덮어 예쁘게 보이게 만드는 화장품보다 피부를 치료하고 젊게 만드는 화장품의 종류가 많이 늘어났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For pharmaceuticals and cosmetics with proven efficacy to treat the skin, now seems to be their time.
answer: 이제는 피부를 치료하는 효능이 검증된 의약품 겸 화장품이 등장할 때가 된 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is not as strict as pharmaceuticals, but it is a time when we need a 'beauty drug' that can scientifically confirm its efficacy to apply, that requires minimal clinical trials.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In functional cosmetics commercials, antioxidants are the most popular topic.
answer: 항산화제는 기능성 화장품 광고에 가장 많이 등장하는 주제다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because, the culprit of skin aging is not age, found through dermatological research, but ultraviolet rays and free oxygen.
answer: 피부과학 연구를 통해 피부 노화의 범인은 세월이 아니라 자외선과 활성산소라는 것을 밝혀내었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So antioxidants that remove free oxygen are widely used also in edible functional foods, not only in functional cosmetics.
answer: 그래서 활성산소를 제거한다는 항산화제는 기능성 화장품뿐만 아니라 먹는 기능성 식품에도 많이 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From the well-known Vitamins C and E to tocopherol, Green tea extract, Coenzyme Q, Kirkcummin, and Resverastole, there are many types of antioxidants.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They cannot fundamentally prevent the formation of free oxygen in cells, but the free radicals that have already been created can be removed with antioxidants.
answer: 이미 만들어진 활성산소는 항산화제로 제거할 수 있지만, 세포에서 활성산소가 생기는 것은 근본적으로 막지 못한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because when cells breathe to sustain life reactive oxygen species are always generated.
answer: 활성산소는 세포가 생명을 유지하기 위해 호흡을 하면 항상 발생하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To prevent skin aging from free oxygen, skin science research is still ongoing.
answer: 활성산소로부터 피부 노화를 막기 위한 피부과학 연구는 지금도 계속되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition to antioxidants, to develop extracts and find effects such as anti-aging, skin whitening, and wrinkle improvement from natural products such as herbs and plants, there are cosmetic companies that are in charge of supplying raw materials for functional cosmetics.
answer: 항산화제뿐만 아니라 허브나 식물 같은 천연물에서 항노화, 피부 미백, 주름 개선 등의 효능을 찾아내고 추출물을 개발하는 기능성 화장품의 원료 공급을 담당하는 화장품회사도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The traditional method of squeezing or drying herbs or plants and boiling them is the method mainly used, but to confirm their efficacy bio-new technology is used.
answer: 추출물은 주로 허브나 식물을 쥐어짜거나 건조시켜 끓여내는 전통적인 방법을 사용하지만, 그 효능을 확인하는 데 바이오신기술이 활용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Companies that have more researchers than production workers are not uncommon.
answer: 그래서 생산인력보다 연구원의 수가 더 많은 회사도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because, development and research are carried out in parallel to discover the efficacy of extracts that by cultivating pigment cells that make melanin produce a whitening effect.
answer: 예를 들자면 멜라닌을 만드는 색소 세포를 배양하여 미백 효과를 내는 추출물의 효능을 찾아내는 것 같은 연구 개발을 병행하기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bio-new technology is mobilized to find extracts that make epidermal cells at the ends of the skin grow well, or collagen synthesizing fibroblasts.
answer: 콜라겐을 합성하는 섬유아세포나 피부 말단의 표피세포를 잘 자라게 만드는 추출물을 찾아내기 위해서 최첨단의 바이오신기술이 동원된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It also studies whether each skin cell is aging or inflammation occurs, by isolating genes or proteins.
answer: 유전자나 단백질을 분리해 각각의 피부세포가 노화되는지 혹은 염증이 발생했는지도 연구한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The creation of a cosmetic bio venture that verifies the functionality and studies the skin improvement effect was founded with this background in mind.
answer: 기능성을 검증하고 피부 개선 효과를 연구하는 화장품 바이오벤처가 생겨나게 된 배경이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is also a bio venture that goes one step further and studies the skin improvement effect at the level of new drug development beyond the level of efficacy verification with bio-new technology.
answer: 한 걸음 더 나아가 효능 검증의 수준을 넘어 신약 개발 수준의 바이오신기술로 피부 개선 효과를 연구하는 바이오벤처도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are also bio ventures which naturally take a step towards the development of new drugs related to skin diseases such as atopy or hair loss that are in the middle between cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.
answer: 자연스럽게 아토피와 같은 피부질환 혹은 탈모 관련 신약 개발에 한 발을 내딛는, 화장품과 의약품의 중간에 포진한 바이오벤처도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After the venture boom in 2000, bio ventures that belong to the cosmetics industry ecosystems have been created one by one.
answer: 화장품산업 생태계에 속한 바이오벤처는 2000년 벤처붐 이후에 하나 둘씩 생겨났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cosmetic bio ventures business areas vary from skin research and efficacy analysis to R&D and contract production of functional ingredients, but they are mainly in charge of functional ingredients.
answer: 화장품 바이오벤처는 주로 기능성 원료를 담당하지만, 사업영역은 피부 연구와 효능 분석부터 기능성 원료의 연구개발 및 계약 생산 단계까지 다양하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The proportion they occupy in the cosmetic industry ecosystems cannot be said to be small although the number of cosmetic bio ventures is not large.
answer: 화장품 바이오벤처의 수가 많지는 않지만 화장품산업 생태계에서 차지하는 비중은 결코 작다고 할 수 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, to generate sales, there is a limit in that brand cosmetics companies must purchase in raw materials.
answer: 그러나 브랜드 화장품회사가 원료를 사주어야 매출이 발생한다는 한계가 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. That goes to say then, that the sales of functional raw materials, which are subsidiary materials, are inevitably lower.
answer: 따라서 부재료인 기능성 원료의 매출은 더 낮을 수밖에 없는 구조다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For promotional purposes to tempt consumers, functional ingredients added as much as eye mucus are also actively used.
answer: 눈곱만큼 첨가되는 기능성 원료는 소비자를 유혹하는 홍보용으로 적극 활용되기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In order to increase the appearance because sales are small with only functional ingredients added in small amounts, there are many bio ventures that produce and sell finished cosmetics.
answer: 소량씩 첨가되는 기능성 원료만으로는 매출이 작기 때문에 외형을 키우기 위해 완제 화장품을 생산 판매하는 바이오벤처도 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Compared to the distribution scale of brand cosmetics companies, there are many cases where there are difficulties in distribution and sales, and the production level is often at the level of prototypes.
answer: 그렇지만 브랜드 화장품회사의 유통 규모에 비해 시제품 생산 수준인 경우가 많고 유통·판매 부분에서 어려움을 겪는 경우가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bioland, ACT, Dami Chemical, Biospectrum, Biogenics, Natural Solution, and Radian are the companies that manufacture and supply functional raw materials from plant extracts.
answer: 식물 추출물에서 기능성 원료를 제조·공급하는 기업으로는 바이오랜드, 에이씨티, 다미화학, 바이오스펙트럼, 바이오제닉스, 내추럴솔루션, 래디안 등이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, there are a number of bio ventures specializing in special materials , that develop cosmetic raw materials.
answer: 이외에 특수한 소재를 전문으로 화장품 원료를 개발하는 바이오벤처도 다수 존재한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is somewhat bizarre, but from placental extracts to snail mucus or DNA extracted from salmon testicle, various raw materials are used as cosmetic ingredients.
answer: 다소 엽기적이지만 태반 추출물부터 달팽이 점액이나 연어의 정소에서 추출한 DNA까지 다양한 원료가 화장품 원료로 사용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. High proportion of sales, promotion, and advertising expenses go into cosmetics.
answer: 화장품은 판매 및 판촉비나 광고비 비중이 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The market scale of cosmetic raw materials is inevitably limited since the proportion of manufacturing cost is not high.
answer: 제조원가의 비중은 높지 않기 때문에 화장품 원료의 시장 규모는 한정적일 수밖에 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the cosmetic raw materials sales scale, except for Bioland, do not exceed 10 billion won.
answer: 바이오랜드를 제외하면 화장품 원료 매출 규모는 100억 원을 넘지 않는 경우가 대부분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The price of the product might increase by more than 100 times, which is the value of functional additives added in small amounts.
answer: 소량 첨가된 기능성 첨가물의 가치가 제품의 가격을 100배 이상 올릴 수도 있다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is bitter that bio-new technology is not being treated as much as it deserves because of course, this would be possible with the brand power of the best cosmetics company and huge advertising investment.
answer: 물론 최고의 화장품 회사가 가진 브랜드 파워와 막대한 광고 투자로 가능한 일이겠지만, 바이오신기술이 그 가치만큼 대우받지 못하는 것 같아 씁쓸하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, there is a lot of information or advertisements that highlight their comparative advantage with other products or stimulate consumers' desire to purchase.
answer: 그래서 소비자의 구매욕을 자극하거나 타 상품과의 비교우위를 돋보이게 해주는 정보나 광고가 난무한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is often that the content of scientific data advertised is unfamiliar or complex, contrarily.
answer: 반면 광고되는 과학적인 자료의 내용은 생소하거나 복잡한 경우도 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, scientific evidence is transformed into vague new words or sensational advertisements, such as skin regeneration and anti-aging.
answer: 때문에 피부 재생이나 노화 방지와 같은 과학적인 증거도 애매모호한 신조어나 감각적인 광고로 변신하여 등장한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The cosmetics industry ecosystems are complexly composed of companies specializing in the development and manufacturing or planning and distribution of cosmetics, aesthetics, beauty salons, and even advertisements and broadcasting fields, and also research institutes and dermatology hospitals that research dermatology.
answer: 그래서 화장품 산업 생태계는 피부과학을 연구하는 연구소나 피부과 병원부터, 화장품의 개발 및 제조 혹은 기획 및 유통을 전문으로 하는 기업과 에스테틱, 피부미용실 심지어는 광고나 방송 분야까지 복잡하게 구성되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Large brand cosmetics companies are one of the strongest players in the cosmetics industry ecosystems.
answer: 화장품산업 생태계의 최강자는 대형 브랜드 화장품 회사다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In order to reign at the top of the ecosystems, they continue to grow in size through mergers and acquisitions and pursue globalization of their distribution and sales networks.
answer: 그들은 생태계의 최상위에 군림하기 위해 인수 합병을 통해 계속 몸집을 키우고 유통판매망의 글로벌화를 추구하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cosmetic biotech companies are likely to coexist as satellites orbiting around them as brand cosmetics companies are getting bigger and bigger.
answer: 브랜드 화장품 회사의 규모는 점점 거대해지고 화장품 바이오텍 기업은 그 주변을 도는 위성 같은 존재로 공존하게 될 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is difficult to monopolize technology through patents like pharmaceuticals, even for functional cosmetics raw materials.
answer: 기능성 화장품 원료라 하더라도 의약품처럼 특허를 통한 기술 독점은 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Patents with high exclusivity such as material patents cannot be obtained, because most substances already exist in the natural world.
answer: 대부분 자연계에 이미 존재하는 물질이므로 물질 특허 같은 배타성이 높은 특허를 가질 수 없기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unlike pharmaceuticals, they do not require licenses and therefore have relatively low entry barriers which is the reason why bio ventures with domestic technology are entering the cosmetics industry.
answer: 국내의 기술력 있는 바이오벤처가 화장품산업에 발을 들이는 이유는, 의약품처럼 인허가가 불필요하므로 비교적 진입장벽이 낮기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The idea is to increase sales to have an appearance as a company, even if it is often the case that a business is run by making finished cosmetics.
answer: 완제화장품을 만들어 사업을 하는 경우도 빈번한데, 매출을 키워서 기업으로서의 외형을 갖추자는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For new drug development bio ventures that have already entered the KOSDAQ, it is not uncommon for them to develop and sell finished cosmetics with a cosmetics division.
answer: 이미 코스닥에 진입한 신약 개발 바이오벤처도 화장품 사업부를 두고 완제화장품을 개발해 판매하는 경우도 비일비재하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to the cosmetic Korean wave, fortunately, OEM/ODM companies and cosmetic bio ventures, not only brand cosmetics companies, are seeing a trickle-down effect.
answer: 다행스럽게도 화장품 한류의 열풍으로 브랜드 화장품 회사뿐만 아니라 OEM/ODM 회사와 화장품 바이오벤처도 낙수 효과를 보고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The cosmetics industry ecosystems must be strong, for the cosmetics Korean wave to continue.
answer: 화장품 한류가 지속되기 위해서는 화장품산업 생태계가 튼튼해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Diversity is essential in the ecosystems of the cosmetic industry, just as diversity is the most important thing in the ecosystems of nature.
answer: 자연의 생태계에서 가장 중요한 것이 다양성인 것처럼 화장품산업 생태계에서도 다양성이 필수적이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Among them, with bio-new technology, by continuously developing new functional materials and business models, bio ventures are the leading edge in expanding the cosmetics industry ecosystems.
answer: 그 중에서도 바이오신기술로 새로운 기능성 소재나 비즈니스 모델을 계속 개발하여 화장품산업 생태계의 영역을 넓혀가는 첨병이 바로 바이오벤처다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To stimulate growth of epidermal cells as well as epithelial cells of the skin they use EGF.
answer: EGF는 상피세포뿐만 아니라 피부의 표피세포도 자라게 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Old cells are pushed to the surface of the skin and keratinize and disappear when EGF causes new cells to grow in the lower layers of the skin.
answer: EGF는 피부의 아래층에서 새로운 세포를 자라게 하고, 오래된 세포는 피부의 표면으로 밀려올라와 각질화되어 없어지게 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Less EGF is produced with age just as with other hormones.
answer: 다른 호르몬처럼 나이가 들면 EGF도 적게 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The proportion of old cells increases, as in an aging society, and the skin tone becomes dark and dull.
answer: 마치 노령사회처럼 오래된 세포의 비율이 높아져 피부 톤이 어둡고 칙칙해진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. EGF is made in that area when there is a wound on the skin, and the skin cells grow faster.
answer: 피부에 상처가 생기면 그 부위에서 EGF가 만들어져 피부세포를 빨리 자라게 만드는데 나이가 들면 상처가 아무는데 시간이 걸리는 것도 EGF가 적게 만들어지기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For this reason, in medical burn treatment creams, EGF was originally used as the main ingredient.
answer: 이런 이유로 EGF는 원래 의료용 화상치료크림의 주성분으로 사용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Iceland is the country that became famous not only for EGF cosmetics but also for custom medicines through genetic analysis for the first time perhaps because the DNA of the Vikings who enjoyed adventures while sailing in the cold Arctic Ocean remains.
answer: 차가운 북극해를 항해하며 모험을 즐기던 바이킹의 DNA가 남아 있기 때문인지, EGF 화장품뿐만 아니라 유전자 분석을 통해 맞춤의약을 최초로 추진해서 유명해진 나라도 바로 아이슬란드다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As they are the ancestors of most of today's Icelanders, the small number of Vikings who migrated before BC are a very genetically identical group.
answer: 기원전 이주한 소수의 바이킹이 현재 대부분의 아이슬란드인의 조상이기 때문에 유전적으로 매우 동일한 집단이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, it is possible to find a causal relationship with the disease, even by analyzing the genetic information of a small number of people.
answer: 따라서 적은 수의 사람들의 유전자 정보를 분석해도 질병과의 인과관계를 알아낼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Nevertheless, there are also accusations of them selling to a multinational pharmaceutical company, the genetic information of Icelanders.
answer: 그러나 아이슬란드 국민의 유전자 정보를 다국적 제약회사에 팔아버렸다는 비난을 동시에 받고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are also many voices warning about the dangers of EGF cosmetics as BioEffect's EGF serum is also evaluated by many to have the effect of rejuvenating the skin that was not experienced in existing functional cosmetics.
answer: 바이오이펙트의 EGF 세럼 역시 기존의 기능성 화장품에서 경험할 수 없던 피부를 회춘시키는 효능이 있다는 평가도 많지만, EGF 화장품의 위험성을 경고하는 목소리도 만만치 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It makes skin cells lively because EGF is a cell growth factor, but it can also make cancerous cells grow faster.
answer: EGF가 바로 세포성장인자이기 때문에 피부세포를 활기차게 만들기도 하지만 혹시 있을지 모르는 암세포를 빨리 자라게 할 수 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the cosmetics lines of large domestic companies EGF cosmetics appeared one after another.
answer: 국내 대기업의 화장품 라인에도 EGF 화장품이 속속 등장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Daewoong Pharmaceutical also developed EGF cosmetics in 2011, which originally launched EGF as a treatment for foot ulcers.
answer: 원래 족부궤양 치료제로 EGF를 출시한 대웅제약도 2011년에 EGF 화장품을 개발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The development and supplying of HGH for cosmetics is done by bio venture Regeron and BioFDNC.
answer: 바이오벤처인 리제론과 바이오에프디엔씨에서 화장품용 HGH을 개발하여 공급하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to stem cells proliferate and produce various types of cell growth factors as well as EGF and HGH, cosmetics containing stem cell cultures are also gaining popularity.
answer: 줄기세포 배양물을 첨가한 화장품도 인기를 끌고 있는데, 줄기세포는 증식하면서 EGF나 HGH뿐만 아니라 다양한 종류의 세포성장인자를 만들기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. EGF cosmetics have claims that they can achieve similar, if not better effects.
answer: EGF 화장품과 비슷한 혹은 더 나은 효과를 얻을 수 있다고 주장한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the cell growth factors contained in the culture are analyzed by analyzing the culture, in order to exclude bovine serum used for cultivating stem cells, and by mixing cell growth factors made by genetically modified microorganisms, cosmetic raw materials that are reconstituted are also used.
answer: 줄기세포를 배양할 때 사용하는 소의 혈청을 배제하기 위해 배양물을 분석해서 포함된 세포성장인자를 대부분 밝혀내고, 유전자 재조합 미생물이 만든 세포성장인자를 혼합해서 만들어 재구성한 화장품 원료도 사용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Caregen, CHA BiodioStech, and NexGenBio are bio ventures that manufacture cell growth factors from cosmetic raw materials.
answer: 화장품 원료로 세포성장인자를 제조하는 바이오벤처로는 케어젠, 차바이오디오스텍, 넥스젠바이오 등이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The issue of trust is also being raised as EGF cosmetics and stem cells cosmetics are popping up like bamboo shoots.
answer: EGF 화장품이나 줄기세포 화장품이 우후죽순처럼 생겨나면서 신뢰의 문제도 제기되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Whether or not the cell growth factor has been properly and sufficiently added to cosmetics, there is no way to know.
answer: 화장품에 세포성장인자를 제대로 충분하게 첨가했는지 알 수 있는 방법이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. During the distribution process, it is not known whether the added cell growth factor remains as it is.
answer: 첨가된 세포성장인자가 유통 과정에서 그대로 남아있는지도 알 수 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cell growth factor is a protein, but because it is continuously degraded or its structure is changed, it is unstable, preventing its original function.
answer: 세포성장인자는 단백질인데 불안정해서 계속 분해되거나 구조가 변해서 원래의 기능을 못하게 되기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In particular, when it comes in contact with an emulsifying agent, it is easily denatured, or broken down, which is the main component of cosmetics.
answer: 특히 화장품의 주성분인 유화제와 만나면 쉽게 변성된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Concerns cannot be erased that EGF cosmetics are flooded with patterns just like the phenomenon in which deterioration builds up positive sentiment.
answer: 악화가 양화를 구축하는 현상처럼 무늬만 EGF 화장품이 범람할 우려를 지울 수가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You should check the data that verified the efficacy of the ingredients remaining in the finished product, rather than being deceived by the word EGF or stem cells.
answer: EGF나 줄기세포라는 말에 현혹되기보다는 완제품에 남아 있는 성분의 효능을 검증한 자료를 확인해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is a difficulty in understanding it only if you have a considerable level of scientific knowledge, even if you trust the experimental data provided by the manufacturer.
answer: 제조사에서 제공한 실험 자료를 신뢰한다 하더라도 상당한 수준의 과학지식이 있어야 이해할 수 있다는 어려움도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From those of the past functional cosmetics, functional cosmetics containing cell growth factors or stem cells cultured solution that directly affect cells have different functions on the skin.
answer: 세포에 직접적으로 영향을 주는 세포성장인자나 줄기세포 배양액이 포함된 기능성 화장품이 피부에 미치는 기능이 과거의 기능성 화장품과는 다르다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It seems necessary to introduce a licensing system like pharmaceuticals, considering it as a new concept product, a skin treatment product that is located in the middle of cosmetics and pharmaceuticals.
answer: 화장품과 의약품의 중간에 위치한 피부치료제라는 새로운 개념의 상품으로 간주하여 의약품처럼 인허가 제도를 도입하는 방법도 필요할 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Collagen was first developed as a filler and has been used since 1980, and is known to be good for the skin.
answer: 피부에 좋다고 알려진 콜라겐이 먼저 필러로 개발되어 1980년부터 사용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only if there is no immune response by testing a small amount on the skin can collagen be used.
answer: 콜라겐은 피부에 소량을 테스트해서 면역반응이 없어야 사용 가능하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It decomposes and disappears in about a month even if injected into the skin.
answer: 피부 속에 주사해도 한 달 정도면 분해되어 없어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hyaluronic acid, like Collagen, is a biopolymer in our body.
answer: 히알루론산도 콜라겐처럼 우리 몸에 있는 생물고분자 물질이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2003, the FDA approved fillers made from hyaluronic acid, and the cosmetic filler market rapidly expanded.
answer: 히알루론산을 원료로 만들어진 필러가 2003년 FDA의 허가를 받아 미용 목적의 필러시장이 급팽창했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because the effect lasts for more than 6 months in the skin, and it is cheaper than collagen.
answer: 콜라겐보다 가격이 싸고 피부 속에서 6개월 이상 효과가 지속되기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since then, products such as ones that improve the shortcomings of collagen and products that contain plastic particles that cannot be absorbed by the body are the various cosmetic filler products have appeared one after another.
answer: 이후 콜라겐의 단점을 개선한 제품이나 체내에서 흡수되지 않는 플라스틱 입자를 혼합한 제품 등 다양한 성형 필러 제품이 속속 등장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Being cheaper to produce and easier to operate than collagen, these are the reasons the filler market has expanded with hyaluronic acid. .
answer: 히알루론산으로 필러 시장이 팽창한 이유는 콜라겐보다 생산비용이 저렴하고 시술하기 쉽기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, in 1990, hyaluronic acid was developed in our country as a treatment for arthritis by LG Life Sciences.
answer: 실제로 우리나라의 LG생명과학에서도 히알루론산을 생산했는데, 1990년 당시에는 관절염 치료제로 개발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Thanks to the success of Restylane, many domestic and foreign companies entered the cosmetic filler market and there were also companies that supplied purified hyaluronic acid that can be used for injection.
answer: 주사제로 사용 가능한 정제된 히알루론산을 공급하는 기업도 있었으며, 레스틸렌의 성공에 힘입어 국내외 많은 기업들이 성형 필러 시장에 진입했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By 2015, more than 110 products have been approved by the Food and Drug Administration as cosmetic fillers.
answer: 2015년까지 식약청에서 성형용 필러로 허가받은 제품만 110개가 넘는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The domestic molded filler market has already grown to 80 billion won scale by 2010, due to imported products.
answer: 수입제품으로 인해 국내 성형 필러 시장도 2010년경에 이미 800억 원 규모로 성장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Korea, others who have attempted to enter the filler market are LG Life Sciences, Ildong Pharmaceutical, Chabio, and Hugel.
answer: 국내에서도 LG생명과학, 일동제약, 차바이오, 휴젤 등이 필러시장에 진입을 시도했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Accounting for half of the domestic filler market estimated to be worth 120 billion won in 2015, cosmetic filler products from LG Life Sciences, Huons, and JW Pharmaceutical have been released.
answer: 현재 LG생명과학, 휴온스, JW중외제약의 성형필러 제품이 출시되어 2015년 1,200억 원 규모로 추정되는 국내 필러시장의 절반을 차지하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With the investment of large plastic surgeons in Gangnam, Hugel's Bottlelex was established and has risen to the third place in the domestic market.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Botulinum bacteria-producing botulinum toxin is a dangerous microorganism that has the potential to be used as a weapon of bioterrorism which is the reason botulinum toxin is somewhat difficult to enter the market.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The fact that a small amount of toxins paralyzes the muscle-regulating function is the inspiring principle of smoothing wrinkles.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It as a Class A risk microorganism when classified by The United States Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Convention on the Prohibition of Biological Weapons is also targeting these microorganisms.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Aum Shintoism members sprayed botulinum toxin several times in Tokyo, in the 1990s in Japan, but fortunately there were no victims.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, various safety facilities are required for factories that manufacture botulinum toxin.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The location of factories must be carefully considered and manufacturing permits are difficult.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fillers and botox, in reality, are more often thought of as cosmetic means despite originally being used as medicines.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because of the human desire to be beautiful, there are few people who listen to the side effects of fillers and botox.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Botulinum toxin has been developed in various formulations and filler products continue to evolve.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The market is likely to continue to grow for some time to come for cosmetic fillers and botulinum toxin.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At first, people were blinded by it and their ears fell deaf, like a fad, and then disappeared like the wind.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is impossible to accurately predict the future, but it is clear that bio-new technology will play an important role in the beauty industry as a whole, not only in the cosmetic industry.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With the development of bio-new technology, the perception of cosmetics is changing to skin treatments that treat the skin, from simply applied cosmetics.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because we have come to analyze and understand skin at the cellular level or at the gene level as we have discovered substances that regulate cells activity and growth.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a business that provides the most suitable makeup method or product, manages the skin for each individual, and genetically checks the characteristics of individual skin.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When biotech companies with original genetic analysis technology entered the cosmetic industry, this was a new field that was created.
answer: 원래 유전자 분석 기술을 가진 바이오텍 기업이 화장품 산업분야로 진입하면서 생겨난 새로운 분야다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Human skin cells can live 50 times, but the skin cells of the Galapagos tortoises, who can live to be almost 200 years old, die after dividing 110 times.
answer: 사람의 피부세포는 50회 그러나 200년 가까이 살 수 있는 갈라파고스 거북이의 피부세포는 110회 분열한 후에 죽는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The skin cells also appear to have evolved, if the lifespan is long, to divide several times.
answer: 수명이 길면 피부 세포도 여러 차례 분열하도록 진화된 모양이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The length of telomeres at the ends of chromosomes determines the number of cells divisions.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A certain length shortens each time a cells divides, which eventually disappears and as a result ending the lifespan of the cells.
answer: 세포가 한번 분열할 때마다 일정 길이가 짧아지고 결국에는 없어지면서 세포의 수명을 다하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Telomeres cosmetics have also appeared that increase the length of telomeres.
answer: 텔로미어의 길이를 다시 늘리는 텔로미어 화장품도 등장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the past, cosmetics focused on covering the skin, but now are gradually entering the cells and are now targeting genes.
answer: 피부를 덮는 화장품이 점차 세포 속으로 들어가 이제는 유전자를 공략하고 있는 셈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It remains to be seen whether they will be the starting point for developing future cosmetic drugs with excellent efficacy or whether telomeres are simply used as a means to deceive consumers.
answer: 텔로미어가 단순히 소비자를 현혹하는 수단으로 이용되고 말지 뛰어난 효능을 지닌 미래의 미용약품을 개발하는 출발점이 될지 지켜볼 일이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is not very different from skin, because it is made by cultivating real skin cells.
answer: 실제 피부세포를 배양하여 만들기 때문에 피부와 별반 다르지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because it reacts according to the functional substances of cosmetics like the skin it is used to evaluate the efficacy of cosmetics.
answer: 피부처럼 화장품의 기능성 물질에 따라 반응하기 때문에, 화장품의 효능 평가에 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to the European Union's Act on the Prohibition of Animal Testing in Cosmetics the demand for cosmetics is expected to continue to rise.
answer: 유럽연합의 화장품 동물실험금지법 때문에 수요가 계속 증가할 것으로 예상하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A plan to use artificial skin made by Olga Bono, was announced by L'Oreal for functional evaluation of cosmetics.
answer: 로레알은 올가보노에서 만든 인공피부를 화장품의 기능성 평가에 사용하려는 계획을 발표하기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For cultivation of skin cells, our country’s Tego Science is also unique in its technology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It sells artificially cultivated skin and operates a skin bank that stores skin tissue.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It has been a long time since new bio-new technology began to be applied to cosmetics, such as genetic analysis and 3D skin cultivation.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through mesenchymal stem cells transplantation, there are even dermatologists claiming to regenerate the skin.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Businesses that blur the boundaries between aesthetics and dermatology are also emerging from biotech companies that claim stem cells skin care.
answer: 줄기세포 스킨케어를 표방하는 바이오텍 기업부터 에스테틱 혹은 피부과와의 경계가 모호한 사업도 생겨나고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the next 10 years, I expect that bio cosmetics will grow not just a type of cosmetics, but into a vine called 'applied beauty medicine'.
answer: 미래 10년의 바이오화장품은 단순히 화장품의 한 종류가 아니라 ‘바르는 미용약’이라는 대박넝쿨로 자라길 기대해 본다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because it has strong oxidizing power and attacks living tissue and damages cells it is called harmful oxygen.
answer: 산화력이 강하여 생체조직을 공격하고 세포를 손상시키기 때문에 유해산소라고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Our body has the ability to remove harmful oxygen, but due to environmental pollution, chemicals, ultraviolet rays, blood circulation disorders, and stress in many cases it cannot completely block the generation of harmful oxygen.
answer: 우리 몸은 유해산소를 제거하는 능력을 가지고 있으나 환경오염과 화학물질, 자외선, 혈액순환 장애, 스트레스 등에 영향으로 유해산소의 발생을 완전하게 차단시키지 못하는 경우가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. EGFEGF plays a role in proliferating epithelial cells of the esophagus and intestinal epidermis as a protein hormone present in blood, breast milk, and saliva.
answer: EGFEGF는 혈액이나 모유, 타액에 존재하는 단백질 호르몬인데 식도와 위 창자 표피의 상피세포를 증식시키는 역할을 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Animals lick wounds due to the EGF that is contained in saliva, which causes epidermal cells, the epithelial cells of the skin, to grow.
answer: 피부의 상피세포인 표피세포도 자라게 하는데, 동물들이 상처 부위를 핥는 것도 EGF가 타액에 포함되어 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Claims that it has anti-aging effects on the skin are published in some papers.
answer: 피부에 항노화 작용을 한다는 논문도 일부 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Established with the goal of extending human lifespan, Human Longevity, conducts research on constructing big data of more than 40, 000 human genomes annually by analyzing a base arrangement of a dielectric substance.
answer: 인간의 수명 연장을 목표로 설립된 휴먼 롱제버티는 연간 4만 명 이상의 인간 유전체의 염기배열을 분석하여 빅데이터를 구성하는 연구를 하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We're no longer using oil is not something we would say.
answer: 그러나 석유를 더 이상 사용하지 않는다는 말은 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Petroleum will continue to be used as a raw material for synthetic fibers and as a fuel for automobiles.
answer: 석유는 여전히 자동차 연료로, 합성섬유의 원료물질로 계속 사용될 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Similarly, bio-new technology can further advance the chemical industry just like the stone buildings of the Iron Age.
answer: 마찬가지로 철기시대의 석조 건물처럼 바이오신기술이 화학산업을 더 발전시킬 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It can make the chemical industry sustainable by reducing carbon emissions that cause global environmental problems.
answer: 지구적 환경문제를 일으키는 탄소 배출을 줄이고 화학산업을 지속 가능하도록 만들 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By applying bio-new technology, let's look for jackpot vines that can be created in the midst of transformation into a sustainable biochemical industry.
answer: 여기서는 바이오신기술이 적용되어 지속 가능한 바이오화학산업으로 변모하는 가운데 생길 수 있는 대박넝쿨을 찾아보자.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fermented foods include, but aren’t limited to, liquor, kimchi, soy sauce, vinegar, yogurt and cheese.
answer: 주류나 김치, 장류, 식초, 요구르트와 치즈가 바로 발효식품이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. there are hundreds of pharmaceuticals and chemical products made from fermentation, except for fermentation foods.
answer: 발효식품을 제외하고도 발효로 만드는 의약품이나 화학제품은 수백 가지가 넘는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through fermentation, antibiotics, such as penicillin, and anticancer drugs, such as doxorubicin, are made.
answer: 페니실린과 같은 항생제나 독소루비신 같은 항암제도 발효를 통해 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Factories using fermentation or enzymes of a microorganism as catalysts also make vitamins, amino acids, and steroids.
answer: 비타민이나 아미노산, 스테로이드 종류도 발효 혹은 미생물의 효소를 촉매로 사용하여 공장에서 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By cultivation of genetically modified microorganism in a fermenter, bio-new drug such as interferon, hepatitis vaccine, and human growth hormone are also made, .
answer: 인터페론이나 간염 백신, 인간 성장 호르몬 같은 바이오신약도 유전자 재조합 미생물을 발효조에서 배양하여 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, because rather than finished products, they are used as intermediate raw materials most of them are not well known to us.
answer: 그러나 대부분 완제품이 아닌 중간원료로 사용되기 때문에 우리에게 잘 알려져 있지 않을 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Products necessary for our daily life, such as industrial products, pharmaceuticals, or food, these intermediate raw materials are used as raw materials to manufacture them.
answer: 이런 중간원료는 공산품이나 의약품 혹은 식품과 같은 우리 생활에 필요한 상품을 제조하는 원료로 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are a number of chemicals used in pharmaceuticals and food that are made through microorganism fermentation even though most of the intermediate raw materials are made in the chemical industry.
answer: 대부분의 중간원료는 화학산업에서 만들지만, 의약품이나 식품에 사용되는 화학물질 중에는 미생물 발효를 통해 만들어지는 것도 상당수 존재한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For example, ethanol, the main ingredient in alcohol, it is made from microorganism fermentation, despite the capability of it being made from petroleum.
answer: 예를 들어 술의 주성분인 에탄올은 석유에서도 만들 수 있지만 미생물 발효로 만든 것을 사용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Carcinogens such as benzopyrene derived from petroleum during the manufacturing process are difficult to completely remove.
answer: 제조 과정에서 석유에서 유래한 벤조피렌 같은 발암물질을 완전히 제거하기 어렵기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, alcohol made through fermentation is used as a raw material for food or cosmetics, as a cold medicine, or hand sanitizer.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Often, difficult products to manufacture are complex substances such as antibiotics are difficult to manufacture chemically.
answer: 항생제와 같이 복잡하게 생긴 물질은 화학적으로 제조하기 어려운 경우가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the time, by fermenting microorganisms, antibiotics such as penicillin and tetracycline are made.
answer: 페니실린이나 테트라사이클린 같은 항생제는 대부분 미생물을 발효하여 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It has become possible to change or replace the genes of microorganisms at will with the development of bio-new technology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Lauded as scientific achievements are the attempts to enslave microorganism by moderately altering their genes.
answer: 유전자를 적당히 바꾸어 미생물을 노예로 만들려는 시도는 과학적인 성과로 찬사를 받는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Made from genes are the thousands of proteins that work in a complex way to sustain life.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Changing the gene requires understanding how it works and requires sophisticated design, just as you can't make a flying car right away by attaching airplane parts to a car.
answer: 자동차에 비행기 부품을 붙인다고 바로 하늘을 나는 자동차를 만들 수 없듯이, 유전자를 바꾸는 데도 작동 원리를 파악해야 하고 정교한 설계도 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We can’t always create the microorganism we want just because we can tamper with our genes.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By cutting out interferon or growth hormone gene fragments from human cells and putting them in colon bacillus or hamster cells is how typical successful cases for bio-new drug productions happen.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a relatively simple genetic engineering technology, at the current level, but to create a jackpot vine, it has been linked to the bio-new drug industry.
