prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If the number of parts with the gene that makes the enzyme is increased, in the case of enzyme production, microorganisms that produce more enzymes than necessary can sometimes be obtained.
answer: 효소를 생산하는 경우 효소를 만드는 유전자가 있는 부분의 수를 늘려 주면 효소를 필요 이상으로 많이 만드는 미생물이 얻어지는 경우도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The bacteria that ferments alcohol, Colon bacillus, was created by inserting a gene for making ethanol into colon bacillus.
answer: 대장균에 에탄올을 만드는 유전자를 넣어 알코올 발효를 하는 대장균도 만들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is possible to make raw materials, in addition to ethanol, that microorganisms could not originally make for natural rubber and petroleum.
answer: 에탄올뿐만 아니라 미생물이 원래 만들지 못했던 석유나 천연고무의 원료도 만들 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Inside the cells, genes and proteins are like a spider's web, intricately intertwined with one another.
answer: 세포 내부의 유전자와 단백질은 거미줄처럼 복잡하게 얽혀 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, it is a challenge for many researchers to design a microorganism that can be enslaved.
answer: 그러나 많은 연구자들이 노예처럼 부릴 수 있는 미생물을 디자인하기 위하여 끊임없이 도전하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They claim that by adding the necessary genes to this, it is possible to design microorganisms necessary for humans.
answer: 여기에 필요한 유전자를 첨가하는 방식으로 인간에게 필요한 미생물을 설계할 수 있다고 주장하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is expected that human-designed synthetic microorganism technology and molecular evolution technology will sustainably evolve the chemical industry.
answer: 분자진화 기술과 인간이 설계한 합성미생물 기술이 화학산업을 지속 가능하게 진화시킬 것이라고 예상한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Let's look for any possibly growing buds of the jackpot vines.
answer: 그 속에서 자라고 있을지 모를 대박넝쿨의 싹을 찾아보자.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The escape of water from the cells is a simple explanation for the osmotic action of sugar.
answer: 설탕의 삼투작용으로 세포의 수분이 빠져나오는 것에 불과하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By cultivating microorganisms in modern factories genuine enzymes are made.
answer: 진짜 효소는 현대화된 시설을 갖춘 공장에서 미생물을 배양하여 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As microorganism cells grow, they make enzymes.
answer: 미생물 세포는 자라면서 효소를 만들어 내기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Protease is the enzyme that breaks down proteins, and depending on the type, it is used as a raw material for digestive or anti-inflammatory drugs.
answer: 생물 시간에 프로테아제라고 배웠던 단백질을 분해하는 효소는 종류에 따라 소화제나 소염제의 원료로 사용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to the suspension made by combining tannins with proteins, wheat beer is cloudy.
answer: 밀맥주가 혼탁한 이유는 탄닌과 단백질이 결합하여 만들어진 부유물 때문인데, 단백질 분해효소를 사용하여 단백질을 작게 잘라버리면 탄닌과 결합하지 못해 맑은 맥주를 만들 수 있게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By using amylase, an enzyme that breaks down starch, the starch syrup we sell in supermarkets is also made.
answer: 우리가 슈퍼마켓에서 파는 물엿도 전분을 분해시키는 효소인 아밀라아제를 사용하여 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To make bread more puffy and improve its texture, we also use enzymes.
answer: 식빵을 더 잘 부풀게 하고 식감을 개선시키는 효소도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ironically, laundry detergents are the most common use of enzymes.
answer: 아이러니하게 효소가 가장 많이 사용되는 곳은 세탁용 세제다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can find explanations that proteolytic enzymes or lipolytic enzymes have been added if you look closely at the packaging of detergent for washing machines.
answer: 세탁기용 세제의 포장을 잘 살펴보면 단백질 분해효소나 지방 분해효소가 첨가되었다는 설명을 찾을 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Dead skin cells and grease are easily removed from our clothes by these enzymes.
answer: 이 효소들은 우리 몸에서 떨어져 나온 각질이나 기름때를 빨랫감에서 쉽게 제거시켜 준다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Dirt is easily removed even with a small amount of detergent when enzymes are added, so it is eco-friendly by using less of the main component of detergent which is surfactant.
answer: 효소를 첨가하면 세제를 적게 사용해도 때가 잘 빠지기 때문에, 세제의 주성분인 계면활성제를 적게 사용하여 친환경적이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With most of them are imported from foreign companies, the domestic market for detergent enzymes is approaching 100 billion won.
answer: 세제용 효소의 국내시장은 1,000억 원에 육박하고 있는데 대부분 외국기업의 제품을 수입하여 사용하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mixing just any detergent and enzymes will not work.
answer: 아무 효소나 세제에 섞는다고 효과가 있는 것은 아니기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of them undergo thermal denaturation when temperatures rise because enzymes are proteins.
answer: 효소는 단백질이기 때문에 온도가 높아지면 대부분 열변성이 일어나기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So, in the past, they have found and used from microorganisms isolated from hot places such as hot springs because those can make enzymes suitable for these conditions.
answer: 그래서 과거에는 온천같이 뜨거운 곳에서 분리된 미생물에서 이런 조건에 적합한 효소를 찾아내어 사용해 왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, it can evolve into a robust enzyme by using molecular evolution technology, that does not undergo denaturation even under high temperature or alkaline conditions.
answer: 그러나 분자진화 기술을 사용하면 고온이나 알칼리 조건에서도 변성이 일어나지 않는 튼튼한 효소로 진화시킬 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By changing the base arrangement of the gene that makes the enzyme, this technology uses a method of repeatedly selecting those that do not undergo denaturation at high temperature to little by little create numerous modified enzymes.
answer: 이 기술은 효소를 만드는 유전자의 염기배열을 조금씩 바꾸어 수많은 변형 효소를 만들어 내고 높은 온도에서 변성이 일어나지 않는 것을 반복해서 골라내는 방법을 사용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because it makes many mutations and repeats the process of survival of the fittest, it is called molecular evolution.
answer: 돌연변이를 많이 만들고 적자생존의 과정을 반복시키기 때문에 분자진화라고 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A big contribution to improving the enzymes used in detergents has been molecular evolution technology.
answer: 분자진화 기술은 세제에 사용되는 효소를 개량하는 데 크게 기여했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When they encounter surfactants, the main component of detergents, enzymes lose their activity.
answer: 효소는 세제의 주성분인 계면활성제를 만나면 활성을 잃어버린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The environment inside cells, where substances such as surfactants do not exist, is where enzymes have evolved to be suitable for.
answer: 효소는 계면활성제 같은 물질이 존재하지 않는 세포 내부의 환경에 적합하게 진화되었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By repeating the operation of changing the base arrangement of the enzyme gene little by little, it is possible to find the base arrangement in which an enzyme that does not lose its activity even if the presence of a surfactant is made.
answer: 효소 유전자의 염기배열을 조금씩 바꾸는 작업을 수없이 반복하여 계면활성제가 있어도 활성을 잃어버리지 않는 효소가 만들어지는 염기배열을 찾아낼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To create an enzyme optimized for a new environment, molecular evolution technology is technology that continuously changes the base arrangement of a gene.
answer: 이렇게 분자진화 기술은 유전자의 염기배열을 계속 바꾸어 새로운 환경에 최적화된 효소를 만드는 기술이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To improve enzymes, they collaborated with several companies that produce existing enzymes.
answer: 그들은 기존 효소를 생산하는 여러 회사와 공동으로 효소 개량을 추진했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A unique enzyme company that occupies half of the global market, Novozyme, by applying molecular evolution technology, is now developing and selling improved enzymes.
answer: 세계시장의 절반을 점유하는 독보적인 효소기업인 노보자임도 지금은 분자진화 기술을 적용해서 개량된 효소를 개발해 판매하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The same goes for DuPont, a multinational chemical company, and the second-largest enzyme company, DSM.
answer: 2위의 효소기업인 DSM과 다국적 화학기업인 듀퐁도 마찬가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In our country there is surprisingly a bio venture company that has developed its own molecular evolution technology.
answer: 놀랍게도 독자적인 분자진화 기술을 개발한 우리나라의 바이오벤처기업도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Listed on the KOSDAQ in 2013, Amicogen, has developed a molecular evolution technology that in a creative way can evade Maxigen's patents .
answer: 2013년 코스닥에 상장된 아미코젠은 맥시젠의 특허를 회피할 수 있는 창의적인 방법의 분자진화 기술을 개발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For gene evolution, it has its own technology.
answer: 이외에도 유전자를 진화시키는 독자적인 기술도 가지고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An enzyme used to manufacture antibiotics was licensed to Sandos after being developed with this technology.
answer: 이 기술로 항생제를 제조하는 데 사용되는 효소를 개발해 산도스에 라이선스했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It produces and sells enzymes at the same time, growing rapidly and recording sales of tens of billions of dollars.
answer: 동시에 효소를 생산·판매하여 수백억대의 매출을 기록하고 빠르게 성장하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The recently listed on the KOSDAQ, Xenofocus, is also developing and selling based on molecular breeding technology enzymes.
answer: 최근 코스닥에 상장한 제노포커스 역시 분자육종 기술을 기반으로 효소를 개발해 판매하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To apply molecular evolution technology to enzymes used in the chemical industry this spin-off subsidiary was created.
answer: 화학산업에 사용되는 효소에 분자진화 기술을 적용하기 위해 스핀오프시킨 자회사다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Depending on where the enzyme is applied, Maxigen has created several spin-off companies.
answer: 맥시젠은 효소가 적용되는 분야에 따라 여러 스핀오프 기업을 만들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Maxigen focused on using molecular evolution technology to improve protein bio-new drug, but was unsuccessful.
answer: 맥시젠은 분자진화 기술을 사용해 단백질 바이오신약을 개량하는데 집중했으나, 성공하지는 못했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since then, Codexis is currently in the business of licensing enzyme improvement technology to more than 50 companies or jointly improving enzymes, all after they acquired the patent for molecular evolution technology.
answer: 이후 코덱시스가 분자진화 기술의 특허를 인수했고 현재 50여 개 이상의 기업에 효소 개량 기술을 라이선스하거나 공동으로 효소를 개량하는 사업을 하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Compared to bio-new drug biotech companies, Codexis has a relatively small market cap of $140 million.
answer: 코덱시스의 시가총액은 1.4억 달러로 바이오신약 바이오텍기업에 비하면 작다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reason is that the monopoly power of molecular evolution technology has weakened and similar technologies have been developed.
answer: 그 이유는 유사한 기술이 개발되어 분자진화 기술의 독점력이 약해졌기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A rival of Maxigen in the field of enzyme improvement, Diversa was acquired by chemical giant BASF.
answer: 효소 개량 분야에서 맥시젠과 쌍벽을 이루던 다이버사는 거대 화학기업인 BASF에 인수되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. DuPont will emerge as the world's third largest enzyme company after DSM, based on the enzyme technology and production facilities of Danisco and Genenco.
answer: 다니스코와 제넨코의 효소 기술과 생산설비를 바탕으로 듀퐁은 DSM에 이어 세계 3위의 효소회사로 등장하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Producing ethanol for fuel from cellulose is the reason DuPont entered the enzyme business.
answer: 듀퐁이 효소사업에 뛰어든 이유는 셀룰로오스로부터 연료용 에탄올을 생산하기 위해서다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because to break down cellulose, it is essential to develop an efficient enzyme.
answer: 셀룰로오스를 분해시키는 효율적인 효소의 개발이 필수적이기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At that time, due to the price of crude oil that was only rising to the ceiling, the development of alternative energy or new and renewable energy was urgent.
answer: 천정부지로 오르기만 하던 원유가격 때문에 당시에는 대체에너지 혹은 신재생에너지의 개발이 절박했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Obama administration emphasized energy diversification and energy security as the energy issues were intensively covered in the media every day.
answer: 언론에서도 연일 에너지 문제가 집중적으로 다루어졌고, 오바마 정부도 에너지 다변화와 에너지 안보를 역설했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mixed with gasoline, bioethanol was made from corn and used as fuel.
answer: 옥수수에서 바이오에탄올이 만들어져 휘발유와 섞여 연료로 사용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sold mainly at gas stations in the Midwest of the United States, E85 is a fuel that is a mixture of 15% gasoline and 85% ethanol.
answer: 미국 중서부의 주유소에서 주로 판매되는 E85는 휘발유 15%와 에탄올 85%가 섞인 연료다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ethanol made from corn was used, and when oil prices were high was widely used.
answer: 옥수수에서 만들어진 에탄올을 사용한 것인데 석유가격이 높았을 당시 많이 이용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the other hand, the subject of using corn for food to be used as fuel for cars has been a point of criticism.
answer: 반면에 식량으로 사용될 옥수수를 자동차 연료로 바꾸어 사용하는 것에 대한 비난이 거셌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An alternative is to isolate cellulose from by-products that are not used as food, such as corn stalks and leaves, and to use enzymes to process them to produce ethanol.

It is argued that the price of cellulose ethanol produced using celic can compete with ethanol or petroleum obtained by fermenting corn starch, and the celic used here is the product with the highest cellulose degradation efficiency compared to the price.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Yeast ingests glucose to make ethanol only when cellulose is broken down into glucose.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Enzymes must also be used even though cellulose enzymes are added after pretreatment with acid or steam.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using specially made agricultural machinery, one person collects and supplies more than 100 tons of cellulose raw materials per day.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Separating cellulose from weeds and making ethanol is not only very advantageous considering that other crops can be grown on weed-growing land to make a profit.

answer: 단순히 숫자상으로 비교해 본다면 엄청나게 늘어난 것으로 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, it was reported that only 586 companies, or 43% of the 1, 285 companies, in 『The Status of Bioventures for 20 Years』, received government venture certification.
answer: 그런데 『바이오벤처 현황 20년』에서는 정부의 벤처 인증을 받은 기업은 1,285개 회사의 43%인 586개에 불과하다고 보고된 바 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The question of whether too many companies are listed in the database is raised by the blurring of boundaries between bio ventures.
answer: 바이오벤처의 경계가 모호해서 너무 많은 기업들이 데이터베이스에 수록되어 있는 것은 아닌가 하는 의구심이 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this chapter, we will try to solve the story by looking back at bio ventures that have emerged in our country since 2000, although there is much room to think about structural issues such as the definition of bio venture and the operation of the venture company confirmation system.
answer: 바이오벤처의 정의와 벤처기업 확인제도의 운영 같은 구조적인 문제에 대해서도 생각해 볼 여지가 많지만, 이 장에서는 지난 2000년 이후 우리나라에서 생겨난 바이오벤처를 되돌아보면서 이야기를 풀어가고자 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Companies are members of our industrial ecosystem that have been granted legal personality through start-ups.
answer: 창업을 통해 법인격을 부여받은 기업은 우리 산업생태계의 구성원이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. New businesses are inevitably the future of our country’s industry, just as children are our future.
answer: 아이들이 우리의 미래인 것처럼 새로 창업하는 기업들은 우리나라 산업의 미래일 수밖에 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To the extent that it is irreversible in our country, the word venture company or bio venture has already been engraved in people's minds.
answer: 그러나 이미 우리나라에서 벤처기업 혹은 바이오벤처라는 단어는 이제 되돌릴 수 없을 정도로 사람들의 머리에 각인되어 버렸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. My hope is that ventures are not recognized as adventures, but as meanings that have infinite possibilities.
answer: 다만 벤처는 모험이 아니라 무한한 가능성을 가진다는 뜻으로 인식되길 바랄 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the venture bubble collapsed, when the KOSDAQ index fell to one-tenth in 2001, which had previous been soaring.
answer: 그러나 급등하던 코스닥지수가 2001년 한 해 동안 10분의 1로 떨어지는 벤처 거품 붕괴가 발생했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The dot-com boom and collapse that emerged in the United States, far across the Pacific, in our country was reproduced as well.
answer: 태평양을 건너 미국에서 생겨난 닷컴 붐과 붕괴가 우리나라에서도 재현된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Many ant investors suffered huge losses, in the process of bursting the bubble.
answer: 거품 붕괴 과정에서 수많은 개미투자자가 막대한 손실을 입었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is my hope that the don't ask investment that raged at the beginning of the 21st century venture bubble of will never reappear again.
answer: 21세기 초에 휘몰아친 묻지마 투자의 벤처 거품이 다시는 재현되지 않기를 바란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a victim of the venture bubble, not only irrelevant.
answer: 무관하기만 한 게 아니라 오히려 벤처 거품의 피해자라고 할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2000 and 2001, only 5 companies in 2000 and 6 companies in 2001 were classified as bio ventures when the venture bubble frenzy and the aftermath of collapse, the number of newly listed companies on the KOSDAQ was 183 and 172, respectively.
answer: 벤처 거품의 광풍과 붕괴의 후폭풍이 몰아치던 2000년과 2001년 코스닥 신규 상장 기업 수가 각각 183개와 172개 회사였으나, 바이오벤처로 분류되는 기업은 2000년 5개사 2001년 6개 회사에 불과했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After the venture bubble disappeared in 2002 most bio ventures went public.
answer: 대부분의 바이오벤처는 벤처 거품이 사라진 2002년 이후에 어렵사리 상장의 과정을 밟았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Five years later, bio ventures began to enter the KOSDAQ in earnest after ViroMed and Bioneer were listed.
answer: 이후 5년이 지나 바이로메드와 바이오니아가 상장하면서 본격적으로 바이오벤처의 코스닥 입성이 시작되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As of the end of 2014, about 5%, started out as bio ventures and were listed on the KOSDAQ which is about 50 of the 1, 054 KOSDAQ listed companies.
answer: 2014년 말 기준으로 코스닥 상장회사 1,054개 기업 중 약 5%에 해당하는 50여 개가 바이오벤처로 출발해 코스닥에 상장된 바이오기업이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The number may be reduced to less than 40 if the strict standard of bio-new technology applied.
answer: 바이오신기술이라는 엄격한 잣대를 적용한다면 40여 개 이하로 줄어들 수도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It will rise again to the level of 5% but only if the concept of new biotechnology is slightly expanded so that it will include bio-new technology companies that develop new bio-new drug or companies that are newly promoting the bio business.
answer: 그러나 바이오신기술의 개념을 약간 확대해 바이오신약을 개발하는 제약회사나 바이오 사업을 신규로 추진하는 기업까지 포함한다면 다시 5% 수준으로 늘어난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Again and again have Bio ventures attempted to enter the KOSDAQ.
answer: 바이오벤처들은 코스닥 진입을 위하여 재수, 삼수를 거듭했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fortunately, through the special listing system for technology companies, more than 10 bio ventures have entered the KOSDAQ.
answer: 다행스러운 것은 기술기업 특례상장제도를 통해 10여 개 이상의 바이오벤처가 코스닥에 입성한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The following figure shows the KOSDAQ index along with the number of bio ventures listed on the KOSDAQ.
answer: 다음 그림에서 코스닥지수와 함께 코스닥에 상장된 바이오벤처의 수를 표시하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Many of the bio-companies that started from bio ventures established around 2000 are listed on the KOSDAQ today.
answer: 오늘날 코스닥에 상장된 바이오기업의 상당수는 2000년 전후에 설립된 바이오벤처에서 출발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was misunderstood as a venture bubble as it survived the difficult times of the KOSDAQ market.
answer: 코스닥시장의 어려운 시기를 겪으며, 벤처거품이라는 오해를 받으며 살아남은 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reality is revealed only after the bubble was extinguished.
answer: 거품이 꺼진 후에 비로소 실체가 드러나는 법이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now, there are also bio-companies receiving praise from the media that they are leading the KOSDAQ, and the proportion of KOSDAQ bio companies in the top group by market capitalization has increased.
answer: 이제는 코스닥 바이오기업이 시가총액 상위 그룹에서 차지하는 비율도 높아졌고 코스닥을 견인하고 있다는 언론의 찬사를 받고 있는 바이오기업도 생겨났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now, to see if the proportion of bio-companies in the overall KOSDAQ is appropriate, let's compare it with the United States Nasdaq.
answer: 현재 코스닥 전체에서 차지하는 바이오기업의 비율은 적절한지 미국 나스닥과 비교해 보자.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There were 618 companies classified in the Nasdaq healthcare industry as of October 2015, accounting for 20% of the total 3, 101 listed companies.
answer: 2015년 10월 기준으로 나스닥의 헬스케어 산업군으로 분류되는 회사는 618개로 전체의 상장회사 3,101개의 20% 수준이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It seems that the proportion of bio-companies currently occupying 5% of the KOSDAQ is quite small, even considering that there are many differences in the industrial structure of the United States and our country.
answer: 미국과 우리나라의 산업 구조에는 많은 차이가 있는 것을 고려하더라도, 현재 코스닥에서 차지하는 바이오기업의 비중이 5%인 것은 상당히 적어 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So, I would like to take this opportunity to think about the future of bio ventures, and to review what has happened to bio venture companies over the past 15 years by event.
answer: 그래서 이번 기회에 지난 15년간 바이오벤처 기업에 일어났던 일들을 사건별로 정리하여 되새겨 보고 앞으로 바이오벤처의 미래에 대하여 생각해 보고자 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A press report stating that KOSDAQ No. 1 bio venture is EZ Biological System can be found.
answer: 그래서 코스닥 1호 바이오벤처는 이지바이오시스템이라는 언론 보도를 찾아볼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. EZ System, which manufactures and sells feed based on the optimal mixing technology for feed, is what EZ Biological System originally started as.
answer: 이지바이오시스템은 원래 사료의 최적 배합 기술을 기반으로 사료를 제조 판매하는 이지시스템에서 출발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bio products such as lactobacilli and enzymes used in feed additives are the base of what the bio business was promoted on.
answer: 사료첨가제에 사용되는 유산균이나 효소 등의 바이오 제품을 기반으로 바이오 사업을 추진했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the many types of feed additives used in the livestock industry are manufactured using orthodox biotechnology such as fermentation.
answer: 축산업에서 사용하는 사료첨가제는 종류도 많지만 대부분은 발효와 같은 정통적인 바이오기술로 제조되는 경우가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because through microorganism fermentation, lysine, one of the essential amino acids that improve feed efficiency, and lactobacilli antibiotics are all made.
answer: 사료의 효율을 높이는 필수아미노산의 하나인 라이신이나, 유산균 항생제들이 모두 미생물 발효를 통하여 만들어지기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, because the business portion of the general feed sector is large, it is difficult to classify EZ Bio as a bio- company or a venture company, but ironically, it was known as a representative bio stock in the KOSDAQ market at the time.
answer: 사실 이지바이오는 일반 사료 부분의 사업 비중이 크기 때문에 바이오기업이나 벤처기업으로 분류하기 어려우나 아이러니하게도 당시 코스닥시장에서는 대표적인 바이오주로 통했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For bio ventures with short business history and low sales or profits, barriers to entry into the KOSDAQ were high at the time.
answer: 업력이 짧고 매출이나 수익이 일천한 바이오벤처들에게 당시 코스닥 진입 장벽은 높았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Feed additives or animal drug dealing companies have entered the KOSDAQ with EZ Bio at the fore.
answer: 사료첨가제나 동물약품을 취급하는 회사들이 이지바이오를 필두로 코스닥에 진입하게 된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The word 'bio' appears in all of their company names.
answer: 모두 회사명에 ‘바이오’라는 단어가 들어 있는 회사들이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, by growing based on its listing on the KOSDAQ, EZ Bio has grown into a major company in the livestock industry.
answer: 실제로 이지바이오는 코스닥 상장을 기반으로 성장하여 축산산업 분야의 주요 기업으로 성장하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of the 143 companies listed on the KOSDAQ in 2000, 4 companies including Macrogen, JoongAng Bio, Eagle Bet, and Daesung Microorganism Research Institute are classified as bio ventures.
answer: 2000년에 코스닥에 상장된 143개 기업 중에서 바이오벤처로 분류되는 곳은 마크로젠 외에 중앙바이오, 이글벳, 대성미생물연구소로 모두 4개 회사다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Among them, a company that at time that commercialized cutting-edge technology based on dielectric analysis technology was Macrogen, a new technology startup company.
answer: 그중 마크로젠은 유전체 분석 기술을 바탕으로 첨단기술을 사업화하는, 당시로서 신생 기술창업 회사였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. JoongAng Bio and Daesung Microorganism were companies that supplied bio products to the livestock industry and dealt with veterinary drugs that until the 2000s, had grown rapidly.
answer: 중앙바이오와 대성미생물은 동물의약품을 취급하는 회사로 2000년대까지 급속하게 성장했던 축산산업을 무대로 바이오 제품을 공급하던 회사였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As of the end of 2014, Daesung Microorganism recorded 2.4 billion won in operating profit and 25.3 billion won in sales.
answer: 대성미생물의 경우 2014년 말 기준 매출은 253억 원에 영업이익은 24억 원이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the other hand, Macrogen who had their roots based in the genetic analysis business, which was unfamiliar at the time, recorded sales of only 2.5 billion won in 2000, but reached 54.1 billion won in 2014, a 20-fold increase over the same period.
answer: 반면 당시만 해도 생소한 유전자 분석 사업을 시작했던 마크로젠은 2000년 25억 원에 불과했던 매출액이 2014년에는 541억 원으로 같은 기간 동안 20배 이상의 성과를 올리게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Comparing the cases of four companies listed as bio ventures in 2000 is not to disparage the feed business, but to emphasize the high growth potential of Macrogen based on bio-new technology.
answer: 2000년에 바이오벤처로 상장한 네 개 기업의 경우를 비교한 것은 바이오신기술에 기반을 둔 마크로젠의 높은 성장성을 강조하기 위함일 뿐 사료사업을 폄훼하려는 것은 물론 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is undeniable that Daesung Microorganism and Eagle Bet achieve results above the average operating profit margin of our country’s manufacturing industry as they are highly stable and profitable companies.
answer: 대성미생물과 이글벳은 우리나라 제조업 평균 영업이익률 이상의 실적을 달성하는 안정성과 수익성이 높은 기업인 점을 부인할 수 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It has grown by leaps and bounds into the EZ Bio group with 39 affiliates and sales of KRW 1.5 trillion scale in the 14 years since listing on the KOSDAQ.
answer: 코스닥 상장 후 14년 동안 39개의 계열사를 가진 매출규모 1조 5,000억 원 규모의 이지바이오그룹으로 폭풍 성장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is meaningless to debate over who is the first bio venture listed on the KOSDAQ.
answer: 당연히 누가 최초로 코스닥에 상장된 바이오벤처인지 따위의 논쟁은 아무런 의미가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because bio ventures have a significant meaning even in the scale of the national economy and especially in the capital market.
answer: 자본시장, 나아가서는 국가경제의 규모에서 바이오벤처가 상당한 의미를 갖고 있다고 보는 까닭이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The example of Macrogen shows that bio ventures have the highest growth potential in new business fields that are pioneering new markets, rather than companies competing in an already saturated market.
answer: 이미 포화된 시장에서 경쟁하는 기업보다는 새로운 시장을 개척하는 신사업분야의 바이오벤처가 바로 성장성이 가장 높은 기업이라는 것이 마크로젠의 예를 통해 알 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unfortunately, most bio ventures have suffered from chronic funding shortages for a long time since 2001, as the venture investment market has tightened.
answer: 불행히도 2001년 이후부터 벤처 투자시장이 경색되면서 대부분의 바이오벤처들이 오랫동안 만성적인 자금 부족을 겪었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I often wonder if there would have been a second or third Macrogen that has grown terribly now if the doors of KOSDAQ listing had been slightly more open to bio ventures at the time.
answer: 당시 바이오벤처에게 코스닥 상장의 문이 조금 더 열려 있었더라면 지금 무섭게 성장한 제2, 제3의 마크로젠이 있지 않았을까 하는 생각을 자주 하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Daehan Biolink, who had climbed among bio ventures to the top in market capitalization after its listing in 2001, it was a promising company with a net profit of 4.4 billion won in 2000 and sales of 15.6 billion won.
answer: 2001년 상장 후 바이오벤처 중에서 시가총액이 1위까지 올라갔던 대한바이오링크의 경우 2000년 당시 156억의 매출에 44억의 순익을 기록하는 유망한 기업이었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Daehan Biolink, operated a large-scale laboratory animal production facility and had a continuous profit structure, was in the business of supplying laboratory animals such as rats and rabbits to hospitals and research institutes, occupying 70% of the domestic market at the time.
answer: 병원이나 연구소 등에 쥐나 토끼 같은 실험동물을 공급하는 사업을 하던 대한 바이오링크는 대규모 실험동물 생산시설을 운영하며 당시 국내시장의 70%를 점유하는 등 지속적인 수익 구조를 가지고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By acquiring the Hanil Synthetic Fiber, established by Hanil Synthetic Fiber, Inbionet received attention from the public because it had been a major conglomerate at the time, but was also delisted due to final bankruptcy in 2008.
answer: 인바이오넷은 당시 대기업 반열에 들었던 한일합섬에서 설립한 한효과학기술원을 인수하여 세간의 주목을 받기도 했으나, 역시 2008년 최종 부도로 상장 폐지된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Inbionet has increased its capital relatively easily through a number of rights offerings as they are a company which specializes in the development and manufacturing of pharmaceutical and microorganism feed additives.
answer: 제약 및 미생물 사료첨가제 개발 및 제조를 전문으로 하던 인바이오넷은 여러 차례 유상증자를 통해 비교적 어렵지 않게 자본을 확충했으나 2008년에는 20억 원 규모의 유상증자에 실패해 상장 폐지된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At that time, since they had expanded and were establishing medical centers in Daejeon and Incheon many thought that it was due this unreasonable business expansion.
answer: 당시 대전과 인천에 메디컬센터를 건립하는 등 무리한 사업 확장 때문이었다는 견해가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reason for such a view is that its operating profit was also in the black state of KRW 2.5 billion, and Inbionet's sales of animal drugs and feed additives in 2007 were KRW 13.9 billion.
answer: 그렇게 보는 이유는 인바이오넷의 2007년 당기의 동물약품이나 사료용첨가제 매출액이 139억 원이고 영업이익 또한 25억 원 정도로 흑자 상태였기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After that, it tried to transform into a comprehensive entertainment company and the company name was changed to EBT Network.
answer: 이후 EBT네트워크로 회사명이 바뀌고 종합 엔터테인먼트 기업으로 변신을 시도했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As the name was changed to EBT Network, there were many incidents that were reported through media such as management rights disputes, various lawsuits and embezzlement, and the possibility of connection with Jin Seung-hyeon Gate.
answer: EBT네트워크로 사명이 변경되면서 언론을 통해 경영권 분쟁, 각종고소와 횡령 그리고 진승현 게이트와의 관련 가능성 등이 보도된 후 결국 주가가 액면가의 40%에 미달하여 상장 폐지된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the time, Nexus Investment, which was actively investing in bio ventures at the time, through a consortium acquired the management rights of Biomedia for 6.6 billion won and to get significant profits by a roundabout listing merged it with Soribada in 2006.
answer: 당시 적극적으로 바이오벤처 투자를 하던 넥서스투자가 컨소시엄을 통해 66억 원에 바이오메디아의 경영권을 인수한 후 2006년 소리바다와 합병시켜 우회상장시킴으로서 상당한 수익을 얻는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At that time, There were no special problems for Biomedia's for hair growth artificial soil or cultivation soil business but it still did not grow significantly.
answer: 당시 바이오메디아의 인공토양이나 육모용 배양토 사업은 크게 성장하지는 않았으나 특별한 문제가 발생하지는 않았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, after the merger, Biomedia disappeared from the KOSDAQ market after the last role of listing Soribada on the KOSDAQ and the bio business was liquidated.
answer: 그러나 합병 이후 바이오 사업은 정리되었고 소리바다를 코스닥에 상장시키는 역할을 마지막으로 바이오메디아는 코스닥시장에서 사라지게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Also listed in the same year, Kobiotech tried to expand into the bio business that develops health food and pharmaceutical raw materials after changing the company name from Korea fermenters, due to them originally manufacturing fermenters necessary for cultivating microorganisms.
answer: 역시 그해 상장한 코바이오텍은 미생물을 배양하는 데 필요한 발효기를 제조하는 한국발효기에서 회사명을 바꾸고 건강식품이나 제약원료를 개발하는 바이오 사업으로 확장하기 위해 노력했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the fermenter business will be closed after merging with Farmswell in March 2008 and changing the company name to Farmswell Bio.
answer: 그러나 2008년 3월 팜스웰과 합병을 통해 팜스웰바이오로 회사명을 바꾼 후 발효기 사업은 정리한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, through Cobiotech, Farmswell, which started as Kempro, which manufactures and sells raw materials, has been listed.
answer: 결과적으로 원료의약품을 제조·판매하는 켐프로에서 출발한 팜스웰이 코바이오텍을 통해 우회상장하게 된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The original major shareholders re-founded Cobiotech in January 2009 after they liquidated their shares, and they are running the fermenter business, their main business, at the original location.
answer: 원래의 대주주들은 지분을 정리하고 2009년 1월 다시 코바이오텍을 재창업하여 원래의 장소에서 본업인 발효기 사업을 영위하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They seemed to have zero intention of growth for the company through listing on the KOSDAQ from the beginning, let alone even considered to be a listing on the KOSDAQ as a business goal.
answer: 처음부터 코스닥 상장을 통해 회사를 성장시키려는 의지가 없었거나 심지어는 코스닥 상장을 사업의 목표로 생각한 경우도 있었던 것 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Korea Microorganism, after changing its name to Komipharm, was also promoting drug development based on clinical practice analysis services, pharmaceuticals, and animal vaccines.
answer: 한국미생물은 코미팜으로 개명한 후 동물용 백신과 의약품 및 임상 분석 서비스업을 기반으로 의약품 개발도 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After being listed on the KOSDAQ, Bioland is currently pursuing the cosmetics raw material business as its main focus after it acquired the biochemical division of Pacific ocean Chemical in 2004.
answer: 바이오랜드는 코스닥에 상장한 후 2004년 태평양화학의 생화학사업부를 인수하여 현재 화장품원료사업을 주력으로 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In January 2003, SD was listed and through a tender purchase by Inverness, a multinational diagnostic reagent company, acquired management rights.
answer: 2003년 1월에 상장한 에스디는 다국적 진단시약 기업인 인버니스가 공개 매수하여 경영권을 취득하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. SD's sales increased rapidly after becoming a subsidiary of Inverness, and Inverness developed into a multinational diagnostic/service company with current sales of more than $300 million after changing its name to 'Alias'.
answer: 인버니스의 자회사가 된 이후 에스디의 매출은 급격하게 증가하였고 인버니스는 회사명을 앨리어로 바꾼 후 현재 3억 달러 이상의 매출을 올리는 다국적 진단/서비스 전문회사로 발전하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was expected that it would be a year in which our country's biotechnology could take off globally and the stem cell therapy could be developed immediately.
answer: 줄기세포 치료제가 당장이라도 개발되고 우리나라의 바이오기술이 세계적으로 도약할 수 있는 한 해가 될 것으로 기대했었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sadly contrary to their belief, there is still no embryonic stem cell therapy approved as a drug, even now being 10 years later.
answer: 그러나 10년이 지난 지금도 의약품으로 허가받은 배아줄기세포 치료제는 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only few trials that are in progress are approved by the United States Food and Drug Administration.
answer: 미국 식품의약품국인 FDA에서 승인한 임상시험만 몇 건 진행되고 있을 뿐이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The closer we get to the end of the desert, the more often we will see a mirage, as we don't know how far the end of the desert is.
answer: 사막의 끝이 얼마나 남았는지 모르지만, 사막의 끝에 가까워질수록 신기루가 더 자주 보일지도 모른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Stem cell therapy that is currently sold or being operated in hospitals uses adult stem cells, not embryonic stem cells, regardless of the permission of the health authorities.
answer: 현재 판매되거나 보건당국의 허가와 무관하게 병원에서 시술되고 있는 줄기세포 치료는 배아줄기세포가 아닌 성체줄기세포를 사용하는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mesenchymal stem cells are obtained through methods such as extraction of bone marrow from a patient's hip bone or liposuction, then isolated and used from adipocytes.
answer: 환자의 엉덩이뼈에서 골수를 뽑거나 지방 흡입과 같은 방법으로 얻은 지방세포로부터 중간엽줄기세포를 분리하여 사용하는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, at that time, stocks called bio-themed stocks or stem cells stocks soared due to embryonic stem cells research by Professor Hwang Woo-seok that had sparked interest and craze for bio ventures listed on the KOSDAQ.
answer: 그러나 당시 황우석 교수의 배아줄기세포 연구가 코스닥에 상장된 바이오벤처에 대한 관심과 열풍을 불러왔고, 바이오테마주 혹은 줄기세포주라고 불리던 주식들이 급등했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Despite the fact that there is no connection with stem cells, self-proclaimed stem cells bio ventures have appeared.
answer: 딱히 줄기세포와 연결고리가 없음에도 불구하고 타칭 혹은 자칭 줄기세포 바이오벤처가 등장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A place that specifically denied that it was related to stem cells was hard to find.
answer: 줄기세포와 관련이 없다고 딱히 부인하는 곳도 찾아보기 어려웠다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From the first half of 2005, the price rally of bio ventures, called bio-themed stocks, continued until the end of the year, benefiting from the Hwang Woo-suk effect.
answer: 2005년 상반기부터 바이오테마주라고 불리는 바이오벤처들의 상한가 랠리가 연말까지 이어져 황우석 효과를 톡톡히 누리기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sanseong PNC, Cho-A Pharmaceutical, Macrogen, Easy Bio, and Samcheondang Pharmaceutical, are now in business that has little to do with stem cells despite the fact they were introduced to the press as KOSDAQ's stem cell-themed stocks based on a report from a foreign securities company.
answer: 한 외국계 증권사의 보고서를 근거로 코스닥의 줄기세포 테마주라고 언론에 소개되던 산성피앤씨, 조아제약, 마크로젠, 이지바이오, 삼천당제약은 모두 지금은 줄기세포와는 별반 관련이 없는 사업을 하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the time, unlisted bio venture companies Future Cell Bank and Pharmicell were conducting clinical trials with patients who had cerebral hemorrhage, Parkinson's disease, and cerebral infarction, in which they administered stem cells extracted from bone marrow.
answer: 당시 비상장 바이오벤처기업인 퓨처셀뱅크와 파미셀은 골수에서 뽑아낸 줄기세포로 뇌출혈, 파킨슨병, 뇌경색 환자에게 투여하는 임상시험을 진행하고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unlike embryonic stem cells the stem cells derived from bone marrow are called adult stem cells.
answer: 골수에서 유래한 줄기세포는 배아줄기세포와 달리 성체줄기세포라고 하는데, 백혈병 환자에게 골수이식을 할 때 사용되는 조혈모세포와는 달리 중간엽줄기세포를 사용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Nevertheless, when looking at Sanseong PNC, which is known to own shares in Future Cell Bank and Pharmicell, their stock price achieved a record 32 times increase in 2005.
answer: 그럼에도 퓨처셀뱅크와 파미셀의 지분을 소유한 것으로 알려진 산성피앤씨의 주가는 2005년에 32배 오르는 기록을 달성했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Afterwards, Pharmicell was created by Future Cell Bank and Pharmicell merging, and they developed acute myocardial infarction stem cells and sold them in Korea.
answer: 이후 퓨처셀뱅크와 파미셀은 합병하여 파미셀이 되었고, 급성심근경색 줄기세포를 개발해 국내에서 허가받아 판매하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Pharmicell, after merging with FCBT Wellve, entered the KOSDAQ through a roundabout listing in 2011, a company listed on the KOSDAQ at the time, which manufactures and sells women's wear.
answer: 파미셀은 2011년 당시 코스닥 상장 업체이며 여성복을 제조·판매하는 에프씨비투웰브와 합병으로 우회상장을 통해 코스닥에 입성했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2011, Prostemics, which had been known as a stem cells company, ended up merging with Sanseong PNC and Leader Cosmetics, a cosmetics manufacturer.
answer: 산성피앤씨는 2011년 줄기세포 업체로 알려진 프로스테믹스, 화장품 제조업체인 리더스코스메틱 등과 합병하게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. More than half of sales come from cosmetics such as packs and masks whereas the rest is in the cardboard business.
answer: 팩이나 마스크류의 화장품 매출이 절반 이상을 차지하고 나머지는 골판지 사업을 지속하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cosmetics sales in the China market have increased significantly recently, and just like in 2005, the stock price soared 20 times in 2014.
answer: 최근 들어 중국시장에서 화장품 매출이 크게 늘어 2005년처럼 2014년 한 해에 20배의 주가 급등을 기록했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. History indeed repeats itself, doesn’t it? Another company that was classified as a stem cell line was Cho-A Pharmaceutical, but at least, through nuclear replacement of somatic cell, it promoted a cloned pig business that could be linked to stem cells.
answer: 역사는 반복된다고 했던가? 조아제약 역시 줄기세포주로 분류되었는데 그나마 줄기세포와 연결 지을 수 있는 체세포 핵치환을 통한 복제 돼지 사업을 추진했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now it is a pharmaceutical company that could not be picked as different from any other pharmaceutical company.
answer: 지금은 여느 제약회사와 다를 바 없는 제약사다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to the 2014 business report, a continuously pursued field of research is that of the research and development for the production of recombinant proteins using cloned pigs.
answer: 다만 2014년 사업보고서에 따르면 복제 돼지를 이용한 재조합단백질을 생산하는 연구개발을 지속적으로 추진하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Macrogen has grown into one of the global leaders in personal genomics and is currently generates most of its sales from dielectric analysis.
answer: 마크로젠은 현재 매출의 대부분이 유전체 분석에서 발생하고 있으며 개인유전체의학의 글로벌 선도기업의 하나로 성장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Based on big data of the past and the experience of genetic analysis service, there is little direct connection with stem cell therapy as we are promoting a personalized medical business that analyzes personal dielectric substance information and suggests the best treatment.
answer: 그 동안의 유전자 분석 서비스 경험과 빅데이터를 기반으로 개인유전체 정보를 분석하여 최적의 치료법을 제시하는 개인 맞춤형 의료사업을 추진하고 있으며 줄기세포 치료제와 직접적인 관련은 적다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mostly related to the livestock industry, EZBio is an EZBIO group composed of 31 affiliates, and is also not related to stem cells.
answer: 이지바이오는 대부분 축산산업과 연관된 31개 관계사로 구성된 이지바이오그룹으로 역시 줄기세포와는 관련이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The media was busy denouncing that most bio stocks were overvalued and between the devil as the KOSDAQ index plummeted.
answer: 코스닥지수는 급락했고 언론에서는 바이오주가 대부분 고평가 상태이며 진퇴양난에 빠진 상태라고 깎아내리기 바빴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Subsequently, there were also concerns about the negative impact on ViroMed, Bioneer, and Crystal Genomics, who had left the general public offering process and had completed the KOSDAQ listing review.
answer: 당시 코스닥 상장 심사를 마치고 일반 공모 절차를 남겨 두고 있던 바이로메드, 바이오니아, 크리스탈지노믹스에게 끼칠 부정적인 영향에 대한 우려도 많았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fortunately, however, Bioneer's general public offering stock subscription competition ratio had a margin evidence of 801.8 billion won was received and after ending on December 21, was 287.4 to 1.
answer: 그러나 다행스럽게 12월 21일 마감된 바이오니아의 일반 공모주 청약경쟁률은 287.4대 1이었고 8,018억 원의 증거금이 접수되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From the perspective of bio ventures, 2005 was a year of confusion.
answer: 2005년은 바이오벤처의 입장에서 보면 혼란스러움 그 자체였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because it is the time when bio ventures resumed listing on the KOSDAQ, which had been stagnant before.
answer: 그동안 주춤거렸던 바이오벤처의 코스닥 상장이 재개되던 시점이기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. From 2002 to 2004, the number of bio ventures plummeted that had been listed on the KOSDAQ.
answer: 2002년부터 2004년까지 코스닥에 상장하는 바이오벤처의 수는 급감했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2002, six companies, which included Cell Biotech, were listed on the KOSDAQ, and in 2003 there were only two, Central Vaccine and SD, and finally in 2004, the only one that was listed on the KOSDAQ was Stech Pharma.
answer: 2002년 쎌바이오텍을 포함한 6개 회사가 코스닥에 상장했고, 2003년에는 중앙백신과 에스디 2곳에 불과했으며, 2004년에는 에스텍파마 한 곳만 코스닥 시장에 상장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, Estech Pharma is a company that is difficult to classify as a bio venture due to the fact it is a company that, through chemical synthesis, manufactures raw materials that manufacture pharmaceutical compounds or antibiotics.
answer: 그나마 에스텍파마는 화학 합성을 통하여 의약용 화합물이나 항생제를 제조하는 원료의약품을 제조하는 회사이므로 바이오벤처로 분류하기도 어려운 측면이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through a roundabout listing and special technology listing system, the beginning of the full-fledged entry of bio ventures into the KOSDAQ was marked in 2005.
answer: 2005년은 우회상장과 기술특례상장 제도를 통한 바이오벤처의 코스닥 진입이 본격적으로 시작된 시기이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a system that, for venture companies that have technology but take a long time to generate profits, registers on the KOSDAQ market to facilitate direct financing in the capital market, and the exact name is 'Special Listing of Technology Growth Companies'.
answer: 정확한 명칭은 ‘기술성장기업 상장특례’이며 기술력은 있으나 수익이 발생하는 데 오랜 시간이 걸리는 벤처기업들에게 자본시장에서의 직접 자금 조달을 용이하게 해 주기 위해 코스닥시장에 등록시켜 준다는 취지의 제도이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. ViroMed and Bioneer were listed on the KOSDAQ for the first time through a new process called list of technical exceptions in December 2005, during the whirlwind of Hwang Woo-Suk 's shock.
answer: 황우석 쇼크의 소용돌이가 몰아치던 2005년 12월 처음으로 바이로메드와 바이오니아가 기술특례상장이라는 새로운 절차를 통하여 코스닥에 상장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are many new drug development bio ventures among the companies that entered the KOSDAQ through special listing.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Just like genetic exploration, new drug development is a business that requires long-term investment.
answer: 신약 개발은 마치 유전탐사처럼 장기간의 투자가 필요한 사업이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The process to develop a new drug is first through animal testing, etc. develop a drug, then complete the manufacturing process, and finally for the clinical trial, manufacture the drug and undergo clinical trials for several years.
answer: 신약 개발은 먼저 동물실험 등을 통하여 의약품을 개발하고 제조공정을 완성시킨 후에 임상시험용 의약품을 제조하여 수년 동안 임상시험을 거쳐야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Tens of billions of won scale in funds is also required in the cost of pursuing domestic clinical practice approval of a new drug.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, at home and abroad, the new drugs that are undergoing clinical trials are gradually increasing.
answer: 이외에도 국내외 임상시험을 진행 중인 신약이 점차 늘어나고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is expected that a bio- company on the KOSDAQ will make a bio-new drug made within a few years.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, no bio-companies listed before 2004 have been delisted, and special listed bio-companies are leading the KOSDAQ.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The opportunity for listing is open even if there is no sales or profit, although, there is no list of technical exceptions.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To continue the virtuous cycle of mutual growth, I hope that great bio ventures will be registered on the KOSDAQ.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Biogenomics opened the door for the first round of a roundabout listing, as a bio venture, on the KOSPI in 2003.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Attracting public attention by promoting a treasure ship salvage project, Biogenomics was once a subsidiary of Samae Industries, but was separated in 2001.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It merged with Orient in 2003, which was manufacturing and selling watches, listed on the KOSPI and changed its name to Orient Bio.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By promoting the development of a new drug for hair growth a recent public announcement revealed that it is planning a clinical trial in 2015.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Why did Celltrion enter the KOSDAQ by way of a roundabout listing? prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Lab Frontier, Oscotech, Infopia, Peptron, Amicogen, Caregen, and Biocore, including Celltrion, which applied for a listing preliminary examination in 2005, were swept by this atmosphere and will all be judged on hold.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After that, for a year or two, a decrease was seen in the number of bio ventures entering the KOSDAQ.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 2009, Chabio merged with Diostech and listed on the KOSDAQ as Chabiodiostech. In 2010, Korea Bonbank, whose current name is now Cellumed, faced a blocked road as lastly enhanced regulations on the roundabout listing system.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Not only the KOSDAQ, but also R&L Bio were eventually delisted, which was listed by a roundabout listing on the KOSPI.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mainly bio/healthcare companies that invest heavily in R&D seem to be the target.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After putting the injection into a sterile state, seal it with a rubber stopper as it is used when dividing the medicine.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The jackpot vines did not grow except for bio-new drug, and this is probably because the situation was different from the heavy chemical products that already existed in the market.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Long-term high glucose exposure causes 60% of lower extremity amputations, 67% of high blood pressure, and 44% of kidney failure.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. He endured strenuous training by using a diabetic tester to monitor his blood sugar eight times per day.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The discovery of a chemical known as "GLP-1" was motivated by the hypothesis that a unique substance found in saliva would effectively control blood glucose.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The majority of oral diabetes medications, including this chemical, do not harm beta cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These kinds of medications are typically used to treat type 2 diabetes in its early stages; if the patient does not respond adequately, insulin injections may also be utilized.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The issue is that only 28-44% of patients manage to control their blood sugar despite these efforts.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it is not enough to simply control blood sugar with medications and injections; the pancreas must also be fundamentally healthy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Those who are older and have pre-diabetes can benefit the most from this strategy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of course, you need to eat sensibly, limiting your intake of calories from carbohydrates while increasing your intake of other nutrients.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. White bread should be substituted with easy-to-digest simple sugars like brown rice.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Exercise helps you burn excess glucose to prevent obesity and enables your cells to respond to the insulin signal.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Additionally, it has the effect of restoring the normal function of the pancreatic beta cells, killing three birds with one stone.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Additionally, based on these associations, 100 randomly selected individuals reported that their blood sugar control was significantly improved after receiving a prescription that was specifically formulated for them.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Insulin is not a treatment for diabetes, according to Canadian Frederick Banting, who received the Nobel Prize for his work on the first discovery of insulin at the age of 32.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Overeating and inadequate exercise are the two main causes of type 2 diabetes.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Overeating leads to diabetes mellitus, a condition that calls for restraint and perseverance.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These foods are bad for diabetes because they cause a rapid inflow of sugar into the blood vessels.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If there is a lot of sugar in the blood, the pancreas secretes insulin to absorb the sugar into the endothelium. If this process is repeated, the pancreas' ability to function and insulin secretion decline.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Additionally, when sugar builds up in the blood vessels, it not only impairs blood flow but also intensifies inflammation.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You urinate a lot at this time because glucose moves a lot of water through your body.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, the body experiences increased thirst and water consumption.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Food must be used as energy when consumed; otherwise, you become easily exhausted and crave food.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, regardless of how much you eat, glucose is not utilized by the body's cells, which causes the weight to drop and the body to progressively weaken.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The van can be heard making a "kick-knock" sound as it races at the automobile in the rearview mirror and smashes it hard.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Dementia, mental sickness, and despair could all be treated using blue LED light.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because of this, there is a fear that the same thing will happen in a similar setting, and in extreme situations, auditory hallucinations or paranoia develop.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These individuals eventually lose brain stem, lateral, and frontal lobe thickness.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To put it another way, when you are involved in or witness a serious accident, your brain cells shrink and you become ill.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to bomb shock, the soldier in the first row on the left has become insane.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As deeply ingrained in the memory as the joy is the first kiss.
answer: 첫 입맞춤은 그 짜릿함 만큼이나 뇌에 확실하게 각인된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A sort of "storage circuit" is created in the brain when particular neurons are activated and linked to synapse in response to a stimulus when an event is input.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As other event circuits cover or replace these transient short-term memories over time, they deteriorate, become smaller, and eventually vanish.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The study team at Columbia University found an adhesive component that makes the link more durable.
answer: 컬럼비아 연구팀이 밝힌 것은 연결고리를 굳히는 접착제 성분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Self-replicating proteins known as prions can collect and kill cells, resulting in mad cow disease.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Synaptic enhancers of the prion type allow for long-term memory of events.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When I fed an elderly mouse a lot of this protein, it not only improved to the level of a young mouse also restored memory.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Synapse tangled with lengthy branches are how nerve cells connect to other cells to establish storage circuits. The issue of artificial memory production is a means to generate a lot of particular proteins when activating certain brain regions.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You won't have to look for the remote control in the refrigerator if you increase the production of memory protein in the hippocampus by activating just the memory gene.
answer: 해마의 그 기억 유전자만을 자극해서 기억 단백질을 많이 만들면 단기 기억이 좋아져서 냉장고 속에 넣어둔 리모컨을 찾아 헤매는 일도 없을 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A part of the hippocampus can be stimulated to create "artificial" memories.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Conversely, you can also remove a neuron's memory by decreasing its stimulation.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Neuroscientists have recently created a novel device that regulates neurons, or brain cells, one at a time.
answer: 최근 뇌과학자들은 뉴런, 즉 뇌세포 하나하나를 조절하는 신기술을 개발했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the history of neuroscience, the most revolutionary invention is actually quite straightforward.
answer: 뇌과학 역사 이래 가장 획기적인 이 기술은 사실 간단하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Plants use light to photosynthesize and produce power.
answer: 식물은 빛을 받으면 전기를 발생시키며 광합성을 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, when a cell is exposed to light, it responds as though an external electrical input had just arrived.
answer: 따라서 뉴런에 빛을 쬐면 외부에서 전기 자극이 온 것처럼 그 부분의 뉴런이 활성화된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In mice, MIT researchers disrupted synapse development to induce "unfinished" anxiety memories.
answer: MIT 연구진들은 쥐에게 시냅스 형성을 방해해서 ‘미완성’ 된 공포 기억을 만들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Naturally, mice with weak synapses were unable to remember.
answer: 시냅스가 제대로 안 만들어진 쥐는 당연히 기억하지 못했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, the circuits connecting the neurons rather than the new synapse itself contained the memory.
answer: 즉 기억은 새로 생기는 시냅스 자체에 있는 것이 아니고 뉴런끼리 연결된 회로에 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because the synapse is well-formed, it is simple to recall first love memories.
answer: 첫사랑의 기억은 시냅스가 강하게 형성돼 있어 쉽게 꺼내진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the synapse is weak or absent in the memory of the acquaintance I met yesterday, making it impossible to retrieve the memory.
answer: 하지만 어제 만난 친구의 기억은 시냅스가 약하게 혹은 형성되지 않아서 기억을 못 꺼낸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A signal chemical called "acetylcholine" is sent by the brain to neighboring neurons in response to a powerful stimulus, such as stinging electricity, to build a network of "storage circuits.".
answer: 두뇌는 찌릿한 전기 같은 강한 자극이 들어오면 ‘아세틸콜린’이란 신호물질을 근처 뉴런에 전달해서 일련의 ‘기억회로’를 만들게 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, I find it difficult to recall everyday sounds that are not electrical stimulation.
answer: 하지만 전기 자극이 아닌 평범한 소리는 쉽게 기억이 안 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The research team played a common sound, "sound A," while simultaneously stimulating frontal lobe cells with light to produce acetylcholine.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, the mouse was exposed to light and had the memory of "Sound A" implanted.
answer: 즉, 쥐에게 빛을 쪼여서 ‘소리 A’의 기억을 심어준 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You are a drug addict if you have a vivid memory of the dopamine, the happy hormone released when you ingest drugs.
answer: 마약 흡입 시 생성되는 도파민, 즉 쾌락 호르몬이 강하게 기억되면 그게 마약 중독이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only methamphetamine addiction in rats vanished when methamphetamine and a drug that prevents synapse development were administered into methamphetamine-dependent rats.
answer: 필로폰 중독 쥐에게 필로폰과 함께 ‘시냅스 형성 방해물질’을 주사하자 쥐의 필로폰 중독 현상만 없어졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Your brain will regenerate if you continue to use your hair while exercising. The sound of their grandkids laughing is the best therapy for grandmothers.
answer: 운동하고 머리 자꾸 쓰면 뇌 젊어져 할머니들의 최고 보약은 깔깔거리는 손주의 웃음소리다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It has recently been established that depression can be treated with optogenetic technology by activating the dopamine-producing region, which is the primary region of depression.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The research team is investigating how to use a protein component found in snake venom to create a blood clot remover.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The research team further dissected the fibrin-degrading protein and tested how it would react with the blood spots on the jeans.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was determined as a result that the majority of the clot was eliminated.
answer: 그 결과 응고된 혈액이 대부분 제거되는 것을 확인했습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We might use a laundry detergent derived from snake venom in the future.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These concepts are all derived from studying how snakes live.
answer: 이런 아이디어는 모두 뱀이 어떻게 살아가고 있는가를 관찰한 데서 나온 아이디어입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia, however, can lead to catastrophic conditions such retinal detachment, glaucoma, and blindness.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. LASIK surgery is not a primary treatment or means of prevention, but rather a substitute for spectacles.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia, however, causes the focus to be in front of the retina, making it appear blurry since the eye is longer than usual.
answer: 하지만 근시는 눈의 길이가 정상보다 길어서 초점이 망막 앞에 맺혀 뿌옇게 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this instance, dragging the object toward the tip of your nose will cause the focus to return, allowing you to see it clearly.
answer: 이 경우 물체를 코앞까지 끌고 와야만 초점이 뒤로 옮겨져 제대로 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A 40-year period is too brief for genetic change to take place.
answer: 40년은 유전자 변화가 생기기에는 너무 짧은 시간이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it is refuted that myopia is caused by genes rather than the environment.
answer: 즉 유전자가 아닌 주위 환경이 근시를 만든다는 반증이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The acquired environment is equally important, according to recent research findings.
answer: 최근의 연구 결과들도 후천적 환경에 무게를 둔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Acquired causes are mostly caused by two factors: extremely long eyes, and adjusting vision to only view close objects.
answer: 후천적 원인은 크게 두 가지, 즉 눈이 비정상으로 길어지는 것, 그리고 가까운 물체만 보도록 생활이 변해 가고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The child's eye length and the lens of a crystal are adjusted by the time they are 8 or 9 years old.
answer: 아이가 8~9세가 되면 눈의 길이와 수정체 초점 조절이 끝난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia, on the other hand, results in aberrant eye growth that lasts until the mid-20s.
answer: 하지만 근시의 경우는 20대 중반까지도 눈이 비정상적으로 계속 자란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Focus is lost in front of the retina as a result, and objects seem hazy.
answer: 그 결과, 망막 앞에 초점이 맺히고 물체는 뿌옇게 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Dopamine is a neuroregulatory chemical that the brain produces in response to sunlight entering the eyes and inhibiting eye development.
answer: 도파민은 눈을 통해 햇볕을 받은 뇌가 만드는 신경조절물질로 눈이 더 자라지 않도록 억제한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Teenagers nowadays, however, have less dopamine because of the absence of sunlight, and as a result, their eyes continue to enlarge.
answer: 하지만 지금의 청소년은 햇빛 부족으로 도파민이 적게 만들어져 눈이 계속 자란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia can also result from a crystal's lens being trained to exclusively focus on nearby objects.
answer: 근시의 두 번째 원인은 수정체가 가까운 거리만 보도록 훈련되기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When a crystal is gazing at something far away, the lens gets thinner, and when it is looking at something near up, the lens gets thicker.
answer: 먼 물체를 볼 때는 수정체가 얇아지고 가까운 것을 볼 때는 두꺼워지도록 수정체는 스스로 조절, 적응한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The eyes must see messages on smart phones at 18 cm, which is significantly closer than 30 cm when reading books and using a computer.
answer: 책, PC를 보는 30㎝보다 훨씬 가까운 18㎝에서 눈은 깨알 같은 스마트폰 문자를 봐야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The muscles in the lens only contract in the short range as a result of constant visual stimulation in front of the nose.
answer: 계속되는 코앞의 시각 자극 활동은 수정체의 근육을 근거리에만 작용하도록 만든다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In comparison to the 26 hours in Europe, the average study week is 32 hours.
answer: 주당 평균 공부 시간은 32시간으로 유럽의 26시간보다 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia is a negative side effect of working hard to get into a prestigious institution.
answer: 좋은 대학 가겠다고 열심히 공부한 부작용이 근시인 셈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ages 7-8 mark the start of myopia, which peaks between 9 and 11 and peaks around high school graduation.
answer: 근시는 7~8세부터 발생해서 9~11세에 급증하고 고교 졸업쯤에는 정점에 이른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This growing pattern seems to support the claim that it will eventually happen unless you stop looking at your books, computers, and smartphones.
answer: 이러한 증가 추세는 책, PC, 스마트폰에서 눈을 떼지 않는 한 필연이라는 주장에 고개가 끄덕여진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Otherwise, eyesight becomes hazy, impairing attention and leading to headaches, glare, and subpar academic performance.
answer: 그렇지 않으면 시야가 흐려져 집중도 하락, 눈부심, 두통, 학력 저하가 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Myopia glasses lengthen the focus length of an object, causing the retina to produce an image of the object.
answer: 근시 안경은 물체의 초점거리를 늘려 망막에 상이 맺히게 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. LASIK thinly slices the corneal lid, opens it, makes cuts within, and then snaps the lid shut.
answer: 라식은 각막 뚜껑을 얇게 잘라 열고 내부를 깎은 뒤 뚜껑을 닫는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even though LASIK heals quickly, occasionally people get dry eyes.
answer: 라식은 회복이 빠르나 눈이 건조한 경우도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All procedures are advised to be carried out after the age of 20, when the eyes have totally finished changing.
answer: 모든 수술은 눈의 변화가 완전히 끝난 20대 이후에 하는 것이 좋다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After LASIK surgery, adverse consequences are frequently observed. A research on the success of LASIK surgery over the previous five years was released by the US Food and Drug Administration.
answer: 라식 수술 후의 부작용은 종종 보도된다 미국 식품의약처는 지난 5년간의 라식 수술 효율성을 조사해 발표했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Visual acuity improved to 1.0 by 95% after 3 months after surgery, "light haze" dropped from 33% to 6%, and side effects were reported to be 0.7%.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Korea Institute of Health and Medical Sciences reported that, among 2,638 Korean doctors, 8% and 13.4% of LASIK patients sustained vision loss three years following surgery.
answer: 한국보건의료연구원 자료에 의하면 국내 수술자 2,638명 중 수술 후 3년 시점에 시력이 떨어진 경우가 라식 8%, 라섹 13.4%였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to some, surgery cannot treat myopia at its root.
answer: 수술은 근시를 원천 치료하는 방법은 아니라는 이야기다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The general population is unaware that modern individuals with eyes adapted to the African grasslands suffer from a sickness called myopia, which is more than just a minor annoyance.
answer: 아프리카 초원에 적응된 눈을 가진 현대인의 근시가 단순 불편함이 아닌 질병이란 점을 일반인은 잘 모른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The normal retina is just wallpaper-like connected to the interior of the eye.
answer: 정상 망막은 마치 벽지처럼 눈 안쪽에 ‘딱’ 붙어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, myopia occurs when the retina is pushed and the eye lengthens.
answer: 하지만 근시는 눈 길이가 늘어나서 망막이 당겨진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, myopia has a major effect on eye health in addition to just causing "visual discomfort.".
answer: 즉, 근시는 단순한 ‘시각적 불편함’이 아니라 눈 건강에 심각한 영향을 미친다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is only one course of action if myopia does not improve: early prevention.
answer: 근시가 치유되지 않는다면 대응 방법은 오직 하나, 조기 예방이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The lens of a crystal muscle breaks down if the distance between the letters and the eyes continues to "come and go" in this manner. The eye muscles likewise "grow and decrease.".
answer: 이렇게 글자-눈 사이 거리가 계속 ‘왔다 갔다’ 하면 눈 근육도 ‘늘었다 줄었다’ 해 수정체 근육이 고장 난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Researchers hypothesize that myopia may have been brought on by wobbly attention and indoor dwelling.
answer: 연구팀은 흔들리는 초점과 실내 생활이 근시를 만든 것으로 추측했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Recent findings indicate that being outside can help reduce nearsightedness.
answer: 최근 야외활동이 근시를 예방한다는 결과가 나오고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, East Asians, highly educated women, the wealthy, bookworms, and city dwellers were more likely to have myopia.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The best way to prevent myopia is to spend time outdoors in the sunlight, whether or not you are exercising.
answer: 운동 여부와 상관없이 햇볕을 쬐고 먼 곳의 풍경을 보는 것이 가장 효과적인 근시 예방이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In a study of 500 children with normal eyes aged 8 to 9 years, an ophthalmology research team at the University of Oregon in the United States discovered that 20% of them had myopia after five years.
answer: 미국 오리건대학 안과 연구진에 의하면 눈이 정상인 8~9살 아이 500명을 5년 뒤 조사해보니 20%가 근시가 됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Taiwanese kids' nearsightedness decreased by 52% a year later when they also engaged in outdoor activity for 80 minutes.
answer: 대만 아이들도 밖에서 80분 활동시켰더니 1년 뒤 근시가 52% 감소했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Outdoor activities are similar to those in our ancestors' African grasslands. The eyes are the same as they were countless eons ago.
answer: 야외활동은 인류 조상의 아프리카 초원 생활과 같다 눈은 수십만 년 전과 같은데 눈의 길이, 수정체 근육이 짧은 기간에 변한 결과가 근시다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Modern scientists worked very hard to discover the answer, which was "outdoor activity.".
answer: ‘야외활동’이라는 답을 찾기 위해 현대 과학자들은 많은 노력을 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Through distance vision and dopamine production, outdoor activities reduce nearsightedness.
answer: 야외활동은 원거리 시야와 도파민 생산으로 근시를 예방한다 근시 예방은 시작 시점이 중요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Check with an ophthalmologist for any anomalies when you are 3 or 4 years old.
answer: 3~4세가 되면 안과에서 눈 이상 여부를 검사하자.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In just three years, the percentage of elementary school pupils who own smartphones has risen to 41%.
answer: 초등학생 스마트폰 보유율은 3년 새 2배 증가한 41%다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Nearsightedness is a result of modern people's eyes continuing to expand while seeing less sunshine.
answer: 하지만 현대인은 햇빛을 덜 보면서 안구가 계속 자라 근시가 생깁니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you don't wear glasses, you could lose your ability to see clearly with corrective lenses, which could have catastrophic repercussions like amblyopia.
answer: 근시는 안경을 안 쓴다든지 하면 오히려 정확한 교정시력을 잃는 경우가 있으므로 약시 등의 심각한 결과를 초래할 수 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, it is preferable to get a thorough eye checkup every six months to a year and get the problem fixed when you are young.
answer: 그래서 어린 시절에는 정확한 시력 검사를 6개월, 혹은 1년 단위로 받고 교정하는 것이 최선의 방법입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ophthalmologists may have individual variations of opinion, although LASIK and LASEK are typically advised whenever practical.
answer: 안과 의사마다 개인적인 견해차는 있지만 라식, 라섹 모두 가능하다면 보통 라섹을 권유합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because our primary focuses are safety and minimal negative effects.
answer: 왜냐하면 안정성과 부작용이 적은 것을 최우선으로 고려하기 때문입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. LASIK problems involving the corneal segment are possible.
answer: 라식의 경우 각막절편과 관련된 합병증이 생길 수가 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For instance, the corneal segment is still only loosely linked to the corneal body years after surgery.
answer: 가령 수술 후 시간이 한참 지나도 각막절편은 각막 몸통에 느슨히 붙어 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The corneal segment is therefore torn or torn when a hard impact is applied, which causes a severe loss of vision.
answer: 따라서 강한 충격을 받으면 각막절편이 찢어지거나 뜯겨나가게 되는데 이때는 심한 시력 저하가 생기게 됩니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the past ten years, men's cosmetics consumption has multiplied by six.
answer: 남성 화장품 소비가 10년 사이 6배 늘어났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The middle-aged flower began to dress up like the "Grooming group," who take attention to their attire.
answer: 차림새에 신경을 쓰는 ‘그루밍족’에 이어 꽃중년이 단장을 시작했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Her magnetism as a queen and beauty as a woman are especially evident in the dark black eyeliner used around her eyes and eyebrows.
answer: 특히 눈썹과 눈 주위의 짙은 검은색 아이라인은 여왕으로서의 카리스마와 여인으로서의 아름다움을 유감없이 보여준다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cosmetic jars discovered in Egyptian monarchs' tombs are kept in the Berlin Museum's collection at the Louvre in Paris.
answer: 베를린 박물관 소장 파리 루브르 박물관에는 이집트 왕들의 무덤에서 발견된 화장품 용기가 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A popular Chinese cosmetic that claimed to whiten the face actually included mercury toxicity, which killed skin cells.
answer: 한때 얼굴을 희게 한다고 불티나게 팔린 중국산 화장품이 있었지만, 수은 독으로 피부세포를 죽게 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to Egypt's Nile River flooding at the period, there were numerous diseases.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The research team found that through boosting skin immunity, the black pigment had the impact of avoiding certain diseases.
answer: 검정 색소는 피부 면역을 높여서 이런 질병 예방 효과를 냈다고 연구진이 밝혔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Additionally, since the main ingredient is a synthetic substance rather than a natural one, it is believed that the effect was anticipated and that it was purposefully created and used to prevent eye disease and generate cosmetics.
answer: 더구나 납 화합물은 천연물이 아니라 합성한 것이라니 그런 효과를 미리 알고 화장 겸 눈병 예방 목적으로 의도적으로 만들어 발랐다는 이야기다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the period of producing cosmetics based on brain response, there are two sorts of cosmetics: "tone," which alters skin color, and "functionality," which enhances skin.
answer: 두뇌 반응 따라 화장품 개발하는 시대 화장품은 피부색을 변화시키는 ‘색조’와 피부를 좋게 하는 ‘기능성’ 두 종류다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although alternative compounds devoid of heavy metals are currently available, the "black" substance used by the Egyptian queen is a rare cosmetic material that possesses both color and utility.
answer: 이집트 여왕의 ‘검은색’ 소재는, 비록 지금은 중금속 없는 다른 소재를 쓰지만, 색조와 기능성을 모두 가진 드문 화장품 소재인 셈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it analyses brain activity to determine how to feel the most attractive when wearing makeup.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Understanding how sunscreen works and using it. Recently, domestic beaches and outdoor pools have noticed a gradual change in wind speed.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The same middle-aged groups avoid the sun as previously, while younger groups are on the rise.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Big data analysis has revealed a direct connection between the words "tanning" and "TV celebrity.".

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Instead of tanning, it's preferable to intentionally alter your skin color if you desire a brown physique.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It must be covered or protected with sunscreen.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Utilizing products that are waterproof and do not wash off with water is also advised.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Until recently, only this level was examined because it was believed that ultraviolet B photons were primarily responsible for skin cancer or erythema.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. SPF 30 translates to 450 minutes of UVB protection (30 minutes multiplied by 15 minutes).

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Direct sunlight on naked skin increases your chance of developing skin cancer, according to some research. However, you only need 5 to 30 minutes of exposure every day, at least twice a week.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Synthetic biology is a vulcan cannon that fires at a rate of 3,000 rounds per minute, if genetic recombination is a pistol.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 150 societal leaders, including eminent synthetic biologists and medical professionals, were invited to Harvard University in June 2016.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The meeting's topic was "the artificial human genome," but it was held in private without the participation of the media.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A smartphone is made up of a chip with a sophisticated circuit printed on it and a module comprising chips.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using a DNA synthesis machine, the specified DNA circuit is printed as though it were printed.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this manner, modules for DNA synthesis, bioenergy production, and cell division control are produced.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The genome is made up of the many modules that make up the entire collection of genes that make up an organism.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The pace of IT development has been on an ascent jet, from vacuum tubes to transistors to integrated circuits, high-density circuits, cell phones, and smartphones.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Moore's Law, which states that computer performance doubles every 18 months while price remains constant, also holds true for synthetic biology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 10,000 DNA chains may be made in one week as opposed to the two years it previously required to synthesize them.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The microorganisms in the North Pole produce cold enzymes, but not for laundry.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We consequently overnight produced the bacterium that best metabolized starch.
