prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is crucial because it acts as a catalyst for many chemical processes in cells.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It happens unintentionally during the process of genetic material replication or is brought on by outside sources like radiation or toxins.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When exposed to radiation or medications, spontaneous mutations arise more frequently than once every million DNA replications.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Parts of living beings are assembled and synthesized in synthetic biology. Genome big data, DNA analysis, and DNA synthesis technology are the three main components of synthetic biology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using this information, the lab robot synthesizes, modifies, and chooses DNA in the desired direction.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Microorganisms can produce things that people demand thanks to synthetic biology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A gasoline module is being put together in the colon bacillus by Dr. Lee Sang-research yeop's team at the Korea Advanced Institute of Science and Technology.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A supercomputer analyzes all of the genetic data in colon bacteria to create the best circuit.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Existing colon bacteria do not contain the gene responsible for producing gasoline.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now, antimalarial medications may be created simply by cultivating yeast, much like you would when making beer.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They didn't have yeast's antimalarial medication or colon bacilli's gasoline at first.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is possible to reassemble organisms to produce fresh medications, novel chemical compounds, and clean energy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It refers to a class of mold or mushrooms, but it is also a general name for single-celled organisms that lack mycelium, photosynthetic capacity, or movement.
answer: 곰팡이나 버섯 무리이지만 균사가 없고, 광합성능이나 운동성도 가지지 않는 단세포 생물의 총칭이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This results from yeast producing carbon dioxide during fermentation, which causes significant foaming.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Human insulin hormone was created from yeast 100 years ago, penicillin from mold 40 years ago, and plastic raw material from intestinal bacteria two years ago.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Genetic engineering, once a cottage industry, entered the age of high-speed, mass-produced synthetic biology when it encountered robots and computers.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If manufacturing of parts was the stage up until this point, part assembly is the stage right now.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A full genome, or set of genes, is created when the component pieces come together.
answer: 부품들이 모여서 완성품인 게놈, 즉 유전자 세트가 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. creating new medications and energy by examining, altering, and manufacturing the internal workings of bacteria The era of synthetic genomes is rapidly arriving. The renowned scientific journal Science reports that artificial yeast has been created.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this investigation, synthetic chromosomes were used to replace 30% of the yeast chromosomes.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Chromosomes created artificially are not merely replicas of natural ones.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They created proteins that were absent from existing animals, cut out unneeded components from existing chromosomes, and altered the signaling system.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. an instance where components of living things that have been utilised for hundreds of millions of years are altering.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The yeast on Earth has been replaced with artificial yeast.
answer: 이제 인조 효모는 더 이상 지구상에 있던 효모가 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Yeast and colon bacilli are microscopic organisms that cannot be seen with the naked eye.
answer: 대장균, 효모는 눈에 보이지 않는 작은 미생물이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the technology used here to create synthetic biology is already moving toward walking creatures.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The chromatin in the nucleus gathers to create chromosomes during cell division.
answer: 세포분열의 전기 때 핵 속의 염색사가 응축되어 염색체를 형성한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The goal of the 'Artificial Human Genome' covert gathering at Harvard University in 2016 was to synthesize the full human genome in ten years.

answer: 어떤 남자의 모발을 한 가닥 얻어서 유전자 정보를 분석하고 유전자를 그대로 복사해서 극미량의 DNA를 얻었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, 1 cc of a woman's blood was taken out, the DNA-containing white blood cells were taken out, and artificial DNA was introduced.
answer: 즉 어떤 여자의 혈액을 1cc 뽑아 DNA가 있는 백혈구를 제거하고 여기에 인조 DNA를 첨가했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The two types of DNA samples created in this manner were sent to a U.S. DNA testing facility that was accredited.
answer: 이렇게 만든 두 종류의 DNA 샘플을 미국의 공인된 DNA 검사소에 보냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The sample protagonist is a man, according to the DNA information, and he has the following DNA features.
answer: 샘플 주인공은 남자이고 DNA 특징은 이러이러하다고 DNA 정보를 보내왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I had no idea it was female blood, and I didn't even realize it was a synthetic sample.
answer: 여성의 혈액이었음을 전혀 구분 못 했고 또 이 샘플이 인조라는 것도 알아채지 못했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The necessary experimental tools and their price are in the tens of millions of won.
answer: 실험 장비와 비용은 수천만 원대 정도면 충분하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you know someone's DNA, all you have to do is make a chunk of DNA that represents them and bury it in the field weapon.
answer: DNA 정보만 있으면 그 사람을 대변할 조각 DNA를 만들어서 현장 흉기에 묻혀놓기만 하면 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It demonstrates how flawed even the best science, DNA testing, is.
answer: 이처럼 최고의 과학인 DNA 검사도 완벽하지는 않다는 것을 보여준다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The victim woman, who is a woman of varied ages, is acting abnormally as she covers her face with underpants and ties her hands with stockings.
answer: 피해 여성 나이가 다양하고 스타킹으로 두 손을 묶고 속옷으로 얼굴을 덮는 이상행동이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These traits are used by criminal psychologists known as "profilers" to forecast criminal behavior.
answer: ‘프로파일러’라고 불리는 범죄심리학자들은 이런 특징으로부터 범인을 예측한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it portends a single offender, a steady job, and someone who exhibits intense sadism.
answer: 즉, 단독범, 안정적 직업, 극심한 가학성 소유자를 예측하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To put it another way, it portends a lone criminal, a reliable employment, and a person who exhibits intense sadism.
answer: 범행 패턴을 보고 범인을 예측하는 범죄 프로파일러의 주 무기는 통계다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can infer the type of person if the offender is the person who purchased a specific item from the hypermarket at that time.
answer: 만약 범인이 그 시간에 대형마트에서 특정 물건을 구입한 사람이라면 어떤 종류의 사람인지를 추측할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is possible to tell whether this is the same individual or a parent-child relationship by comparing it. Even so, DNA data is just one of several forms of proof.
answer: 이것을 비교하면 동일인인지 자식 관계인지도 알 수 있다 DNA 정보는 아직 여러 증거 중의 하나 DNA 예측은 신체적 특징을 알려준다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The likelihood of a black face can be predicted based on the type of DNA.
answer: DNA 종류에 따라 검은 얼 굴색을 예측할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, more than 80% of the time, blue eyes can only be matched genetically.
answer: 실제로 유전자 정보만으로 푸른색의 눈동자인지 맞출 확률은 80% 이상이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In actuality, there is a greater than 80% chance that only genetic information may explain a person's blue eyes.
answer: 4개의 유전자 정보로 얼굴 모양을 그릴 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With the identification of these genes, DNA analysis may now be used to predict traits like height, baldness, and face shape.
answer: 이런 유전자의 발견으로 현재는 키, 대머리 여부, 얼굴 형태도 DNA 분석으로 예측 가능하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The microscope hair test, at the time the best method, also had flaws, as in the instance of a black young man who was wrongfully imprisoned for 21 years.
answer: 21년을 억울하게 옥살이한 흑인 청년의 경우처럼 당시 최고의 기술이었던 현미경 모발 검사법도 오류가 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although there is a 10 in 1 billion chance that you are the offender, there is no guarantee.
answer: 10억 분의 1 확률이라고 하지만 100% 범인이라는 확증은 역시 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Investigating a crime scene is so challenging that the scientific investigation team is featured on the EBS program "Extreme Job.".
answer: EBS ‘극한직업’ 프로그램에 과학수사대가 방영될 정도로 범죄 현장 수사는 힘들다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We anticipate that cutting-edge DNA technology will lessen the physical and mental strain on those who labor at the horrific crime site.
answer: 참혹한 살인 현장에서 일하는 이들의 육체적, 정신적 어려움을 DNA 첨단기법이 덜어주었으면 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I require a DNA list, or all available DNA data.
answer: DNA 리스트, 즉 DNA 정보가 100% 필요합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the amount of DNA data varies significantly between nations.
answer: 하지만 국가마다 DNA 정보를 가지고 있는 정도가 다릅니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When a resident ID card is made, fingerprints are all registered, but DNA is not.
answer: 지문은 주민등록증 만들 때 모두 등록하지만, DNA는 그렇지 못하지요.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It makes use of PCR, an amplification technique, to evaluate even little amounts of on-site blood, semen, and hair samples.
answer: 소량의 현장 혈액, 정액, 모발 샘플로도 검사할 수 있도록 PCR이라는 증폭 기술을 사용합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bloodstains are more prone to change since they are exposed to the air than cells that retain their DNA in the body.
answer: 몸속에 남아 있는 세포 DNA와 달리 혈흔은 공기 중에 노출되기 때문에 DNA가 변할 가능성이 높습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While normal DNA is more stable than mitochondrial DNA, the stability also varies greatly depending on the preservation environment.
answer: 일반 DNA보다는 미토콘드리아 DNA가 좀 더 안정되지만, 이것 역시 보존 환경에 따라 많은 차이가 납니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Patients are first asked by doctors if they have a family history.
answer: 의사가 환자에게 묻는 첫 질문은 가족력 여부다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. See whether any of my kin have experienced the same illness.
answer: 내 친척 중에 같은 병을 앓은 사람이 있는지를 확인한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hemophilia and other uncommon genetic diseases are not the only inherited illnesses.
answer: 대물림되는 병은 혈우병 같은 희귀 유전병만이 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Cancer, diabetes, hyperlipidemia, and possibly Parkinson's disease run in the family.
answer: 암, 당뇨, 고지혈증, 심지어 파킨슨병도 가족력이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You may now purchase my genetic information at $1000,000.
answer: 이제 1000달러면 내 유전자 정보를 알 수 있게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. What should I do if a member of my family carries a cancer-causing gene variant?.
answer: 내 가족이 암에 걸릴 비정상 유전자를 가졌다면 나는 무엇을 해야 하나.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Should I prepare for cancer by having my breasts and ovaries removed, like Angelina Jolie did?.
answer: 안젤리나 졸리처럼 암을 피하려고 미리 유방, 난소를 절제해야 하나.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Can a normal gene take the place of a defective one?.
answer: 아예 비정상 유전자를 정상으로 바꿀 수는 없는가.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We anticipate being able to overcome our dread of inheriting sickness.
answer: 대물림 병의 공포에서 벗어날 수 있을 전망이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Additionally afflicted by a hereditary condition is Tutankhamun. Turn left after ascending the central flight of stairs at the Cairo, Egypt, Archaeological Museum to locate another room where you must pass through the security guard.
answer: 투탕카멘도 유전병의 희생양 이집트 카이로 고고학박물관의 중앙 계단을 올라가 왼쪽으로 꺾으면 보안대를 통과해야 하는 또 다른 방이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. King Tutankhamun, a 19-year-old Egyptian boy, was mummified and coated in gold when he passed away 3000,000 years ago.
answer: 3000년 전 19세로 짧은 생애를 마친 이집트 소년 왕 투탕카멘은 미라로 만들어졌고 온몸이 황금으로 덮였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mira's CT scan revealed the reason for his demise.
answer: 미라의 CT 검사 결과 그의 사망 원인이 밝혀졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A Mira DNA test also revealed that his parents were in fact related.
answer: 또 미라의 DNA 검사로 그의 부모가 남매지간임이 확인됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Prince Alexei, the princess's son, inherited the hemophilia gene when she wed Nicholas II of Russia.
answer: 공주가 러시아의 니콜라스 2세와 결혼하면서 혈우병 유전자는 아들인 알렉세이 황태자에게 전달됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. With hemophilia, even a small wound can be lethal because blood does not stop bleeding well.
answer: 혈우병은 피가 났을 때 지혈이 잘 안 되는 병으로 작은 상처도 치명적이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By chance, Alexei's hemophilia got better after he left.
answer: 우연의 일치인지 그가 다녀간 후 알렉세이의 혈우병이 호전됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are additional ideas that claim that aspirin's blood-thinning adverse effects could be treated only using mystical means or by psychotherapy delivered in a flamboyant manner.
answer: 현란한 말로 심리 치료를 했다거나 신통력만으로 치료하려고 아스피린 복용을 중단한 것이 피를 묽게 하는 아스피린의 부작용을 없앴다는 설도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, the Russian Empire eventually fell, and the revolutionary army killed the hemophiliac prince and his family.
answer: 하지만 결국 러시아 제정은 무너졌고 혈우병의 황태자도 가족과 함께 혁명군에게 처형당했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. But no one can fault a mother for caring for her hemophiliac son who is dying.
answer: 하지만 혈우병으로 죽어가는 아들을 치료하겠다던 어머니를 탓할 사람은 아무도 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Princess Anastasia is the person on the extreme right.
answer: 맨 오른편은 아나스타샤 공주다 비정상 유전자의 정상화로 근본 치료 씨도둑은 못 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The emotions of parents who watch such children are broken when the illness that the parents suffered from is handed down.
answer: 부모가 앓고 있던 병이 대물림되면 이런 자식을 보는 부모의 마음은 산산조각이 난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Defective genes are transferred to kids through sperm and eggs and are the root cause of the 766 hereditary disorders that have been recognized.
answer: 밝혀진 766가지 유전병은 고장 난 유전자가 정자, 난자를 통해 자식에게 전달돼 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hemophilia is an example of a single gene disorder where the cause, diagnosis, and inheritance are all known.
answer: 혈우병처럼 하나의 유전자가 고장 난 경우는 원인, 진단, 대물림이 확실하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, a variety of genetic malfunctions and environmental factors contribute to the development of cancer, diabetes, and Parkinson's disease.
answer: 그러나 암, 당뇨, 파킨슨병은 여러 개의 유전자 고장과 환경 영향으로 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, it is challenging to pinpoint the precise causes and mechanisms of the condition.
answer: 따라서 정확하게 왜, 어떻게 그 병이 생기는지 알기 어렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is more likely to be a "familial disease" than a "hereditary disease" in the case of breast cancer brought on by the BRCA1 gene.
answer: BRCA1 유전자에 의한 유방암의 경우 확실히 대물림되는 유전병이라기보다는 그럴 가능성이 높은, 소위 가족력이 있는 병이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Breast cancer is not always brought on by BRCA1 genes.
answer: BRCA1 유전자 하나에 이상이 있다고 해서 모두 유방암에 걸리는 것은 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Breast cancer may also be brought on by other factors, including diverse genes, food, and environment.
answer: 다른 원인, 예를 들면 다른 유전자와 식생활 습관, 주위 환경이 유방암을 발생시킬 수도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although the degree of the abnormality in the parental gene varies, the likelihood that the disease would manifest in the offspring rises.
answer: 부모 유전자에 이상이 있으면 정도 차이가 있지만, 자식 대에 병이 발생할 확률이 높아진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, out of 7,000 total DNA bases, guanine G, not saitoshin C, makes up base 2166.
answer: 즉 전체 7,000개 DNA 염기 중에서 2166번째 염기가 사이토신 C 대신 구아닌 G이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, proper coagulation protein is not formed and coagulation protein production ceases in the middle.
answer: 그 결과 응고단백질 생산이 중간에 멈춰 정상 응고단백질이 안 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Therefore, there are two options for treatment: continue receiving injections of coagulation proteins, or correct the faulty gene internally.
answer: 따라서 치료법은 두 가지, 즉 응고단백질 주사를 계속 맞거나 내부의 비정상 유전자를 고치는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hemophilia sufferers currently get regular injections of coagulation protein.
answer: 현재 혈우병 환자는 주기적으로 응고단백질 주사를 맞는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Despite the fact that frequent injections make it difficult to locate blood vessels, the 10 million won cost per injection is not excessive.
answer: 하지만 계속되는 주사로 혈관 찾기가 어렵고 또 연간 1000만 원의 주사 비용도 만만치 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Gene therapy is the finest treatment since it finally restores the gene to normal.
answer: 최상의 치료는 결국 유전자를 정상으로 만드는 유전자 치료다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to a single gene malfunction known as "gamma C," he lacked protection, making even exposure to airborne infections lethal.
answer: 그는 ‘감마 C’라는 하나의 유전자 고장으로 면역이 없어 공기 중 바이러스에 노출되기만 해도 생명이 위험했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Diabetes is a condition brought on by several genetic abnormalities, as opposed to "bubble-boy illness," which is brought on by a single gene aberration.
answer: ‘버블보이 병’처럼 하나의 유전자 이상으로 생긴 병은 당뇨처럼 여러 유전자 이상으로 생기는 병보다 치료가 상대적으로 쉽다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. hints from the virus-destroying bacterial enzymes. Gene therapy can be done in two ways.
answer: 바이러스 파괴하는 세균 효소에서 힌트 유전자 치료 방법은 두 가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The first option is to keep the abnormal gene and add the normal one, and the second is to remove the abnormal gene and replace it with the normal one.
answer: 첫째는 비정상은 놔두고 정상 유전자를 추가로 넣는 방법, 둘째는 비정상을 잘라내고 정상을 넣는 경우다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The first technique—the investigation of inserting healthy genes into viruses—has been the main focus of gene therapy for the past 15 years.
answer: 지난 15년간 유전자 치료는 첫째 방법, 즉 정상 유전자를 바이러스에 실어 들여보내는 연구에 매달렸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, the virus that was killed was used to insert the gene into a cell's nucleus.
answer: 즉 죽인 바이러스를 이용해 세포핵 속으로 유전자를 넣었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In addition, the transferred gene either did not enter the target spot on the human chromosome or entered the erroneous location and resulted in the development of cancer.
answer: 그리고 운반된 유전자가 목표 장소인 사람의 염색체에 삽입되지 않거나 혹은 엉뚱한 곳에 끼어 들어가 암으로 발전하기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The bacterium destroys the gene of the invading virus.
answer: 침투한 바이러스의 유전자를 박테리아가 ‘싹둑’ 잘라버리는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The anomaly is fixed utilizing the internal editing function rather than adding a normal gene that has been altered from the outside.
answer: 외부에서 편집된 정상 유전자를 넣는 것이 아니라 내부의 편집 기능을 이용해서 비정상을 고치는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The use of scissors technology has sped up gene therapy.
answer: 이 가위 기술로 유전자 치료가 급물살을 타고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It will be the cherry on top if stem cell technology is combined with this scissor technique.
answer: 이 가위 기술에 줄기세포 기술을 더하면 금상첨화다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Korea, leukemia is the most prevalent type of pediatric cancer and mostly affects kids between the ages of 2 and 5.
answer: 백혈병은 국내 소아암 중 가장 많은 암이며 주로 2~5세 소아에게 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, using your own stem cells for gene therapy only needs to be done once.
answer: 하지만 본인 줄기세포를 이용한 유전자 치료 기술은 한 번이면 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, you can use gene scissors to repair the damaged gene in your stem cells and reintroduce it to the bone marrow.
answer: 즉 본인의 줄기세포에서 고장 난 유전자 부분을 유전자가위로 고치고 다시 골수에 넣으면 끝이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The technology behind gene therapy has two sides. Rarely did the same paper appear concurrently in the prestigious academic publications "Science" and "Nature.".

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The internationally recommended safe value is approximately 1000 times the Earth's magnetic field.
