answer: 동물의 방향감, 생체에 영향을 주지만 아주 약한 신호를 주고 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The magnetic field’s effect itself is unclear, but if it vanishes entirely, I believe it will surely have a significant influence.
answer: 자기장의 영향 자체가 분명치 않지만, 완전히 사라진다면 분명 큰 영향을 줄 것으로 판단합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The benign tumor was quickly removed surgically, but pathogenic infection caused complications.
answer: 양성종양은 수술로 금방 제거했지만, 병원균 감염이 문제였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic-resistant bacteria is not just a story from a distant country.
answer: 항생제 내성균은 먼 나라, 남 이야기가 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Resistant bacteria is a worldwide issue. On September 21, 2017, the United Nations General Assembly held a meeting to discuss antibiotic-resistant bacteria.
answer: 내성균은 전 세계적인 문제다 2017년 9월 21일 유엔총회에서 내성균 대책회의를 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The mortality rate of sepsis accounts for more deaths than AIDS, Ebola, breast cancer, and colon cancer combined.
answer: 사망자가 AIDS, 에볼라, 유방암, 대장암을 합친 숫자보다 많고 치료 비용이 가장 높은 병, 바로 패혈증이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sepsis necessitates immediate antibiotic administration. Boxer Muhammad Ali died last June.
answer: 패혈증은 신속히 항생제 처방해야 권투선수 무하마드 알리가 지난 6월 사망했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was due to sepsis that he died a few days after being admitted to the hospital.
answer: 하지만 병원 입원 며칠 만에 그를 죽게 한 병은 패혈증이었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When the nasal bacteria’s immunity is compromised, it enters the bloodstream through flesh wounds or inserted tubes and causes organ damage.
answer: 콧속 균도 면역이 약해지면 피부 상처나 인체 삽입 튜브 등으로 감염돼 혈액으로 퍼져 장기를 망가뜨린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Symptoms include high fever, hypothermia, shortness of breath, increased heart rate, and dizziness.
answer: 고열, 저체온, 호흡곤란, 심박수 증가, 어지러움이 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The survival rate is 80% if antibiotics are administered within one hour of infection, but it drops to 30% after six hours.
answer: 감염 직후 1시간 이내에 항생제를 투입하면 생존율이 80%지만 6시간 지나면 30%로 급감한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Two pieces of information are crucial for doctors to have when sepsis is suspected.
answer: 패혈증이 의심되면 의사는 두 가지 정보가 급히 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If sepsis is the cause, bacteria in the blood should grow in a culture and be visible.
answer: 패혈증이 맞는다면 혈액 속 균이 배지에서 자라나 눈에 보여야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It takes two days to cultivate and it only grows by 30%.
answer: 하지만 30%밖에 안 자라고 배양도 이틀이나 걸린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As soon as possible, the doctor injects a wide range of antibiotics.
answer: 의사는 우선 급한 대로 광범위 항생제를 주사한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Why do resistant bacteria occur and how to eliminate them.
answer: 내성균은 왜 생기고 이를 없앨 방법은 무엇인가.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic resistance is a repercussion of antibiotic abuse. During the Nobel Prize ceremony in 1945, penicillin developer Alexander Fleming warned that “overuse will lead to penicillin-resistant bacteria.”.
answer: 내성균은 항생제 남용의 부메랑 1945년 페니실린 개발자 플레밍은 노벨상 수상식장에서 ‘과다하게 사용하면 페니실린 내성균이 생길 것’이라고 경고했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. So far, more than 150 antibiotics have been discovered and used.
answer: 인류는 지금까지 150여 종의 항생제를 찾아 썼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Penicillin was discovered, mass-produced, and used to treat gonorrhea, pneumonia, and wounds.
answer: 인간은 페니실린을 찾아내 대량 생산해서 임질, 폐렴, 상처 치료에 썼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was discovered that the intestinal flora of animals had bacteria that acted against penicillin.
answer: 페니실린이란 공격무기에 맞서는 방어무기를 가진 균들이 가축 장내 균에게도 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By breaking down, emitting, and blocking penicillin, these bacteria managed to thrive.
answer: 이 균들은 페니실린을 분해, 방출, 블로킹해서 살아남았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotics prescriptions for colds contributed to the spread of resistant bacteria.
answer: 감기에 항생제를 처방한 것도 내성균 확산을 도왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The mutant pathogen quickly develops even if the antibiotic’s structure is altered.
answer: 항생제 구조를 변화시켜도 변종 병원균은 금방 생겼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic resistance is a repercussion of the overuse of man-made antibiotics.
answer: 내성균은 인간이 만든 항생제 남용으로 인한 부메랑이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Reduction of the ratio of excessively high resistant bacteria occurs when the total amount of antibiotics is decreased.
answer: 항생제 총량을 줄이면 비정상적으로 높아진 내성균 비율이 자연스럽게 낮아진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We must use novel drugs that resistant bacteria have never encountered to eradicate them.
answer: 무엇보다 내성균이 만난 적 없는 새로운 항생제로 내성균을 죽여야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Large pharmaceutical businesses quickly expanded as a result of the exploding usage of antibiotics in the latter part of the 20th century.
answer: 20세기 후반 폭발적인 항생제 사용으로 대형 제약회사들은 급성장했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. First, resistant bacteria will emerge in two to three years, even if it costs one trillion won for 10 years.
answer: 첫째, 10년간 1조 원을 들여 만들어도 2~3년 내 내성균이 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Second, unlike diabetes medicine that is taken daily, antibiotics are not cost-effective since you stop taking them once you get better.
answer: 둘째, 매일 먹는 당뇨약과 달리 항생제는 한번 나으면 안 먹으니 돈이 안 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Third, the majority of the antibiotics that could be found have been discovered over the past 90 years.
answer: 셋째, 지난 90년간 찾을 만한 항생제는 대부분 찾았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Until now, the only way to find bacteria that produce antibiotics was to grow them in a culture.
answer: 지금까지는 항생제 생산균이 배지에서 자라서 항생제를 만들어야 찾을 수 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the underground bacteria that produce antibiotics grow less than 1% in the laboratory.
answer: 하지만 항생제를 만드는 대부분 땅속 균은 실험실에서는 1%도 안 자란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A startling study was published in the prestigious scientific journal Nature in October 2015.
answer: 2015년 10월 저명 학술지 네이처에 놀라운 연구 결과가 실렸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Instead of cultivating human skin fungus one at a time, they examined all the DNA scraped off the skin and discovered information about antibiotics that can be used to kill resistant bacteria.
answer: 그래서 인체 피부균을 하나하나 배양하는 대신 피부균들을 면봉으로 긁어 모든 DNA를 읽고 그 속에서 내성균을 죽이는 항생제 정보를 찾아냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 3D virtual space, we discovered and synthesized the structure of resistant bacteria as well as the structure of a natural antibiotic.
answer: 내성균 취약 구조와 거기에 들어맞는 천적균 항생제 구조를 3D 가상공간에서 찾아서 합성해 냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The development of a novel antibiotic utilizing only DNA data and no bacterial culture is an amazing accomplishment.
answer: 신규 항생제를 균 배양 없이 DNA 정보로만 만들어낸 쾌거다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The synthetic biology used here enables E.coli to produce gasoline as well.
answer: 여기 쓰인 합성생물학은 대장균으로 휘발유도 만들게 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By introducing a set of genes necessary for the production of gasoline into E. coli, Dr. Lee Sang-yeop's team at KAIST creates gasoline.
answer: KAIST 이상엽 박사팀은 대장균에 휘발유를 만드는 유전자 세트를 집어넣어 휘발유를 생산한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is possible since it takes just a few days to evaluate an organism's genetic information and just a few minutes to change the DNA sequence to suit one's needs.
answer: 이게 가능한 이유는 생물체 유전자 정보를 며칠이면 분석할 수 있고 몇 분이면 DNA 순서를 원하는 대로 바꿀 수 있기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The rate of advancement in DNA technology is comparable to the rate of increase in semiconductor memory.
answer: DNA를 다루는 기술 발전은 반도체 메모리 증가 속도와 비슷하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It took 13 years and three trillion won to discover the whole sequence of the human genome, but today the process only costs $1,000 and takes less than a month.
answer: 인간 게놈, 즉 인간 유전자 전체 순서를 처음엔 3조 원 들여 13년 만에 밝혀냈지만, 지금은 이 작업에 1,000달러, 한 달이 채 안 걸린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The DNA sequences of every infectious disease, including resistant bacteria, have been found.
answer: 내성균을 포함한 웬만한 병원균 DNA 순서는 다 밝혀졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Two strategies for surviving septicemia include identifying the bacterium immediately and using a new antibiotic that isn't resistant to it.
answer: 패혈증은 두 가지, 즉 어떤 균인지 빨리 알아내서 내성 없는 신규 항생제를 써야 산다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When a patient with sepsis arrives, the DNA of the pathogen in the blood is read without cultivating the blood.
answer: 패혈증 의심 환자가 들어오면 혈액을 굳이 배양하지 않고 혈액 속 병원균 DNA를 그대로 읽어낸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Which infectious illnesses are present and which antibiotics are resistant can be determined by the DNA sequence.
answer: DNA 순서를 알면 어떤 병원균인지, 어떤 항생제 내성이 있는지 알 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic selection currently takes two to three days, but synthetic biology could speed up the process to less than one day.
answer: 항생제 선택에 지금은 2~3일이나 걸리지만, 합성생물학의 도움을 받게 되면 하루도 안 걸릴 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Research from Rockefeller University in the United States has given the go-ahead for the creation of new antibiotics.
answer: 미국 록펠러대학 연구는 신규 항생제 개발의 청신호다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotics created in the last 90 years could only be discovered when bacteria from the soil were grown in a laboratory and the antibiotic gene was turned on.
answer: 지난 90년간 발견된 항생제는 흙 속 균이 실험실에서 자라서 해당 항생제 유전자를 작동시킬 때만 발견할 수 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can discover every antibiotic gene you possess by reading the entire DNA of the bacteria that produce antibiotics in the soil.
answer: 흙 속 항생제 생산균 DNA를 모두 읽으면 가지고 있는 모든 항생제 유전자를 알 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By obtaining the antibiotic gene in this way, antibiotics can then be created.
answer: 그렇게 얻은 항생제 유전자 정보만으로 항생제를 만들 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The prospect of developing new antibiotics has multiplied hundredfold.
answer: 신규 항생제 생산 가능성이 수백 배 높아졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Infectious diseases are the last threat humanity faces. Will the development of new antibiotics completely resolve the issue of resistant bacteria in the world?.
answer: 인류 최후의 적은 병원균이다 새로운 항생제를 만들면 지구촌 내성균 문제를 완전히 해결할 수 있을까.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The evolution of bacteria resistant to new antibiotics derived from synthetic biology is inevitable if they are handled carelessly like earlier antibiotics.
answer: 하지만 합성생물학으로 만든 신규 항생제라도 예전처럼 무분별하게 사용한다면 내성균 등장은 시간문제다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this way, antibiotics have been sought after for the past 90 years. If the vicious cycle of antibiotic discovery followed by the emergence of new resistant bacteria is repeated, humanity will no longer be able to stand.
answer: 이런 방식으로 지난 90년간 항생제를 찾아왔다 항생제 개발→새 내성균 등장의 악순환을 반복하다가는 인류는 더 이상 설 곳이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If all of the most recent new antibiotics developed by combing through the DNA of all hidden bacteria reveal resistant bacteria, humanity will be doomed.
answer: 그동안 숨겨져 있는 모든 균의 DNA까지 샅샅이 뒤져서 만든 최후 신규 항생제에 모두 내성균이 생긴다면 인류는 방법이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It manifests as a result of both the antibiotic's negative effects and the individual's innate allergy.
answer: 항생제 자체에 부작용을 보이는 것과 개인 체질에 의한 알레르기 때문에 나타나는 것이죠.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hepatotoxicity, bone marrow toxicity, gastrointestinal toxicity, neurotoxicity, etc. are just a few of the medication's side effects.
answer: 약 자체의 부작용으로는 간독성, 골수독성, 위장독성, 신경독성 등이 있으며, 과민반응을 일으키면서 약으로 인한 열이 생기거나 발진이 나기도 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the event of allergies, it manifests differently based on the individual constitution, and each person's symptoms varies. If immunity is impaired, symptoms may manifest or worsen.
answer: 알레르기로 인한 경우 개인 체질에 따라 나타나는 것으로 사람마다 증상이 다 다르고 면역력이 저하되면 증상이 나타나거나 더 심해지기도 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It appears that resistant bacteria are not just a human issue.
answer: 내성균은 비단 사람의 문제만은 아닌 것 같습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The principle of antibiotic resistance is the same in humans and animals.
answer: 항생제를 사용했을 때 내성이 생기는 원리는 인간이나 동물이나 모두 같습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is due to the rapid spread of Egyptian forest mosquitoes, which carry the Zika virus and have been circulating in Brazil since October 2015.
answer: 2015년 10월부터 브라질에서 퍼지기 시작한 지카 바이러스를 옮기는 ‘이집트숲모기’가 급격히 퍼지기 시작했기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to the WHO, four million people will become infected each year.
answer: 한 해 400만 명의 감염자가 발생할 것으로 WHO는 예측했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Pregnant women's fear of the Zika virus is reaching high levels as the number of microcephalic (small-headed) unborn children is rising at the same rate.
answer: 더욱이 머리가 작은 ‘소두증’ 태아가 같은 속도로 늘고 있어서 지카 바이러스는 임산부에게 전대미문의 공포가 되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 11,000 Ebola deaths in Africa in 2014 prompted the declaration of an international emergency.
answer: 2014년 아프리카의 에볼라로 1만 1,000명이 사망했을 때 발령했던 국제 비상사태다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The number of infants born in the area since October of last year who have microcephaly, or small heads, has surged by almost eight times the average rate, worrying health officials.
answer: 지난해 10월부터 이 지역에서 태어난 아기 중 머리가 작은 소두증 신생아 수가 평상 수준의 여덟 배 가까이 늘면서 보건당국을 긴장하게 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The increase in microcephaly newborns corresponded with an increase in Zika virus infections.
answer: 소두증 아기의 급증은 지카 바이러스 감염 환자 증가와 일치했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A child born with microcephaly may just have a small head, or the brain may be unusually small in some circumstances.
answer: 소두증은 단순히 작은 머리로 태어나는 정상아일 수도 있고, 비정상적으로 두뇌가 작은 경우가 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The WHO states that the Zika virus, which is spread by mosquitoes, is clearly to blame for the microcephaly crisis in Brazil, although scientists have not yet discovered specific evidence to link the two.
answer: 브라질에서 급증하는 소두증은 분명 모기가 옮기는 지카 바이러스가 원인인 것은 확실한데 아직 과학자들이 정확한 증거와 연관관계를 찾지 못하고 있다고 WHO는 말하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I'm also concerned that there is little information on what is happening to infected patients or whether the virus is still present and affecting an unborn child.
answer: 또한 감염 환자에게 무슨 일이 일어나고 있는지, 혹시 바이러스가 남아 있어서 태아에게 영향을 주는지에 대한 데이터가 전혀 없다는 것이 두렵다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Brazil, which has the most Zika-infected Egyptian forest mosquitoes, has declared a national emergency and is attempting to exterminate mosquitoes.
answer: 지카 바이러스를 옮기는 이집트숲모기 제일 많은 감염자가 발생한 브라질이 국가 비상사태를 선포하고 모기 박멸에 나섰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While researching in the ‘Zika Forest’ in Uganda, a rhesus monkey was found to have a fever.
answer: 아프리카 우간다 ‘지카 숲’에서 포획한 붉은털원숭이가 열이 나는 것을 조사하며 발견됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Microcephaly fetal mosquitoes are already stigmatized as the principal culprits for transmitting pathogens.
answer: 소두증 태아 모습 모기는 이미 병원체를 옮기는 주범으로 ‘낙인’ 찍힌 놈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Chikungunya, dengue fever, malaria, yellow fever, West Nile virus, Zika, etc.
answer: 말라리아, 황열, 뎅기열, 치쿤구니야열, 웨스트나일열, 지카 등 종류도 다양하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Given that many jungles are full of mosquitoes, it is not surprising that they are hotspots for viruses.
answer: 밀림에 많은 것이 모기인 것을 생각하면 이들이 바이러스의 온상이란 것은 그리 놀라운 일이 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. People are always living with the cold virus.
answer: 사람들도 늘 감기 바이러스와 같이 살고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The body's immunity keeps the infection at bay.
answer: 다만 인체가 면역으로 바이러스가 발을 못 붙이게 하는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even invisible bacteria have the ability to coexist, destroy, and migrate.
answer: 눈에 보이지 않는 박테리아에게도 바이러스가 동거, 파괴, 이동하기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The only issue is when a virus causes harm to people.
answer: 문제가 되는 경우는 바이러스가 사람에게 해를 끼칠 때다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If your child is born with microcephaly, a major impairment of brain development, it is not a common problem.
answer: 태어난 아기가 두뇌 발달에 심각한 문제가 있는 소두증이라면 보통 문제가 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mosquitoes are migrating to North America from small locations around the equator.
answer: 더구나 모기가 원래 살던 적도 부근의 좁은 지역을 벗어나 북미까지 이동하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is due to the mosquito that carries the Zika virus being discovered far from South America, in Washington, D.C.
answer: 즉 남미와는 한참 떨어진 워싱턴에서 지카 바이러스 모기가 발견됐기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you can survive in Washington, D.C., there's a good chance you can survive elsewhere in the country as well.
answer: 워싱턴에서 살아남을 수 있으면 미국의 다른 지역에도 있을 가능성이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Air travel is one of the factors contributing to the rapid spread of mosquito viruses.
answer: 모기 바이러스가 급속히 퍼지는 원인 중의 하나는 항공 이동이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The incubation period is two weeks. When the routes of Zika virus patients in the United States were investigated, they were all infected by mosquito bites from other locations, primarily islands around the equator, according to the scientific magazine Scientific American.
answer: 잠복기는 2주 과학잡지 ‘사이언티픽 아메리칸’에 의하면 미국 내에 지카 바이러스 환자가 유입된 경로를 확인해보니 모두 다른 지역, 주로 적도 부근의 섬에서 모기에 물려 감염된 환자였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We can't rule out the possibility that these individuals were infected by mosquito bites in the US.
answer: 이 환자들을 미국 지역 모기가 물어서 전염시킬 가능성도 배제할 수는 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The virus only exists in specific mosquito species.
answer: 하지만 바이러스는 많은 경우 특정 모기 종류에만 산다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Global warming is likely to have caused the mosquitoes located around the equator that originally carried the Zika virus to travel northward.
answer: 따라서 원래 지카 바이러스를 가지고 있던 적도 부근의 모기가 온난화로 서식지가 북상했을 가능성이 더 크다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the moment, there is no vaccine or treatment available to combat the spread of the Zika virus.
answer: 현시점에서 지카 바이러스 확산이 문제 되는 것은 예방 백신이나 치료제가 전혀 없다는 점 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mosquitoes carrying the Zika virus are more active during the day.
answer: 지카 바이러스 모기는 낮에 주로 활동을 한다고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To reduce skin exposure, wear long sleeves and long pants.
answer: 긴 소매 옷과 긴바지를 입고 피부 노출을 최소화해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If possible, stay in an air-conditioned hotel room to lessen your chances of being bitten by mosquitoes.
answer: 가능하면 에어컨이 설치된 호텔 방을 이용하는 것이 그나마 모기를 만날 확률을 줄인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is advisable not to visit those risky locations if you are pregnant or intend to get pregnant in the near future.
answer: 임신 중이거나 가까운 시간 내에 계획 중이라면 해당 위험 지역을 가지 않는 것이 최선이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Despite recent reports of sexually transmitted Zika virus infections in the United States, mosquitoes are still the primary cause of Zika virus transmission.
answer: 최근 미국 보건당국이 성관계를 통해 지카 바이러스에 감염된 사례를 발표하기도 했지만 지카 바이러스 확산의 주범은 모기다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After a vaccine is created, it should be tested on animals and subsequently on humans, with the number gradually rising.
answer: 실험실에서 백신을 만든 후에 동물에게 실험해보고 다시 점차 수를 늘려가면서 사람에게 실험해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. He believes that the blood of someone afflicted with a more powerful virus will halt the zombie virus, so he infects himself and eventually succeeds.
answer: 더 강한 바이러스에 감염된 사람의 피가 좀비 바이러스를 막을 것으로 생각하고 스스로 감염시켜 결국 성공한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fears were heightened when medical personnel in the United States, the world's leading medical powerhouse, became afflicted.
answer: 더구나 최상위 의료 국가인 미국 의료진마저 감염되자 공포가 밀려왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. ZMapp is a medication being researched in the event that Ebola was deployed as a biological weapon.
answer: ‘지맵’은 에볼라가 생물학무기로 사용된 때를 대비해 연구 중이었던 치료제다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a blood antibody produced by injecting the Ebola virus into animals.
answer: 에볼라 바이러스를 동물에게 주사해서 만든 혈액 속의 ‘항체’다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This antibody binds to and kills the Ebola virus.
answer: 이 항체는 에볼라 바이러스에 ‘찰싹’ 달라붙어 죽인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As an emergency measure, an experimental medicine that had been proven effective in a monkey experiment was utilized.
answer: 당시 원숭이 대상 실험에서 효능을 확인한 실험 단계의 약을 비상조치로 사용한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. ZMapp, which can be injected into a large number of infected individuals in Africa, was not ready.
answer: 하지만 아프리카 현지의 수많은 감염 환자에게 주사할 수 있는 ‘지맵’은 준비돼 있지 않았었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The WHO used the blood of recovered patients to treat locally contaminated patients.
answer: WHO가 현지 감염 환자들에게 시도한 것은 다름 아닌 회복 환자의 피였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It must thoroughly remove any other viruses that may be present in the blood.
answer: 혈액에 있을 수 있는 다른 바이러스 등을 완벽하게 걸러내야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Like a blood donation infectious disease test, it must be performed perfectly.
answer: 마치 헌혈한 피의 병원균 검사를 하듯 완벽하게 해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It received little attention because it was difficult to obtain someone else's blood, even that of an Ebola patient, via injection.
answer: 다른 사람의 피, 그것도 에볼라에 걸렸던 사람의 피를 주사로 받는다는 것이 께름칙했던지 그리 많은 호응을 얻지는 못했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. During the 1995 Congo Ebola outbreak, however, eight patients were injected and seven recovered.
answer: 하지만 1995년 콩고 에볼라 사태 때 8명 환자에게 주사해서 7명이 회복된 기록이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Of course, without a control group, this is a small-scale outcome, but it is the only method that can be utilized urgently in the field in the event of an emergency.
answer: 물론 대조군이 없는 소규모 결과이지만 비상시에 현지에서 급히 사용할 수 있는 유일한 방법임에는 틀림없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It attaches to a specific antigen and circulates in the lymphatic and blood systems, resulting in an antigenic antibody response.
answer: 특정한 항원과 특이적으로 결합하여 림프와 혈액을 떠돌며 항원항체 반응을 일으킨다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even before antibiotics were discovered, blood from tetanus survivors was used to save a fatal tetanus patient in 1890.
answer: 항생제가 발견되기도 전인 1890년, 치명적인 파상풍 환자를 살린 건 파상풍에서 살아남은 동물의 피였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even today, the antidote administered at the hospital in the event of a snake or venomous insect bite is ironically produced from its poison.
answer: 지금도 뱀이나 독충에 물린 응급 상황 시 병원에서 맞는 해독제는 아이러니하게도 그 독으로 만들어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, the antibodies produced by injecting snake venom into horses and lambs are purified.
answer: 즉, 뱀독을 미리 말, 양에게 주사해서 생성된 항체를 정제해 놓는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The antidote contains antibodies that bind to the poison and prevent it from harming nerves or organs.
answer: 해독제 속의 항체는 독에 달라붙어서 신경이나 장기를 파괴하지 못하게 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By accurately researching and producing these antibodies, ZMapp has saved Ebola patients in the United States.
answer: 이런 항체를 좀 더 정밀하게 연구하고 생산한 것이 미국 에볼라 환자를 살린 ‘지맵’이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This technology has already been approved for use in patients.
answer: 이런 기술은 이미 확보돼 환자에게 사용되고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As a result, given enough time, even if a new virus emerges, a vaccine or treatment agent can be appropriately created.
answer: 따라서 시간만 충분히 주어진다면 새로운 바이러스가 나타나더라도 충분히 예방 백신이나 치료제를 만들 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because it is currently the only preventive action available, the WHO declared a state of emergency, the Korean government listed it as a legal infectious disease, and the area was issued a travel warning.
answer: WHO가 비상사태를 발령하고, 한국 정부가 법정 감염병으로 지정하고 해당 지역에 여행 경보를 발령한 것도 지금으로서는 그것이 유일한 예방책이기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It's not likely that Zika will spread to Korea.
answer: 지카의 한국 상륙 가능성은 그리 높지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The chance that this mosquito will spread the illness to someone else outside of its own country is quite remote.
answer: 이 모기가 바이러스를 옮기려면 다른 나라에서 감염된 사람을 그 모기가 물어야 하는 아주 적은 확률이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Thankfully, the Zika virus is not as fatal as the Ebola virus.
answer: 그나마 다행인 것은 지카 바이러스가 에볼라처럼 치사율이 높지 않다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We should be concerned about Zika since we know so little about the virus.
answer: 지카를 두려워해야 하는 이유는 우리가 지카 바이러스에 대해 아는 것이 거의 없다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is why, in general, research is required to prepare for dangerous diseases.
answer: 평상시 위험 병원체를 대비한 연구가 필요한 이유다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The symptoms are minimal, and in some situations, the illness is passed without realizing.
answer: 증상이 가벼워 감염 사실을 모르고 지나가는 경우도 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The fatality rate is also low, but because there is no preventive vaccine or treatment, if symptoms arise, treatment should be administered in such a way that adequate rest is obtained.
answer: 치사율도 낮은 편이지만 예방 백신이나 치료제가 없어 증상이 나타나면 충분한 휴식을 취하는 방식으로 치료를 해야 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you are infected, drink plenty of water to avoid dehydration, and over-the-counter medications such as antipyretics may be used to treat fever or pain.
answer: 감염되면 탈수를 예방하기 위해 물을 자주 마셔야 하며 발열이나 통증을 완화하기 위해 해열제 등의 일반 의약품을 사용하기도 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You might have skeeter syndrome if some of your mosquito bites are more irritating or inflamed than others’.
answer: 남들보다 모기 물린 곳이 심하게 가렵거나 부어오른다면 스키터 증후군일 가능성이 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Skeeter syndrome is a relatively unknown disease in Korea that refers to a local skin inflammatory reaction produced by mosquito saliva.
answer: 스키터 증후군은 아직 우리나라에는 잘 알려지지 않은 질환이지만 모기의 침 때문에 발생하는 국소 피부염증 반응을 말합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. People who are allergic to mosquito saliva typically develop a rash accompanied by pain and itching.
answer: 일반적으로 모기의 타액에 알레르기가 있는 사람에게서 통증과 가려움증을 동반하는 발진이 나타납니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In severe cases, it can cause blistering, fever, and even breathing difficulty due to anaphylactic shock.
answer: 심하면 물집이 생기고 열이 나며 아나필락시스 쇼크로 인해 호흡곤란까지 일으킬 수 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This syndrome typically affects young children of kindergarten age, but it can also affect adults who have undergone fast physical deterioration or constitution changes.
answer: 이 증후군은 보통 초등학생 이하의 어린아이들에게 나타나지만 급격한 체력 저하나 체질 변화를 겪은 성인에게서 발생하기도 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I find myself missing the warm, distant southern island country when the cold wind coolly brushes my face.
answer: 찬 바람이 싸늘하게 얼굴을 스치면 따뜻한 먼 남쪽 섬나라가 그립다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Every year, chikungunya, dengue fever, malaria, yellow fever, Zika, and other unfamiliar diseases kill more than one million people.
answer: 말라리아, 황열, 뎅기열, 지카, 치쿤구니아 등 이름도 생소한 병으로 매년 100만 명 이상이 죽는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Recently, a formidable technology has been developed that will completely eradicate these little devils.
answer: 최근 이놈들을 아예 근절시킬 가공할 기술이 나왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Mekong Delta region is four hours south of here.
answer: 이곳에서 4시간 남쪽으로 향하면 메콩 델타 지역이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Vietnam's rural areas are at risk of malaria, according to the World Health Organization.
answer: 세계보건기구에 의하면 베트남 농촌은 말라리아 위험 지역이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Malaria has reduced the combat power of entire units in numerous instances.
answer: 심지어 부대 전체가 말라리아로 전투력을 상실한 곳도 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There were 7,832 malaria cases in that year alone, according to the American Journal of Neuropsychology.
answer: 미국 신경정신병 학회지에 의하면 당시 한 해에만 7,832명의 말라리아 환자가 발생했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. He believed he had severe PTSD, therefore the doctor prescribed medication.
answer: 심한 ‘외상 후 스트레스’를 앓고 있다고 스스로 생각했고 의사도 그런 약을 처방했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When I saw the word 'malaria' on a hospital bulletin board one day, I remembered that I had malaria twice in Vietnam.
answer: 어느 날 병원 게시판에서 ‘말라리아’란 글자를 보고 본인이 베트남에서 말라리아를 두 번씩이나 앓았음을 상기했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An examination revealed that he had significant aftereffects from the malaria protozoan blocking blood vessels in his brain.
answer: 검사 결과 그는 뇌의 혈관이 말라리아 원충으로 막히는 심한 후유증을 앓고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to reports at the time, 70% of veterans suffering from malaria considered suicide.
answer: 당시 기록에 의하면 말라리아 환자였던 참전용사의 70%가 자살을 생각했다고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Malaria can have serious consequences if not treated promptly.
answer: 말라리아는 제때 치료하지 않으면 심한 후유증을 남긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Less than one hundredth of the thickness of a human hair, this protozoan enters the body of the mosquito through blood sucking.
answer: 머리카락 굵기의 100분의 1도 안 되는 이 원충은 모기의 흡혈을 통해서 모기 체내로 침입한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mosquitoes also make an effort to get rid of the intrusive protozoan, although many manage to survive.
answer: 모기도 외부 침입자인 원충을 퇴치하려 하지만 많은 놈이 살아남는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When a mosquito carrying a protozoan bites a victim, the protozoan multiplies inside the victim's red blood cells while avoiding the immune system's attack.
answer: 원충에 감염된 모기가 사람을 물면 사람의 적혈구 속에 들어가서 증식하고 인체의 면역 공격을 피한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It enters the brain and obstructs the cerebral blood artery, leading to a stroke, psychosis, and hallucinations.
answer: 뇌 침입 시 뇌혈관 자체를 막아서 뇌졸중, 정신병, 환각증을 일으킨다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Dengue fever, yellow fever, and Zika are all diseases brought on by viruses found in mosquitoes.
answer: 황열, 뎅기열, 지카는 모두 모기 내의 바이러스가 일으키는 병으로 말라리아처럼 발한, 고열이 난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Tu Youyou, a Nobel Prize winner, created an antimalarial medication.
answer: 노벨상 받은 투유유, 말라리아약 개발 우리나라에도 말라리아, 즉 학질이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. However, only 400 people get infected year, and the infection is of such a mild kind that getting sick is not a huge concern.
answer: 하지만 연간 400명 정도만 감염이 되고 그 정도도 약해서 ‘학질 떼듯’ 앓고 나면 큰일이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you don't take it simply because of the medication's side effects, it's the same as complaining your seat belt is stuffy.
answer: 혹시 있을 약의 부작용 때문에 안 먹는다면 안전벨트가 답답하다고 안 하는 것과 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Avoiding mosquito bites is more crucial than receiving injections and taking anti-inflammatory medications.
answer: 주사, 예방약보다 더 중요한 건 모기에게 안 물리는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Avoid skin contact as much as possible, use repellents and mosquito nets, and, if possible, stay in air-conditioned accommodations.
answer: 피부 노출을 최대한 막고 기피제, 모기장을 사용하고, 가능하면 에어컨이 있는 숙소를 택해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. On the team was a Chinese female scientist.
answer: 그 팀에 중국 여성 과학자가 한 사람 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In October 2014, Dr. Tu Youyou, who is well over 80 years old, was given China's first Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.
answer: 팔순을 훌쩍 넘어선 투유유 박사는 2014년 10월 중국 최초로 노벨생리의학상을 받았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Bill Gates said, "I want to fight malaria and other infectious diseases in underdeveloped countries in my lifetime.”.
answer: 빌 게이츠는 “살아 있는 동안 말라리아 등 후진국의 감염병을 퇴치하고 싶다”고 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 30 years of malaria research is now turning its attention to mosquitoes.
answer: 30년간 지속한 말라리아 연구는 이제 그 칼끝을 모기에게 겨누기 시작했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The emphasis is now firmly on prevention over cure, hence stopping the mosquitoes before they have a chance to transmit disease.
answer: 치료 대신 예방, 즉 모기가 질병을 옮기지 못하게 하는 방향으로 급선회 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Following an emergency that results in birth abnormalities, the Brazilian government plans to send in genetically modified non-biting mosquitoes.
answer: 기형아가 발생하는 비상사태가 발생하자 브라질 정부는 GM 내시모기를 현장 투입할 예정이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The growth of malaria mosquitoes and their protozoan is inhibited by bacteria that Australian researchers discovered in other insects.
answer: 호주 연구팀은 말라리아모기와 그 안의 원충을 못 자라게 하는 박테리아를 다른 곤충에서 찾아냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mosquitoes infected with this bacteria were successful in malaria prevention.
answer: 이 박테리아를 감염시킨 모기가 말라리아 예방에는 효과가 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unknown endemic disease was the biggest obstacle to the construction of the Panama Canal.
answer: 파나마 운하 공사의 가장 큰 난관은 원인을 모르는 풍토병이었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. France, who had previously succeeded in creating the Suez Canal, confidently attempted to build it in 1876, but gave up before even starting due to dying employees.
answer: 수에즈 운하 건설에 성공한 프랑스가 1876년 자신만만하게 건설을 시도했지만 죽어 나가는 인부들로 시작도 못 해 보고 두 손 들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Colonel William C. Gorgas, a medical officer, deduced that mosquitoes were the source of the endemic disease, and cleared 30 kilometers of wetlands and jungles in all directions.
answer: 의무 책임자인 윌리엄 고거스 대령은 풍토병의 원인이 ‘모기’라고 직감하고 사방 30㎞의 늪과 밀림을 제거했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Panama Canal opened as a result of 4,000 people using 600,000 gallons of oil to kill mosquitoes over the course of a year.
answer: 1년간 4,000명의 사람이 60만 갤런의 기름으로 모기 박멸을 한 덕분에 파나마 운하는 개통했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The only solution is to eradicate the malaria protozoan from the planet.
answer: 유일한 방법은 말라리아 원충을 지구상에서 없애는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it takes time to introduce and spread genetically modified mosquitoes into the wild and turn the rest into genetically modified mosquitoes.
answer: 즉 야생에 GM 모기를 방사, 번식해 모두 GM 모기로 바꾸려면 시간이 걸린다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The ideal strategy is to let the genetically modified mosquitoes spread like wildfire on their own.
answer: 가장 좋은 방법은 투입한 GM 모기가 산불처럼 스스로 퍼지게 해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, we created a genetically modified mosquito with a gene for an antibody that prevents malaria and a gene for radioactivity that transfers this gene to a partner gene.
answer: 즉 말라리아를 억제하는 항체유전자와 이 유전자를 ‘짝’의 유전자에 옮기는 ‘전파유전자’를 동시에 갖춘 GM 모기를 만들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because of the influence of a radioactive gene, the mosquito progeny produced by a female and a male mating have an antibody gene in their regular gene.
answer: 그 결과 암놈과 수놈의 ‘짝’ 사이에서 태어나는 자식 모기는 ‘전파유전자’의 힘으로 정상 유전자도 항체유전자를 가지게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All mosquito offspring will eventually contain the antibody gene due to a chain reaction, making it impossible for a malaria protozoan to survive.
answer: 결국 연쇄반응처럼 모든 자식 모기는 항체유전자를 가지고 되고, 따라서 말라리아 원충이 못 살게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All malaria-carrying yellow fever mosquitoes will have new antibody genes.
answer: 말라리아를 옮기는 ‘이집트숲모기’ 전체가 모두 새로운 항체유전자를 가지게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can eradicate them if you employ the non-biting gene rather than the malaria antibody gene.
answer: 만약 말라리아 항체유전자가 아니고 ‘내시’ 유전자를 사용한다면 씨를 말릴 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It will be more destructive and ecologically impactful than any other method used thus far.
answer: 지금까지의 어떤 방법보다도 파괴적이고 생태계 영향이 클 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Some groups believe that removing just one malaria mosquito out of 3,500 will have little impact on the ecology.
answer: 그러나 3,500종의 모기 중 말라리아모기 1종만을 제거한다면 생태계에 미치는 영향이 그리 크지 않을 것으로 예측하는 그룹도 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Malaria protozoans that are homeless may make arrangements with other mosquitos and relocate to new owners.
answer: 살 곳이 없어진 말라리아 원충이 다른 모기와 협약을 맺어서 새 주인에게로 이사 할지도 모른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I'm interested in the status of the mosquito elimination field experiment in Brazil.
answer: 브라질에서 시행 중인 모기 박멸 야외 실험의 진행 결과가 궁금하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Adults must take action to help African children who die from malaria every 30 seconds.
answer: 30초에 한 명씩 말라리아로 죽어가는 아프리카의 아이들을 구하기 위해서 어른들이 발 벗고 나서야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Five times as many cases of dengue fever have been reported globally in the past 20 years.
answer: 최근 20년간 세계적으로 뎅기열 환자는 5배나 늘었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Instead of trying to eradicate mosquitoes, we should investigate why they are moving into more subtropical regions.
answer: 모기의 박멸보다는 왜 그들이 점점 아열대로 퍼져나가는지 살펴야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We should heed the scientists' caution that global warming is the root of the problem.
answer: 그리고 그 원인이 지구온난화에 있다는 과학자의 경고에 귀 기울여야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An artificial enzyme that attaches to a gene in a plant or animal and uses it to cut a specific section of DNA in order to correct the issue by deleting the wrong portion of the gene.
answer: 동식물 유전자에 결합해 특정 DNA 부위를 자르는 데 사용하는 인공 효소로 유전자의 잘못된 부분을 제거해 문제를 해결합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A single gene can now be cut and replaced in days instead of months or years.
answer: 과거에는 유전자 하나를 잘라내고 새로 바꾸는 데 수개월에서 수년씩 걸리던 것이 이제는 며칠이면 가능해졌습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Multiple genes can even be edited at once.
answer: 한 번에 여러 군데의 유전자를 동시에 손볼 수도 있죠.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In an emergency due to a high fever and drop in blood pressure, he had to amputate his infected left leg.
answer: 고열과 함께 혈압이 떨어지는 응급상황 속에서 감염된 왼쪽 다리를 절단해야 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Japan has experienced a sharp rise in the frequency of food-eating bacteria in recent years, with 712 cases reported over the course of the last three years, leading to a fatality rate of about 30%.
answer: 최근 일본에서는 식인 박테리아가 급격히 늘어 3년간 712명이 감염돼 사망률이 30%에 육박했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These bacteria infected another foot a thousand years ago and claimed the lives of thousands of girls.
answer: 이 병원균들은 1000년 전 또 다른 발에 침투해서 수많은 소녀들의 목숨을 앗아갔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A six-year-old’s toe was broken and intentionally infected with broken glass.
answer: 여섯 살 난 여자아이의 발가락을 부러뜨리고 일부러 깨진 유리를 넣어 감염시켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. By soaking the foot in water mixed with animal blood and medicinal herbs, the necrotic area was removed.
answer: 동물의 피와 약초를 섞은 물에 발을 담가서 감염 괴사 부분을 떼어냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As many as 10% of the girls died from the resulting systemic infection.
answer: 이로 인한 전신 감염으로 사망한 소녀들이 10%에 달했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The toxin it exhales only necroses the soft flesh beneath the skin or muscles.
answer: 다만 내뿜는 독소로 피부나 근육 아래의 연한 살을 괴사시킨다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even if bacteria penetrates the skin barrier through a wound, it is only results in a mild boil.
answer: 행여 피부 상처로 피부상재균이 피부 장벽을 뚫고 들어간다 해도 가벼운 종기 정도로 그친다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to Cell, a renowned academic journal, these hemolytic streptococci bacteria break through the skin barrier, enter the human body, and then wait.
answer: 저명 학술지 ‘Cell’에 의하면 ‘용혈성 연쇄상구균’이라 불리는 이놈들은 피부 장벽을 뚫고 인체로 침입하면 일단 대기한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is due to the likelihood that only one or two attacks will set off the body’s immunity alert and cause them to be eradicated.
answer: 한두 놈이 공격해 봐야 인체의 면역 경보만 울려서 박멸되기 십상이기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When this signal is received, the surrounding invading bacteria rapidly grow in size and simultaneously open the gates.
answer: 이 신호를 받은 주변의 침입균들은 급속히 몸집을 불리고 동시에 포문을 연다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It's like an army waiting to attack an enemy; when an attack signal is received, it fires all the cannons at once and advances.
answer: 마치 군대가 적을 공격하기 위해 기다리다가 공격 신호를 받는 순간 모든 포를 동시에 쏘며 진격하는 것과 같다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When the immune system is not yet ready, the body experiences an all-out attack that causes a high fever and coma.
answer: 면역이 미처 준비가 안 된 틈에 전면 공격을 하는 통에 인체는 고열, 혼수상태가 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even when the infection is surgically removed and medications are delivered as soon as possible, 25% of patients die.
answer: 응급 수술로 감염 부분을 절제해내고 항생제를 급히 투여해도 25%가 사망한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. More than 70% of patients die if they are not appropriately handled in the emergency room and intensive care unit.
answer: 응급실, 중환자실에서 제대로 치료받지 못하면 70% 이상이 죽는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Japan, this antibiotic has been used five times as often in the last six years.
answer: 이 항생제는 일본에서 6년 사이 5배나 많이 사용되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reason flesh-eating bacteria are so common in Japan is that regular bacteria on the skin interacted with viruses, resulting in weaponized strains that were antibiotic resistant.
answer: 결국 식인 박테리아가 일본에서 기승을 떨치는 이유는 정상 피부상재균들이 바이러스와 밀매하면서 무기를 갖춘 변종이 나타났고 이놈들이 항생제 내성이 생긴 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, over 20% of all resistant bacteria in the US are flesh-eating bacteria.
answer: 실제 미국에서 식인 박테리아는 전체 내성균의 20%에 육박한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. We must brace ourselves for the spread of flesh-eating germs, as happened in Japan, where living conditions are comparable to ours.
answer: 생활환경이 우리와 유사한 일본에서 급증하고 있는 식인 박테리아를 우리는 대비해야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Superbacteria are spread through supermarket meat and hospital endoscopes used for medical exams.
answer: 슈퍼박테리아는 동네 슈퍼에서 사 온 고기에도, 병원의 건강검진 내시경에서도 옮는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The superbacteria from one patient was on the endoscope because it had not been thoroughly sanitized.
answer: 내시경이 제대로 소독이 안 돼서 다른 환자의 슈퍼박테리아에 감염된 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Some endoscopes have structural issues, and patients are equally concerned.
answer: 일부 내시경의 구조에 문제가 있었다지만 환자들이 불안하기는 마찬가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Superbacteria are especially prevalent in hospitals, where antibiotics are most commonly utilized.
answer: 항생제가 가장 많이 쓰이는 곳인 병원에 슈퍼박테리아가 제일 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In the internal intensive care unit of domestic university hospitals, resistant bacteria are present in 50% of the patients.
answer: 국내 대학병원 내과계 중환자실 환자의 50%가 내성균에 감염되어 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Superbacteria-infected patients have a worse treatment efficiency, resulting in increased mortality and a longer treatment time.
answer: 슈퍼박테리아에 감염된 환자는 치료 효율이 떨어져서 사망률도 높고 치료 기간도 길어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Barack Obama, the president of the United States, declared war on antibiotic-resistant bacteria in March 2015 and committed to fund a 1.3 trillion won budget.
answer: 2015년 3월 미국 버락 오바마 대통령은 항생제 내성균과의 전쟁을 선포하고 1조 3000억 원의 예산을 지원키로 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even in the United States, the country with the best medical facilities, two million instances of infection and 23,000 fatalities occur annually.
answer: 최고 의료시설을 가진 미국에서도 매년 200만 명의 감염 환자, 2만 3,000명의 사망자가 나온다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fleming was awarded the Nobel Prize in 1928 for his discovery of penicillin, the first antibiotic.
answer: 플레밍은 1928년 최초의 항생제인 페니실린을 찾아낸 공로로 노벨상을 받았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At the award ceremony, he predicted the emergence of penicillin-resistant bacteria.
answer: 하지만 수상식 자리에서 그는 페니실린 내성균이 나타날 것이라고 예언했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Resistant bacteria appeared 12 years after penicillin was discovered.
answer: 페니실린이 발견된 지 12년 뒤 내성균이 출현했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In 1950, tetracycline demonstrated resistant bacteria nine years after development.
answer: 이어서 1950년의 테트라사이클린은 9년 뒤 내성균이 나타났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When new antibiotics are used, resistant bacteria may evolve.
answer: 신규 항생제가 사용되면 내성균은 생길 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It will do its job in killing the bacteria, though there may be variations that survive.
answer: 죽이겠다는데 당연히 살아남는 변종이 생길 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Phytoncide, which is emitted by forest trees, also serves as an antibiotic, preventing mold and germs from adhering to the trees.
answer: 숲속에서 나무들이 내뿜는 피톤치드도 나무에 달라붙는 곰팡이, 세균들을 막아주는 항생제 역할을 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Resistant bacteria have emerged that block the antibiotics' entry point or degrade the antibiotics.
answer: 아예 항생제가 들어오는 구멍을 막아버리거나 항생제를 분해하는 내성균도 나타났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 44% of E.coli found in meat distributed in Korea are antibiotic-resistant, and 10.5% are multi-drug resistant.
answer: 국내 유통 중인 고기에서 분리한 대장균의 44%가 항생제 내성, 10.5%가 다 제내성이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic overuse ultimately results in resistant bacteria, which spread not only in hospitals but also throughout the rest of the world.
answer: 결국 내성균은 항생제 오남용으로 발생하고 병원뿐만 아니라 세상 곳곳에 퍼져 있다고 봐야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Currently, 30–50% of gonorrhea cases are penicillin-resistant due to the widely and regularly used antibiotics. There are two approaches to dealing with the problem of new antibiotic-resistant bacteria being discovered in 27 years.
answer: 쉽게 자주 쓰던 항생제 덕분에 지금 임질균의 30~50%가 페니실린 내성이다 흙에서 찾은 27년 만의 신규 항생제 내성균의 문제를 해결하는 방법은 두 가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Second, we must develop new, more potent antibiotics to combat resistant bacteria.
answer: 둘째는 내성균을 막을 강력한 새로운 항생제를 찾아야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The first is an issue for everyone, whereas the second is a problem for scientists.
answer: 첫째는 우리 모두의 문제이고 둘째는 과학자의 몫이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I can quickly recover if I take a lot of antibiotics, but others suffer fatal infections from resistant bacteria.
answer: 내가 항생제를 많이 쓰면 나는 쉽게 낫지만 다른 사람은 내성균으로 죽는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is why there needs to be strict government regulation around the misuse of antibiotics.
answer: 항생제 남용에 국가의 강력한 규제가 필요한 이유다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reason why new antibiotics are not being developed is because we feel we have found enough of them, and antibiotics are not worth a lot of money.
answer: 또한 새로운 항생제가 못 나오는 이유는 그동안 찾을 만큼 찾았고, 항생제가 큰돈이 안 되었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because the market for chronic disease drugs or anticancer drugs that are taken on a regular basis is higher than the market for antibiotics that cure the disease once given.
answer: 한 번 맞고 나면 병이 낫는 항생제보다는 계속 쓰이는 만성병 치료제나 항암제 시장이 크기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It cannot be postponed any longer due to the global proliferation of superbacteria.
answer: 하지만 지구촌 슈퍼박테리아의 확산으로 더 이상 미룰 수만은 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The problem that worries scientists is that all of the antibiotics have been discovered with the current method, and it is difficult to discover new ones.
answer: 정작 과학자들이 고민하는 문제는 그동안 찾을 만큼 찾아서 더 이상 지금의 방식으로는 새로운 항생제를 찾기가 힘들다는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Thirteen American athletes who were preparing for a yacht race on the lake experience abdominal pain.
answer: 요트 경기가 열릴 호수에서 미리 연습하던 미국 선수 13명이 집단 복통에 걸렸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, those who manufacture antibiotics have to be bred in a lab.
answer: 즉 항생제를 생산하는 놈들이 일단 실험실에 자라야 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. One gram of soil contains one million bacteria, but 99% of those cannot be cultivated in the laboratory.
answer: 하지만 흙 1g 속에 있는 백만 마리 균 중 99%는 실험실에서 못 자란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This allowed us to discover antibiotics that required a team effort to produce.
answer: 덕분에 여러 놈들이 합쳐야만 만드는 항생제도 찾을 수 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, it is not easy to find other alternatives and develop resistant bacteria.
answer: 즉 다른 대안을 찾아서 내성균이 생기기가 쉽지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After all, the superbacteria can only be eliminated by other bacteria in the soil.
answer: 결국 슈퍼박테리아를 죽일 수 있는 놈은 흙 속의 다른 균들이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Like MERS, flesh-eating bacteria and superbacteria are spread by direct contact with the outside world through coughing and sneezing.
answer: 식인 박테리아나 슈퍼박테리아는 메르스처럼 기침, 재채기 등 외부와의 접촉으로 옮는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The best basic defense is to wash the exposed areas thoroughly after going out.
answer: 외출 후 반드시 노출 부위를 잘 씻는 기본 방비가 최고다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. “There are no antibiotics in the Middle Ages.” Millions of people have avoided disease thanks to antibiotics.
answer: ‘중세에는 항생제가 없어.’ 항생제는 그동안 수많은 사람을 질병에서 구해냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic overuse has led to the development of resistant bacteria, but humanity will learn from this and find a way to overcome it.
answer: 비록 인류가 항생제 남용으로 내성균의 역풍을 맞고 있지만, 인류는 이를 교훈 삼아 넘어설 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The global community must now pool its collective intelligence in order to prepare for war against super-resistant bacteria.
answer: 이제 지구촌은 슈퍼내성균과의 전쟁 준비에 모든 지혜를 모아야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because the hair is exposed to the outside, infectious diseases can easily enter it.
answer: 털은 외부에 노출되어 있어서 쉽게 병원균이 침입합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It could be bacteria on the skin that previously existed there, or it could be an invading bacteria from outside.
answer: 원래 피부에 살던 피부상재균일 수도 있고 외부 침입균일 수도 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A fight ensues when these bacteria infiltrate through the skin membrane.
answer: 이들 균이 피부막을 통과해서 들어 오면 전투가 벌어지지요.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Acne, on the other hand, is an inflammatory condition caused by hormonal changes.
answer: 반면에 여드름은 염증이지만 원인은 호르몬 변화에 의한 것입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. That is, when reaching puberty, the sebaceous glands linked to the hair follicles become active due to androgens, which are male hormones.
answer: 즉 사춘기에 들어서면서 남성호르몬인 안드로겐의 영향으로 모낭에 붙어 있는 피지선이 활발해지게 됩니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Waste materials collect in the hair follicle as keratinization of the hair follicle increases.
answer: 또한 모낭의 각질화가 늘어나면서 노폐물이 모낭에 쌓입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Acne bacteria grows on the skin, creating fatty acids, which are irritating compounds.
answer: 여기에 피부상재균인 여드름균이 자라면서 자극적인 물질인 지방산이 생성됩니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Antibiotic-resistant infectious diseases are simply referred to as superbacteria.
answer: 병원균 중에 항생제에 내성이 강한 놈을 슈퍼박테리아라고 부르는 것뿐입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Washing exposed skin, such as the face and hands, with soap after leaving the house is another preventative measure.
answer: 외출 후에는 균이 붙을 만한 피부, 즉 얼굴, 손 등 노출되었던 피부를 비누로 씻어내는 것도 예방이 됩니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If you live or die, pus trapped all over leaves the body pockmarked.
answer: 온몸에 고름이 잡혀 죽거나 설사 살아남아도 얼굴이 얽게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Joseon Dynasty was not immune to the smallpox virus that was ravaging Europe at the time.
answer: 당시 유럽을 초토화하던 천연두 바이러스에 조선도 예외는 아니었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Ji Seok-young, a follower of a Japanese news agency in the late Joseon Dynasty, learned the procedure of immunization and injected the virus directly into a relative’s child.
answer: 조선 말기 일본통신사를 따라갔던 지석영이 종두법을 배워 와서 친척 아이에게 직접 주사했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This courage to risk the family’s health has saved countless people from the smallpox virus.
answer: 가족의 위험을 무릅쓴 용기 덕분에 사람들은 천연두 바이러스에서 벗어나게 됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since long before humans were even born, viruses have been in every plant and animal on the planet.
answer: 바이러스는 인류 탄생 이전부터 지구상의 모든 동식물 속에 들어가 살고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Viruses, especially smallpox, have threatened humankind on occasion.
answer: 천연두를 포함해서 바이러스는 간간이 인류를 공격해 왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS is a member of the coronavirus family, which has only caused colds in the last 30 years.
answer: 메르스가 속한 코로나바이러스 집안은 지난 30년 동안 감기 정도만을 일으켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Last year, they killed 40% of infected people in the Middle East.
answer: 그런 놈들이 지난해 중동에서는 감염자의 40%를 사망하게 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. TV celebrities take part in a military training program.
answer: TV 스타들이 군부 대의 훈련 프로그램에 참여한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In this program, ‘real men,’ those with significant physical strength, are decisively filtered out on the guerrilla field.
answer: 이 프로그램에서 ‘진짜 사나이’, 즉 강한 체력의 소유자가 결정적으로 걸러지는 곳은 유격장이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Viruses must also be diverse and dangerous in order to evolve and survive in the bodies of animals.
answer: 바이러스도 진화하려면 다양해지고 독해져야 동물의 몸속에서 살아남는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In reality, being bitten by a bat will cause you to contract AIDS, SARS, or MERS.
answer: 현실에서는 박쥐에게 물리면 에이즈, 사스, 메르스에 걸리게 된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A mutant virus that can endure high temperatures and harmful substances grows in the body of a bat. There are two reasons why bats are being used as a guerrilla training ground for the real virus.
answer: 박쥐 몸에서는 고온과 독성물질 공격에도 견디는 변성 바이러스가 길러진다 박쥐가 ‘진짜 바이러스’를 키우는 유격훈련장인 이유는 두 가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is the world's second most populous mammal after mice, making it a virus hotbed.
answer: 세상의 포유동물 중에서 쥐 다음으로 수가 많아서 ‘바이러스 온상’이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Because they live in a cave, they can easily spread the infection to one another.
answer: 게다가 동굴에서 같이 뭉쳐 살다 보니 서로 바이러스 전달도 쉽다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The second reason bats are a better virus breeding ground than field mice is because of their body temperature.
answer: 하지만 박쥐가 들쥐보다 ‘진짜 바이러스’ 훈련장인 둘째 이유는 박쥐의 체온이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When bats begin to fly, their body temperature rises to 40° Celsius.
answer: 박쥐는 날기 시작하면 체온이 무려 40도까지 올라간다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because a bat's metabolic rate when flying is 16 times higher than normal.
answer: 박쥐가 날면 평상시보다 대사 속도가 16배 높아지기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Only real viruses, i.e. those with exceptional heat resistance, may survive in such a hot bat body.
answer: 이런 고온의 박쥐 체내에서 ‘진짜 바이러스, 즉 열에 강한 독한 놈들만 살아남는다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is a higher chance of heat-resistant poisonous kinds emerging from all sorts of strange places.
answer: 별별 이상한 놈들이 다 만들어지니 그중에서 열에 견디는 독종이 나올 확률이 더 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mutations occur regularly throughout the process of reproducing genetic information in order to increase the number of viruses that enter the body.
answer: 체내에 침투한 뒤 바이러스를 늘리기 위해 유전정보를 복제하는 과정에서 돌연변이가 잘 일어난다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The body's self-defense strategy is to eliminate the heat-resistant intruder virus.
answer: 열에 약한 침입자 바이러스를 죽이려는 몸의 자구책이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Poisonous species selected as 'real viruses' are resistant to human high-temperature operations.
answer: 하지만 ‘진짜 바이러스’로 선발된 독종들은 인간의 고온 작전에도 끄떡없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The bat's 16-fold increased metabolic rate produces free oxygen, a hazardous substance.
answer: 게다가 16배나 높아진 박쥐의 대사 속도는 독성 물질인 ‘활성산소’를 만들어낸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Like the black exhaust gas released by a fast-moving diesel car, deadly free oxygen is produced inside the bat and kills the virus that enters the body.
answer: 디젤차가 급히 달리면 배출되는 검은 배기가스처럼 독한 활성산소가 박쥐 내부에서 만들어져 체내에 들어온 바이러스를 죽인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The virus that survives the free oxygen bombardment is extremely toxic.
answer: 이런 ‘활성산소 폭격’ 속에서도 살아남는 바이러스가 진짜 독한 놈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A 'human-only killer virus' will emerge if these viruses evolve into a form that can infect humans.
answer: 만약 이놈들이 사람에게 침투가 가능한 형태로까지 변한다면 ‘인간 전용 킬러 바이러스’가 생긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In fact, the coronavirus was already altered to enter human cells when American researchers looked at it in bats.
answer: 실제로 미국의 연구진이 박쥐 체내의 코로나바이러스를 조사해 보니 이미 인간 세포를 뚫고 들어갈 수 있도록 변형돼 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Despite their superb flight abilities, bats only carry the virus close to their habitat.
answer: 박쥐가 잘 날아다니기는 하지만 서식지 근방에서만 바이러스를 옮긴다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are already warning signs that a virus is about to wreak havoc on human society.
answer: 바이러스가 인간 사회로 몰려나오는 징조는 이미 나타나기 시작했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. People began to fall one by one as a result of fever, headache, drowsiness, and dizziness.
answer: 열, 두통, 졸림, 어지럼증으로 사람들이 하나둘 쓰러졌다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medical personnel determined that it was Japanese encephalitis and concentrated on mosquito eradication in the area.
answer: 의료진은 일본뇌염으로 판단하고 그 지역의 모기 박멸에 집중했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The first viruses discovered were those isolated from pigs and patients.
answer: 돼지와 환자의 몸에서 분리한 바이러스는 처음 보는 놈이었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was named the Nipah virus after the city where it first appeared.
answer: 발생한 도시 이름을 따서 ‘니파 바이러스’라는 이름이 붙었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Pigs are contaminated by the Nipah virus through bat droppings.
answer: 박쥐 속에 살던 니파 바이러스가 박쥐의 배설물을 타고 돼지를 감염시켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This wild virus spreads to humans all over the world for three reasons.
answer: 이렇게 야생에 있던 바이러스가 지구촌 구석구석의 사람에게 널리 퍼지는 이유는 세 가지다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. First, there was more contact with wild animals; second, livestock served as an intermediary; and third, the global community became a daily living zone.
answer: 첫째, 야생동물 접촉이 많아졌고 둘째, 가축이 중간 전달자 역할을 하고 셋째, 지구촌이 하루 생활권이 된 덕분이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since humans began hunting, there has been an increase in wildlife contact.
answer: 야생동물 접촉은 인간이 사냥을 시작한 이래 계속 늘어났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Wild animals cause 60% of all human diseases.
answer: 인간 질병의 60%가 모두 야생동물에게서 오고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Humans have reached a dead end and can no longer avoid a battle with the virus.
answer: 인간은 바이러스와의 일전을 피할 수 없는 막다른 길로 스스로 들어선 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is not an easy conflict if it is a virus that is not only infected through physical contact, such as smallpox, but is also transferred through the respiratory system, i.e., air.
answer: 게다가 천연두처럼 신체 접촉에 의해서만 감염되는 것이 아니라 호흡기, 즉 공기로도 전염이 되는 바이러스라면 쉽지 않은 전쟁이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The entire globe must brace itself for the impending viral storm. The injection of smallpox pus into the human body was the beginning of inoculation. Lady Montagu was an 18th-century British socialite.
answer: 지구촌 세계는 다가오는 바이러스의 대폭풍을 준비해야 한다 천연두 고름 인체 주입이 백신의 시초 몽태규 백작부인은 18세기 영국 사교계에서 내로라하는 여성이었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. At that time, she heard a story of an Indian traditional cure that involved taking the pus of a smallpox patient and injecting it straight into a person’s skin.
answer: 그러던 와중 그녀는 천연두 환자의 고름을 피부에 직접 찌르는 인도 민간요법 이야기를 들었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. She used it on her son to protect him against smallpox.
answer: 하지만 그녀는 아들에게 그 방법을 사용했고 아들들을 천연두로부터 지켜냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A woman's bravery and devotion spared humanity from the virus's danger.
answer: 한 여인의 용기와 헌신이 인류를 바이러스의 위험으로부터 구한 셈이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The greatest method of preventing a virus is to build up immunity beforehand with a vaccination, or a substance created to mimic a virus.
answer: 바이러스에는 백신, 즉 ‘바이러스처럼 만든 물질’로 면역을 미리 준비시켜 놓는 방법이 최선의 예방책이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For scientists, developing a MERS vaccine is not that challenging.
answer: 메르스 백신을 만드는 것은 과학자들에게 그리 어려운 일이 아니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In Korea, there is presently no vaccine or cure for MERS.
answer: 하지만 현재 한국에는 메르스 백신이나 치료제가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It costs hundreds of billions of dollars to develop, but no one in Africa can afford or utilize these vaccines.
answer: 개발 비용이 수천억 원이나 들지만 이런 백신을 아프리카에서 사서 쓸 사람이 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. As with SARS and MERS, the situation is rapidly shifting.
answer: 하지만 사스나 메르스의 경우처럼 상황이 급변하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is also very contagious and, most importantly, can travel to the opposite side of the world in a single day.
answer: 전염성도 강해지고 무엇보다 하루 만에 지구 반대편까지 날아간다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For highly contagious viruses, early isolation is preferable, and vaccinations are the last line of defense.
answer: 전파력이 강한 바이러스에는 초기 격리가 최선이고 백신이 최후 방어책이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Humanity has eradicated smallpox with a vaccine thanks to Lady Montagu and Jenner.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now is the moment to brace for a new species virus storm, akin to a second smallpox outbreak.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. They spread for a variety of reasons, but one of the most common is that people frequently come into contact with the intermediary host animals that transmit them.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. For example, bats should only be found in jungle areas, but as humans advance deeper into the jungle, they come into contact with them.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Viruses swarm to the animals as the forest gets smaller, causing outbreaks to erupt.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Humans have an increasing number of opportunities to come into contact with viruses as the number of livestock serving as the link between humans and wild animals as hosts rises.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In a port city hospital with an oasis nearby, a patient arrived.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The kidney dialysis area, the general ward, and the intensive care unit were the locations where the infection was spread.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The projecting part adheres to human cells there. Surprisingly, it is comparable to the MERS situation in Korea.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Before receiving a MERS diagnosis in Korea, the first infected patient, a 68-year-old man, visited three different hospitals.
answer: 한국에서는 68세의 최초 감염자가 메르스 확진 판정을 받기 전까지 세 곳의 병원을 옮겨 다녔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Numerous individuals were infected by the first confirmed patient.
answer: 최초 확진 환자한테 감염된 사람이 수십 명이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It can induce a lung infection with high fever, cough and shortness of breath.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS first appeared in the Middle East in 2012 and persisted until 2014.
answer: 메르스는 2012년 중동 지방에서 최초 발병 후 2013~2014년에 지속해서 나타났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is no scientifically validated data on transmission rate, manner of transmission, fatality, defense methods, and so forth.
answer: 전파 속도와 전파 방법, 사망률, 방어책 등에 대한 과학적 검증 데이터가 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It seems like only yesterday that the entire world trembled in fear of the Ebola virus.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS was suspected as a result of a high temperature, coughing, and travel to the Middle East.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The Korea Centers for Disease Control and Prevention examined the region after a day and a half, saying that the area visited was not a MERS area.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The wife of the first patient, as well as the patient and guardian in the same room, were all afflicted.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There is no certainty that MERS will follow the same trend in the Middle East and Korea.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Following the first outbreak in the Red Sea coastal region in 2012, the number of MERS outbreaks climbed gradually in April 2014.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The African Ebola outbreak region is the poorest in the world, with a per capita income of $1,000 and inadequate medical facilities.
answer: 하지만 아프리카의 에볼라 발생 지역은 국민소득 1,000달러 수준으로 세계에서 가장 가난하고 의료시설이 열악하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The possibility of transmission through air-conditioning or air transmission cannot be ruled out.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In one hospital, dozens of people were infected at the same time.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is vital to determine if the first infected person was a ‘superinfected person’ with a lot of virus eruptions or because of the inpatient ward’s poor structure.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The crucial thing to remember is that there is no scientifically validated data about MERS.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. That is, in instances where you don't know what to do, you must constantly be prepared for any scenario.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Contacts and containment personnel sat like adversaries at opposite ends of the bus.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The patient is wearing a mask, and the health worker is wearing a mask, goggles, and hazmat suit.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS and SARS are viruses of the same family that assault the respiratory system.
answer: 메르스, 사스는 호흡기를 공격하는 같은 계열의 바이러스다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The virus in these tiny droplets flying one meter is transferred by clinging to the mucous membranes of the other person's eyes, nose, and mouth.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Simply being in the same room or passing by does not guarantee infection.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The virus in the respiratory tract combines with secretions from coughing and sneezing and infects those who have no contact with the patient.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. To eradicate the virus, you should wash your hands frequently and wash your hands, feet, face, and other exposed areas with soap after going out.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If MERS escapes its current state and spreads across the country, we must fight it more vigorously.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Avoid crowded areas and wear a mask if necessary.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. People with weakened respiratory systems should be especially cautious.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Not everyone with a mild fever and cough should be checked for MERS.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Always keep an eye on who you're in contact with and whether you have a fever or a cough.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Camels are not guilty, but the companion virus is. Camel rides are the highlight of desert travel.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, there were many animal infections, but direct contact with infected people rose in 2013 and 2014.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. More than 60% of cases did not involve secondary infections.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. According to the WHO and the CDC in the United States, SARS can be spread through the air.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Both are caused by the same beta-coronavirus species and cause similar respiratory symptoms.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Wild animal viruses are easily spread to humans via livestock. Camels appear to be the cause of this condition as a host, however they are not guilty.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The MERS virus, the camel's mate, infiltrated the human body for unknown reasons.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All of these are RNA viruses that mutate easily.
answer: 이놈들은 모두 변이가 잘 일어나는 RNA 바이러스다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a dense and connected global community, with frequent contact with wild viruses via livestock and virus habitats in diminished jungles.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In that regard, it is hardly accidental that there are more virus outbreaks now than ever before.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The United States CDC, which is in the southern part of the country, northeast of Atlanta, Georgia, experienced an emergency in May 2014.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS was discovered in two Middle Eastern travelers after they developed a high fever and cough.
answer: 중동을 다녀온 두 명의 여행자가 고열, 기침에 시달린 뒤 메르스 확진 판정을 받은 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Immediately, samples from 495 individuals from hospitals around the United States who had a high fever and cough were gathered and tested.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Fortunately, no other infections were discovered.
answer: 다행히 발견된 두 명 외의 감염자는 없었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In other words, without waiting for confirmation, 50 doctors who had come in contact with the patient were immediately quarantined.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The United States started a new contrast right away, namely research.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even though MERS and SARS are related, they discovered that the invasion method is different.
answer: 메르스가 사스와 사촌이지만 침입 방법이 다른 것도 알아냈다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Korea, on the other hand, ignored the information that the patient had MERS symptoms and flew to the Middle East, far from preparing for it.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The majority of deaths in Saudi Arabia were caused by illness.
answer: 사우디아라비아는 사망자 중 다수가 병이 있었던 사람들이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Korea has already responded admirably to the bird flu and SARS outbreaks, with no severe concerns.
answer: 한국은 이미 조류인플루엔자, 사스 발병 때 큰 문제 없이 잘 대응했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The transmission of baseless scaremongering via social media, for example, can result in the MERS virus spreading.
answer: 하지만 SNS 등을 통한 근거 없는 유언비어의 확산은 메르스 바이러스를 키우는 결과가 될 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is a warning that the MERS virus, which is spreading, may eventually enter its oblivious mouth.
answer: 퍼지는 메르스 바이러스가 결국 그 무지한 입으로 들어갈 수 있다는 경고다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. MERS arrived in Korea in 2015 and killed 36 people, prompting the development of a vaccine.
answer: 2015년 한국에 메르스가 상륙하여 36명 사망자가 나온 후 백신 개발 중입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. INOVIO Pharmaceuticals' DNA vaccine is exhibiting approximately 92% clinical effectiveness.
answer: 이노비오 제약회사가 개발 중인 DNA 백신은 약 92% 임상효과를 보이고 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is expected to be usable and completed soon after all clinical trials are finished.
answer: 임상실험이 모두 끝나면 사용 가능할 것으로 판단하며 조만간 완료될 것으로 기대하고 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. He graduated from the Department of Agricultural Biology at the Seoul National University and received his Ph.D in Virus Research from Giessen University in Germany.
answer: 서울대학교 농생물학과를 졸업하였고, 독일 기센대학교에서 바이러스 연구로 박사학위를 받았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. He completed his postdoctoral studies at the Max Planck Institute for Biochemistry in Germany.
answer: 독일 막스 플랑크 생화학연구소에서 박사 후 과정을 마쳤다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Microbiology is a field that is recently receiving many people's attention among many other disciplines included in the natural sciences.
answer: 나는 이 책을 미생물학은 요즈음 자연과학에 포함되어 있는 여러 학문 중에서 많은 사람들의 관심을 끌고 있는 분야이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are a lot of aspects of microbiology that people do not accurately understand.
answer: 미생물학에 대해서 사람들이 제대로 이해하지 못하는 부분이 많이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Scientists should explain their knowledge in plain language for many people to understand it with joy.
answer: 과학자들은 자신들이 알고 있는 지식을 쉬운 말로 풀어서 많은 사람들이 즐거운 마음으로 이해할 수 있도록 해주어야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is because that is the popularization of science, which leads to the scientification of the general public.
answer: 그것이 바로 과학의 대중화이며, 더 나아가 대중의 과학화라는 결과로 이어지기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The reason I wrote this book is to explain microorganisms, which many people regard difficult, in an easy, conversational way.
answer: 나는 많은 사람들이 어렵다고 생각하는 미생물에 대해서 이야기하듯이 쉽게 풀어 설명하고자 이 책을 썼다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I hope my thoughts and efforts can be of help, however small, for more people to understand microbes.
answer: 나의 생각과 노력이 많은 사람들에게 조금이나마 미생물을 이해하는 데 도움이 되기를 바란다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Having a clearer understanding of the invisible world of microbes will make the world look like they are in natural colors.
answer: 보이지 않는 미생물의 세계를 보다 확실히 알게 되면 그 세계는 천연색으로 뚜렷하게 보일 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I would like to continue my little efforts until the unknown, blurry microbial world, which is black and white, turns into a natural-colored garden of beautiful colors.
answer: 무엇인지 모르는 흐릿한 흑백의 미생물 세계가 아름다운 색깔을 드러내는 천연색 동산으로 바뀌게 될 때까지 내 자그마한 노력을 계속하고 싶다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. My friend in life, microbes The twinkling stars in the night sky are so far away, which is why they look very small even to us.
answer: 생활 속의 내 친구, 미생물 밤하늘에 반짝이는 별은 아주 멀리 떨어져 있으므로 우리가 보기에도 아주 작아 보인다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You can see only a few stars when looking with the naked eye, but a telescope enables you to see more stars in greater detail.
answer: 눈으로 바라보는 경우에는 얼마 볼 수 없는 별이지만, 망원경으로 보면 더 많은 별을 더 자세히 볼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using a high-performance telescope enables you to bring the fuzzy stars closer and see them in more detail, as if you were looking at them from the side.
answer: 성능이 좋은 망원경을 이용하면 가물가물하게 보이던 별들을 가까이 끌어와 마치 곁에서 보는 것처럼 좀 더 자세히 볼 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. In order to see small objects that is difficult to see with a naked eye, you use a magnifying glass. .
answer: 맨눈으로 보기 어려운 작은 크기의 것을 보려면 돋보기를 이용한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since a magnifying glass is made of cut glass, it is difficult to enlarge the lens more than 5 to 10 times no matter how good the magnifying glass might be.
answer: 돋보기는 유리를 깎아 만든 것이기에 아무리 성능이 좋은 돋보기라도 5~10배 이상으로 확대하기는 어렵다.
