prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The in vitro diagnosis is more a platform business than a razor business The coronavirus has indeed transformed many things.
answer: 면도기 비즈니스보다 플랫폼 비즈니스인 체외진단 코로나바이러스는 정말 많은 것들을 바꾸었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The skyrocketing global demand for COVID-19 diagnostic kits led it to record sales of 356.6 billion won and an operating profit margin of 58.5% in the first half of 2020 alone, illustrating the essence of the razor business’s charms and the effect of operating leverage.
answer: 세계적인 코로나바이러스 진단키트 수요 폭증으로 2020년 상반기에만 매출액 3,566억 원, 영업이익률 58.5%를 기록하며 면도기 비즈니스의 매력과 영업 레버리지 효과의 진수를 보여주었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Having reached 166.3 billion won because of the 2009 swine flu outbreak, the influenza-related medical expenses of domestic health insurance dropped sharply to 20.3 billion won in 2011.
answer: 2009년에 발생한 신종플루로 인해 1,663억 원까지 상승했던 국내 건강보험의 인플루엔자 관련 진료비는 2011년 203억 원으로 급감했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The discovery of new biomarkers is like developing a new drug F in the bio industry.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Starting with the initial visual diagnosis method, a wide range of technology was introduced to in vitro diagnosis, including microscopy, the chemical enzyme method, the culture method, the antigen-antibody reaction method, and the PCR method.
answer: 체외진단은 초기 육안을 이용한 진단법을 시작으로 현미경, 화학효소법, 배양법, 항원-항체반응법, PCR 기법 등 다양한 기술들이 도입됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. PCR testing, for example, is able to diagnose coronavirus more accurately than antigen-antibody testing, but antigen-antibody testing is known to be more useful for managing the infected.
answer: 예를 들어 PCR 검사는 항원-항체반응 검사보다 더 정확하게 코로나바이러스를 진단할 수 있지만 감염자 관리는 항원-항체반응 검사가 더 유용하다고 알려져 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This interesting fact that for in vitro diagnostics, the latest technology cannot wholly replace other technology can be explained by reasons roughly divided into 'economics' and 'test output'.
answer: 체외진단에서 최신 기술이 다른 기술을 완벽하게 대체하지 못한다는 이 흥미로운 사실은 크게 ‘경제성’과 ‘검사 산출량’의 이유로 설명할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Sales Proportion of Roche and Quest The best part of the immunochemical diagnosis or blood diagnosis is that their automated test process renders the test cost very low.
answer: 로슈와 퀘스트의 매출 비중 면역화학진단이나 혈액진단의 가장 큰 장점은 검사 과정이 자동화가 이루어져 검사단가가 매우 낮다는 점이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The qRT-PCR method is the most widely used PCR technique today.
answer: 현재 가장 널리 사용되는 PCR 기술은 qRT-PCR 기법이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since the qRT-PCR technology amplifies a specific DNA or RNA region of a virus for testing, it is sensitive enough to be able to make a diagnosis using only a small amount of virus.
answer: qRT-PCR 기술은 바이러스의 특정 DNA나 RNA 부위를 증폭하여 검사하기 때문에 미량의 바이러스만으로도 진단이 가능할 정도로 민감도가 높다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This is where the hesitation between 'a faster test method' and 'a more sensitive test method' begins.
answer: ‘더 빠른 검사 방법’과 ‘더 높은 민감도의 검사 방법’에 대한 고민이 시작된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While both techniques can perfectly complement the shortcomings of qRT-PCR technology, it is unlikely for them to replace the qRT-PCR technology completely.
answer: 두 가지 기술 모두 qRT-PCR 기술의 부족한 점을 훌륭하게 보완할 수 있지만 qRT-PCR 기술을 완전히 대체하기는 힘들다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. ID Now is an isothermal amplification method, which speeds up the test by shortening the length of the amplified nucleic acid, unlike qRT-PCR, a method of repeatedly raising and lowering the temperature.
answer: 온도를 내렸다 올리기를 반복하는 방식인 qRT-PCR과 달리 아이디나우는 등온증폭 방식이며 증폭하는 핵산 길이를 짧게 해 검사 속도를 단축할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. qRT-PCR can conduct 96 to 200 tests at a time in most cases, which means that a test method like ID Now may be less economical if the amount of tests explosively increases as in the case of coronavirus.
answer: qRT-PCR은 보통 96~200개 이상 검사를 한 번에 할 수 있으므로 아이디나우ID Now 같은 검사 방식은 코로나바이러스처럼 검사량이 폭발적으로 증가할 때는 오히려 경제성이 떨어질 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The detection limit of qRT-PCR technology makes it necessary for it to have at least 100 copies of RNA virus to detect the virus.
answer: qRT-PCR 기술은 검출한계로 인해 RNA 바이러스가 100카피는 있어야 바이러스를 검출할 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. qRT-PCR is far better in terms of both economic efficiency and yield If the gene to be detected is clear like in the case of coronavirus.
answer: 코로나바이러스처럼 검출해야 하는 유전자가 명확하다면 경제성과 산출량 모두 qRT-PCR이 월등하게 좋다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Discovering biomarkers that are far more important than diagnostic techniques The most classic management strategy and method to penetrate the market in the medical device industry is M&A.
answer: 진단기법보다 훨씬 중요한 바이오마커 발굴 의료기기 산업의 가장 교과서적인 경영 전략이자 시장 침투 방식은 인수합병이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Adaptive Biotechnology, which is equipped with the technology to study the adaptive immune system, or 10xGenomics, the manufacturer of the equipment that analyzes the sequencing of single cells, recorded market capitalizations of $6.6 billion and $10.3 billion, respectively, after their listing in 2019.
answer: 적응면역계를 연구하기 위한 기술을 갖춘 어댑티브 바이오테크놀로지스나 단일세포의 염기서열을 분석하는 장비를 제조하는 10x지노믹스는 2019년 상장된 후 각각 시가총액 66억 달러, 103억 달러를 기록하기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is closely related to the three key stakeholders of the medicare system, namely health insurers and large global companies.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The price can be set based on value, not on cost.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Prevalence and business model are more important than sensitivity and specificity In March, when the coronavirus was spreading rapidly in Korea, the whole country was in chaos.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A term frequently used in in-vitro diagnostics It is because of the positive predictive value.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A high prevalence rate means that there are many breast cancer diagnosis companies.
answer: 유병률이 높은 만큼 유방암 진단 업체가 많다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This company is well-known for the test that the American actress Angelina Jolie took before the removal of her breast.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 23andMe's tests cost only around $200 in contrast to Myriad Genetics, which costs thousands of dollars.
answer: 몇천 달러가 소요되는 미리어드제네틱스와 달리 23앤드미의 검사는 200달러 수준에 불과하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 23andMe uses saliva to test only 3 mutations present in BRCA1 and BRCA2, in contrast to Myriad Genetics, which tests over 20,000 genetic mutations, including BRCA1, BRCA2, CDH1, PTEN, TP53, ATM, CHEK2, and PALB2.
answer: BRCA1, BRCA2, CDH1, PTEN, TP53, ATM, CHEK2, PALB2 등 2만 개가 넘는 유전변이를 검사하는 미리어드제네틱스와 달리 23앤드미는 타액을 활용해 BRCA1와 BRCA2에 존재하는 단 3개의 돌연변이만을 검사한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While the number of genetic variants tested is important, it is more important that these three genetic variants are observed only in certain races in most cases.
answer: 검사하는 유전변이의 개수도 개수지만 이 세 개의 유전변이는 특정 인종에서만 주로 관찰되는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration is clearly warning 23andMe that negative test results do not mean being completely free from the risk of breast cancer, despite having approved its testing service.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Things that are more important to individual genetic testing companies than expanding test items Individual genetic testing companies provide services that analyze an individual's genetic traits to predict their drug susceptibility, physical characteristics, or the probability that the person develops a specific disease.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The enterprise value of 23andMe's is evaluated to be $2.5 billion, and the company was attracting attention as one of the next-generation unicorns.
answer: 23앤드미의 기업가치는 25억 달러로 평가되며 차세대 유니콘 중 하나로 주목받고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Illumina', the top company in the genetic analysis equipment industry, is the largest test panel provider for these individual genetic testing companies.
answer: 이들 개인 유전자 검사 업체들에 검사패널을 제공하는 가장 큰 업체가 유전자 분석 장비 업계의 최강자인 ‘일루미나’라는 기업이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Individual genetic testing companies are also known as ‘genetic testing for fun’ in the U.S.
answer: 미국에서는 개인 유전자 검사 업체들을 일컬어 재미로 하는 유전검사라고도 부른다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are almost no cases where much is known about diseases caused by the genetic trait itself, excluding rare genetic diseases or specific hereditary cancers.
answer: 유전형질 자체가 원인이 되는 질병은 희귀유전질환이나 특정 유전성 암을 제외하면 밝혀진 바가 거의 없다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Individual genetic testing companies in the U.S. used to rule an era, with the discovery of the 'killer app' called pedigree analysis.
answer: 미국 개인 유전자 검사 업체들은 혈통분석이라는 ‘킬러 앱’을 발굴해 한 시대를 풍미했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 23andme also signed R&D partnership development with GlaxoSmithKline GSK, Genentech, etc., using the data obtained this way.
answer: 그 덕에 얻은 데이터로 23앤드미는 글락소스미스클라인GSK, 제넨테크 등과 연구개발 파트너십 개발을 체결하기도 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Follow-up and tracking studies need to be conducted over a long time to understand the effect of genetic traits on disease.
answer: 유전형질이 질병에 미치는 영향에 대해서는 오랜 후속·추적 연구가 필요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You need the 'phenotypic data of a person with a specific genetic trait' as well if the value of that data is to increase.
answer: ‘특정 유전형질을 지니는 사람의 표현형 데이터’를 함께 가지고 있어야 그 데이터의 가치가 커진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was their possession of phenotypic data that enabled Andme and GlaxoSmithKline to form research partnerships with a global biotech company like Genentech.
answer: 앤드미가 글락소스미스클라인이 제넨테크 같은 세계적인 바이오 기업과 연구 파트너십을 맺을 수 있었던 것도 모두 표현형 데이터를 함께 가지고 있었기 때문이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The future of the domestic in vitro diagnostic industry The in vitro diagnosis is more a platform business than a razor business Coronavirus has indeed changed a lot of things.
answer: 국내 체외진단산업의 미래 면도기 비즈니스보다 플랫폼 비즈니스인 체외진단 코로나바이러스는 정말 많은 것들을 바꾸었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. One of the hottest keywords regarding the coronavirus in 2020 is undoubtedly telemedicine.
answer: 2020년 코로나바이러스로 가장 히트 친 키워드 중 하나는 누가 뭐래도 원격의료일 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Three-phase growth strategies of U.S. and Chinese telemedicine companies It has been proven in many companies that telemedicine is significant for public purposes.
answer: 미중 원격의료 업체들의 3단계 성장 전략 원격의료가 공공 목적으로 유의미하다는 것은 코로나바이러스로 인해 여러 나라에서 증명됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Even Korea, where people are very defensive against telemedicine, has temporarily allowed it.
answer: 심지어 원격의료에 상당히 보수적인 우리나라조차도 한시적으로 원격의료를 허용한 상황이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Teladoc's telemedicine sales accounted for only 16.3% of total sales, and Pyeongyang Good Doctor only 16.9% in 2019.
answer: 2019년 텔라닥의 원격의료 매출은 전체 매출의 16.3%, 평안굿닥터의 원격의료 매출은 16.9%에 불과했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Teladoc had 23.7 million more customers in 2019 than in 2018.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Over 57% of all U.S. businesses and 99% of businesses with 200 or more employees are providing their employees with health and wellness programs.
answer: 미국 전체 기업의 57% 이상과 200명 이상 기업의 99%는 직원들에게 건강복지 프로그램을 제공하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It uses the Pyeongan Life Insurance app to provide telemedicine services and launched Health 360, a product exclusively accessed by its customers.
answer: 평안생명보험 앱을 통해 원격의료 서비스를 제공하며 평안보험 고객 전용 상품인 헬스 360을 출시했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The company acquired 346 million customers in the first half of 2020, a number larger than the entire U.S. population, utilizing the Pyeongan Insurance network.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The average usage rate of U.S. telemedicine companies, in fact, is said to be only around 2 to 3%.
answer: 실제로 미국 원격의료 업체들의 평균 이용률은 2~3% 수준에 불과하다고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This was why Teladoc's customers showed a high usage rate of 9-10%, which exceeded the industry average of 2-3% by far.
answer: 이로 인해 텔라닥의 고객들은 산업평균인 2~3%를 훨씬 웃도는 9~10%의 높은 이용률을 보이고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Pyeongyang Good Doctor’s average number of consultations per day has constantly increased to reach 730,000, providing over 1.1 billion telemedicine services by the first half of 2020.
answer: 평안굿닥터의 일 평균 상담 횟수는 지속적으로 상승해 73만 건에 달하며 2020년 상반기까지 11억 건 이상의 원격의료 서비스를 제공했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It launched a private doctor membership service for those who are not clients of Pyeongan Insurance, in addition to Health 360, a product exclusively accessed by its clients.
answer: 기존 평안보험그룹 고객 전용 상품인 헬스 360 외에 비평안보험 고객을 대상으로 한 프라이빗 닥터 멤버십 서비스를 론칭했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The true impact of COVID-19 on the structural growth of telemedicine The COVID-19 crisis has led to a considerable boost in the sales of telemedicine companies.
answer: 코로나바이러스가 원격의료의 구조적 성장에 미친 진짜 영향 코로나바이러스 사태는 원격의료 업체들에게 상당한 매출증가 효과를 일으켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Telemedicine, before the outbreak of COVID-19, was only given very limited benefits; it was only recognized when conducted by visiting medical institutions in suburban areas.
answer: 코로나바이러스 이전에는 교외지역에 한해 반드시 의료기관에 방문해 시행하는 원격의료만 인정하는, 매우 제한된 형태로 원격의료에 급여 혜택을 제공하고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. 32 million people are estimated to have type 1 diabetes in the U.S., while the in-hospital patient market is estimated to have 10 million patients.
answer: 미국 내 1형 당뇨 환자는 3,200만 명으로 추정되고 병원 내 환자 시장은 1,000만 명에 달하는 것으로 추정된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Telemedicine to be combined with offline treatment Telemedicine has been developed while being utilized to reduce medical costs and use medical resources more efficiently, focusing on patients with mild diseases.
answer: 오프라인 진료와 결합하게 될 원격의료 원격의료는 경증질환자를 중심으로 의료비용 절감과 의료자원 활용의 효율성을 높이는 데 활용되며 발전해왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The gap between the ideal and actual medical data One of the main reasons that telemedicine attracts interest from people is medical data.
answer: 의료 데이터의 이상과 현실의 괴리 사람들이 원격의료에 관심을 가진 가장 큰 이유 중 하나는 의료 데이터다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Electronic medical records, as part of clinical data generated in hospitals, are one of the three key data in healthcare, along with daily life data, which we produce in our daily life, and genetic data, which contain individual genetic information.
answer: 전자의무기록은 병원에서 생산되는 임상 데이터의 일부로서 우리가 일상생활에서 생산하는 일상생활 데이터와 개인의 유전정보가 담긴 유전 데이터와 함께 헬스케어 3대 데이터의 한 축을 담당한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The data immediately usable from electronic medical records is claim data, which is provided to the health insurance company.
answer: 전자의무기록에서 곧바로 활용 가능한 데이터는 건강보험사에 제공하는 청구 데이터다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Insurance code of the US medical device industry When analyzing the secondary added value of medical data derived from electronic medical records besides claim data, you would feel that there is still a long way to go, unlike the expectations of many people.
answer: 미국 의료기기 산업의 보험코드 그런데 청구 데이터 외에 전자의무기록에서 파생되는 의료 데이터로 인한 2차 부가가치에 대해서 분석하다 보면 많은 사람의 기대와는 달리 아직 갈 길이 멀다는 것을 느낄 수 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Looking into clinical practice led to the discovery of three major practical difficulties that made it hard for electronic medical records, which we regard as ideal, to work.
answer: 실제 임상 현장을 살펴보면 우리가 이상적으로 생각하는 전자의무기록이 작동하기 어려운 현실적인 어려움은 크게 세 가지가 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most of the substantial data existing in a hospital’s electronic medical record system, ironically, contains no meaningful information.
answer: 병원 전자의무기록 시스템에 존재하는 수많은 데이터는 역설적으로 대부분 의미 있는 정보를 담고 있지 않다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If a third party used the data to create added value, the next question would be how to reward the individual who produced the data.
answer: 그 데이터들을 활용해 제3자가 부가가치를 창출한다면 데이터를 생산한 개인에게 어떻게 보상을 해줄 것이냐에 대한 문제가 따를 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The real value of Pillpack is not in remote drug delivery but in individual packaging of medicines The U.S. company Pillpack is the provider of the service that packs drugs individually and delivers them remotely.
answer: 필팩의 진짜 가치는 원격 의약품 배송이 아닌 약품 개별포장 미국 기업 필팩은 약을 개별포장해 원격으로 배송하는 서비스를 제공한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Levothyroxine is a treatment for thyroid hormone, while atorvastatin is for lowering cholesterol.
answer: 레보티록신은 갑상선호르몬 치료제이며 아토르바스타틴은 콜레스테롤을 줄이는 치료제이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Refillable medicines can be delivered remotely in the form of mail, and this is called a mail-order service.
answer: 리필이 가능한 의약품은 우편 형태로 원격배송이 가능한데 우편 주문 서비스라고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. the accessibility of hospitals, clinics, and pharmacies is very poor, unlike Korean cities, where most medical institutions are a few minutes’ walk away.
answer: 도시의 경우 걸어서 몇 분 거리에 대부분 의료기관이 존재하는 우리나라와 달리 병·의원과 약국의 접근성이 매우 떨어진다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Allowing remote delivery only for refillable medicines enables it to save medical expenses incurred while seeing a doctor.
answer: 리필이 가능한 의약품에 한해 원격배송을 허용함으로써 의사를 만나면서 드는 의료비용을 절감할 수 있는 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The pharmaceutical culture of the U.S. is to give the medicine as a whole bottle, unlike Korea, where medicines are packaged.
answer: 미국의 의약품 문화는 우리나라처럼 포장해서 주는 것이 아니라 약통에 약을 통째로 담아서 주는 방식이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I believe you have heard may people saying that digital healthcare is a promising growth industry that will lead the future of Korea.
answer: 디지털 헬스케어는 우리나라의 미래를 책임질 유망한 성장 산업이라는 말을 많이 들어왔을 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The concept of digital healthcare that health data of the public will be collected for disease prevention and health management attracted a lot of interest.
answer: 일반인들의 건강 데이터를 모아서 질병예방과 건강관리에 활용한다는 디지털 헬스케어의 개념은 사람들의 관심을 증폭했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A survey by Endeavor Partners showed that a third of people who use activity trackers and smartwatches only used them for six months.
answer: 인데버 파트너즈의 설문조사에 따르면 활동량 측정기와 스마트워치 사용자의 3분의 1은 6개월 후에 더 이상 사용하지 않는 것으로 나타났다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Heart rate and ECG are very important to patients with a risk of a cardiac arrest.
answer: 심정지 가능성이 있는 환자에게는 심박수·심전도가 아주 중요하다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The second reason that healthcare wearables failed is that they could not provide solutions based on the measured data.
answer: 헬스케어 웨어러블 실패의 두 번째 원인은 측정한 데이터를 기반으로 한 솔루션을 제시하지 못한 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The essence of health care hidden in red ginseng, dog repellents, and masks It wasn't only Fitbit that attempted to transform the dynamics of the healthcare market with digital healthcare.
answer: 홍삼, 강아지 구충제, 마스크에 숨어 있는 헬스케어의 본질 디지털 헬스케어로 헬스케어 시장의 판도를 바꾸려고 시도했던 것은 핏빗만이 아니었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The news that it was effective against lung cancer caused it to be out of stock across the nation.
answer: 폐암에 효과가 있다고 알려지면서 전국에서 품절 사태를 일으켰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Long queues to get COVID-19 masks and dog repellents. The third is red ginseng.
answer: 코로나바이러스 마스크를 사기 위한 긴 줄과 강아지 구충제 셋째, 홍삼이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Korea’s red ginseng market is enormous, with its size estimated to be about 1.5 trillion won.
answer: 우리나라의 홍삼 시장규모는 대략 1조 5,000억 원으로 추산될 정도로 크다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medical devices to be the blockbuster in digital healthcare Early digital healthcare companies used digital technology to expand their customer base to the general public.
answer: 디지털 헬스케어의 블록버스터가 될 의료기기 초기 디지털 헬스케어 기업들은 디지털 기술을 활용해 일반인으로 고객층을 확대하고자 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is interesting that a number of people struggle to find unicorns in the digital healthcare industry when there are already blockbusters in it.
answer: 재미있는 일은 많은 사람이 디지털 헬스케어에서 유니콘을 찾기 위해 동분서주하지만, 이미 디지털 헬스케어에서도 블록버스터 존재한다는 사실이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The first strategy of early digital healthcare companies was to be the game-changer.
answer: 초기 디지털 헬스케어 기업들은 첫째 전략인 게임 체인저가 되고자 했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Recent years have seen the rise of digital implant surgery, which uses artificial intelligence technology to create surgical guides through 3D printing with an oral scanner that replaces the plaster impression.
answer: 최근에는 인공지능 기술을 활용해 석고인상을 대체하는 구강스캐너를 이용해 3D프린팅으로 수술용 가이드를 만들어 임플란트 수술을 시행하는 디지털 임플란트 수술이 부상하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All of the global top 10 medical device companies, in fact, are aggressively researching and developing digital technologies, actively using them in some products and services.
answer: 실제로 세계 10대 의료기기 회사들은 모두 디지털 기술을 적극적으로 연구개발하고 있고 몇몇 제품과 서비스에서 적극적으로 활용하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Could digital therapeutics be the blockbuster? Digital therapy is undoubtedly one of the hottest digital healthcare topics in 2020.
answer: 디지털 치료제는 블록버스터가 될 수 있을까 2020년 들어 가장 많이 언급되는 디지털 헬스케어와 관련된 주제 중 하나는 누가 뭐라고 해도 디지털 치료제일 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Having come into the world with the title of 'therapeutic agent', digital therapy made it clear that its business would target patients, not the general public.
answer: 디지털 치료제는 ‘치료제’라는 타이틀을 달고 세상에 나온 만큼 일반인 대상이 아닌 환자 대상으로 사업을 하겠다는 명확한 의지를 보였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Despite being called therapy, it belongs to 'medical devices,’ not drugs, since it is regulated as software for medical purposes.
answer: 치료제라고 불리지만, 의료 목적의 소프트웨어로 규제되기 때문에 의약품이 아닌 ‘의료기기’의 일부다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Digital therapy has to satisfy the three major stakeholders of the healthcare system at least if they are to be successful.
answer: 디지털 치료제가 성공하려면 결국 적어도 의료 시스템의 3대 이해관계자를 만족시켜야 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Most diseases, including cancer, do not have high patient compliance.
answer: 대부분 질병에서 심지어 암 환자조차도 환자 순응도가 높지 않다고 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There has been news that digital therapeutics have been recently added to the drug prescription recommendation list of U.S. insurance drug management companies.
answer: 최근 미국에서 보험약제 관리기업의 의약품 처방 권장 리스트에 디지털 치료제가 등재됐다는 뉴스가 나왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. These points suggest that there is a very limited number of indications that can be recognized as a first-line treatment.
answer: 이런 점들을 고려할 때 1차 치료제로 인정받을 수 있는 적응증은 매우 제한적일 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is possible that it will be recognized as a second-line or third-line treatment, as a matter of course.
answer: 물론 2차 치료제나 3차 치료제로 인정받을 가능성도 존재한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. All flaws and conditions to be considered in the case of 'replacing existing treatments' are applied in the same way.
answer: ‘기존 치료제를 대체하는 경우’의 모든 단점과 고려해야 할 상황이 동일하게 적용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. You will have to satisfy the three key stakeholders at least, if you wish to be a blockbuster in the healthcare system.
answer: 의료 시스템 내에서 블록버스터를 꿈꾼다면 적어도 3대 이해관계자는 반드시 만족시켜야 할 것이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is because there are only a few cases where it directly affects our lives, in contrast to information technology, the IT field, machinery, industry, military technology, and so on.
answer: 정보기술, IT 분야나 기계, 산업, 군사 기술 등과 달리 우리의 삶에 직접적으로 영향을 미치는 경우가 많지 않았기 때문입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I think, among the technologies that will transform the world after COVID-19, it is the 'bio' field, namely scientific technology in the bioscience field, that we should be most interested in.
answer: 코로나19 이후 세상을 바꿀 기술 중 우리가 가장 큰 관심을 가져야 할 것은 역시 ‘바이오’ 분야, 즉 생명과학 분야의 과학기술일 것 같습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I thought of how our society will change in the years from 2035 to 2041, which is when the promising biotechnology announced by the National Biotechnology Policy Research Center over two years from 2019 will be fully put to practical use, and published it as a short story.
answer: 2019년부터 2년 동안 국가생명공학정책연구센터가 발표한 바이오 미래유망기술이 완전히 실용화된 2035~2041년 사이의 미래가 되면 우리 사회를 어떻게 바꾸게 될까를 고민해 보고, 그 내용을 짤막한 단편 소설 형식으로 연재한 적이 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I worked hard to capture the idea that 'people in the future of advanced life science and technology may be living like this' as much as possible.
answer: ‘첨단 생명과학기술이 자리 잡은 미래의 사람들은 이런 삶을 살고 있지 않을까’ 하는 아이디어를 최대한 담기 위해 애썼습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It contains one more novel that summarized 5 technologies related to the prevention of infectious diseases from '2021 Bio Promising Technology', which was newly announced in 2021.
answer: 여기에 2021년 새롭게 발표한 ‘2021 바이오 미래유망기술’의 내용 중 감염병 예방과 관련된 5개의 기술만을 뽑아 정리한 한 편의 소설이 더 들어 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Writing the novel repeatedly over three years, I find that while I could introduce new detailed technologies, there are many cases where the futures pictured by them are not very different from each other.
answer: 3년이나 반복해 소설을 쓰다 보니, 세부적인 기술은 새로운 것이 소개됐지만 그 기술이 그리는 미래의 모습은 큰 차이가 나지 않는 경우가 많습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. ‘Bio-promising technology' originally classified life science and technology by purpose into rather unfamiliar categories like platform bio, red bio, and white bio, and it was because gathering three years of data required a new classification.
answer: ‘바이오 미래유망기술’은 본래 플랫폼바이오, 레드바이오, 화이트바이오 등의 다소 생소한 구분을 통해 생명과학기술을 목적에 맞게 구분하고 있습니다만, 3년간의 내용을 하나로 모으다 보니 새로운 구분이 필요했기 때문입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While he looked out the window, it suddenly flashed through his mind that he and Haseon had together participated in the project to commercialize this transportation system three or four years ago.
answer: 그는 창밖을 보면서 문득 3~4년 전, 이 교통시스템의 실용화 작업에 자신과 하선이 나란히 참가했었던 사실을 떠올렸다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The new idea that Hyun and Ha Seon suggested after putting their heads together during the process of system planning was to introduce the 'DNA recording technology’.
answer: 시스템 기획 과정에서 현과 하선이 머리를 맞대 새롭게 들고 들어간 아이디어는 ‘DNA기록기술’을 도입하자는 거였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Its ability to store 1 billion gigabytes of data in 10 gram of genetic material was throwing a sudden spotlight on it in recent years.
answer: 1g의 유전물질에 10억기가바이트, GB의 데이터를 저장할 수 있어 최근 수년 사이에 급격히 각광받고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A video call was requested to Hyun's mobile device just after 11:30 a.m.
answer: 11시 30분이 넘어갈 무렵, 현의 휴대 단말기로 영상 통화 요청이 들어왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While it has been several years since the DNA recording system was first theoretically studied, it was the U.S. company Microsoft that first succeeded in creating it.
answer: DNA기록시스템이 이론적으로 연구되기 시작한 건 몇 년 정도 지났지만, 처음으로 만드는 데 성공한 건 2019년 미국 기업 ‘마이크로소프트’입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Genes remember everything, including appearance, personality, and congenital health.
answer: 유전자는 사람의 모습, 성격, 선천적 건강 상태 등 모든 것을 기억하고 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Studies are rapidly being conducted to store a variety of information using the function of genes.
answer: 유전자의 기능을 이용해 다양한 정보를 저장하려는 연구가 속속 진행 중입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A large-scale next-generation storage device using such a system is expected to appear in the future.
answer: 미래가 된다면 이런 시스템을 활용한 거대 단위 차세대 저장장치가 등장할 것으로 보입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Hearing the news that she was accepted to the National Institute of Life Science and Technology, one of Korea’s top life science research institutes, Su-min spent several days with a joyful smile on her face.
answer: 국내 정상급 생명과학연구 기관으로 꼽히는 ‘국가생명정보기술원’ 최종 합격 소식을 듣고 수민은 기쁨에 겨워 며칠을 생글거리며 다녔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The emergence of 'CRISPR', the most effective one among these technologies, led people to expect that 'most genetic diseases will be cured in the future'.
answer: 이 기술 중 효율이 아주 뛰어난 ‘크리스퍼’가 등장하자 사람들은 ‘미래엔 대부분의 유전병이 치료될 것’이라고 기대했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Prime editing was fully put into practice in the medical world after the 2030s.
answer: 2030년대를 거치며 프라임 에디팅은 의학계에서 완전히 실용화됐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although it was so useful in conquering rare diseases that have extremely few numbers of patients, there were not many pharmaceutical companies or researchers who were willing to do such an ‘unprofitable work’.
answer: 환자 수가 극도로 적은 희귀병 정복에는 더 없이 유용했지만 그런 ‘소득 없는 일’을 하려는 제약 회사나 연구자는 많지 않았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Genetic scissors refer to the technique that cuts and connects 'DNA', the basic blueprint of organisms.
answer: 유전자가위는 생명체의 기본 설계도인 ‘DNA’를 자르고 이어 붙이는 기술을 말합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is for this reason that the gene scissor technology is said to be ‘comparable to the industrial revolution’.
answer: 유전자가위기술을 두고 ‘산업혁명에 필적하는 기술’이라는 이야기가 나오는 것은 그 때문입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There have been no ways until now for those who were born with a disease and still suffer from it, namely ‘genetic disease’ patients to treat their disease.
answer: 유전자가 잘못되어 태어날 때부터 병을 앓고 있는 사람, 즉 ‘유전병’ 환자들은 지금까지 병을 치료할 방법이 없었습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The evolution of genetic scissors is still underway; the first generation was called zinc finger nuclease, or ZFN, and the second generation Talen.
answer: 유전자가위도 계속 발전하고 있는데, 1세대를 징크핑거뉴클라아제, ZFN, 2세대를 탈렌이라고 불렀습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Researchers studying genetic scissors, the third-generation CRISPR in particular, received the Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 2020 as well.
answer: 유전자가위, 특히 3세대 크리스퍼 연구자들은 2020년 노벨화학상을 수상하기도 했습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The 4th generation 'prime editing' technology has recently become more widely available, alleviating such worries.
answer: 최근 4세대 ‘프라임 에디팅’기술이 보편화되면서 이런 우려는 사라졌습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since genetic scissors, particularly prime editing, are important technologies that will dramatically change our industry and medicine in the future, it was important for the protagonists, who wanted to succeed as 'all-round researchers,’ to have such abilities.
answer: 유전자가위, 특히 프라임 에디팅은 미래 우리 산업과 의학을 큰 폭으로 바꿔 줄 중요한 기술이기에 ‘만능 연구자’로 활약했으면 하는 주인공들에겐 꼭 필요한 능력이었답니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Every living thing uses genetic information to grow and maintain its vital function.
answer: 모든 생명체는 유전자 정보를 통해 성장하고 생체기능을 유지합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Problems in these genes will cause incurable disease that is difficult to be treated.
answer: 이런 유전자가 잘못된다면 치료하기 어려운 난치병을 겪게 됩니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Technology that corrects the wrong gene to treat such incurable diseases is known as 'gene scissors'.
answer: 잘못된 유전자를 교정해 이런 난치병을 치료할 수 있는 기술을 ‘유전자가위’라고 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This 'high-speed research' technology was one of the important skills that must be learned, especially for companies that needed to quickly turn ideas into products as well as for technical support groups whose main job is to provide companies with technical support.
answer: 특히 빠른 속도로 아이디어를 제품으로 바꿔 내야 하는 기업체, 그리고 기업체의 기술지원을 주 업무로 하는 기술지원단에게는 이런 ‘초고속 연구’기술은 반드시 익혀야 하는 중요 역량 중 하나였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The 'biofoundry' technology, a technique that rapidly conducts life science research using standardization technology of synthetic biology, artificial intelligence, and robot technology, has been attracting a lot of attention since 2020, bringing a considerable amount of achievement to humankind.
answer: 2020년 이후 크게 주목받기 시작한 ‘바이오파운드리’기술, 즉 합성생물학의 표준화기술, 인공지능, 로봇기술을 이용해 빠르게 생명과학 연구를 진행하는 이 기술을 통해 인류가 얻은 성과는 적지 않았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The ability to create synthetic microorganisms freely had already enabled the commercialization of technologies for producing large amounts of hydrogen with little energy, high-efficiency biofuel cells, and more.
answer: 합성 미생물을 자유롭게 만들 수 있게 되면서 적은 에너지로 대량의 수소를 생산하는 기술, 고효율 바이오연료전지 등이 이미 실용화되어 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This 'biofoundry' technology was the driving force behind how self-driving cars now freely ran on the road and the commercialization of large-capacity, pollution-free transport trucks using hydrogen as fuel and ultra-large pollution-free cargo ships.
answer: 자율주행차가 도로를 누비게 되었고, 수소를 연료로 쓰는 대용량 무공해 운송트럭, 초대형 무공해 화물선박 등이 실용화된 이면엔 이 ‘바이오파운드리’기술이 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There was an urgent need to develop a 'bio-industrial robot' that could immediately apply the results obtained from DNA design or gene editing to production, as companies wanted to turn ideas into products as quickly as possible.
answer: 기업은 아이디어를 최대한 빨리 제품으로 만들기를 원하기 때문에 DNA 설계나 유전자 편집 등으로 얻어낸 성과를 즉시 생산에 접목할 ‘바이오 산업용 로봇’ 개발이 절실했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although there was no doubt that this behavior was problematic, it implicitly taught me that he wasn't at least the type of person who ignored a younger researcher knocking on the door to ‘learn’.
answer: 이런 행동 자체는 분명 문제를 삼을 만한 것이었지만, 적어도 ‘배우겠다’고 방문을 두드리는 후배 연구자를 모른 척하는 사람은 아니었다는 점을 은연중에 알게 되었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I think it would be better if you first learned about 'synthetic biology', which is a slightly larger concept.
answer: 이보다 조금 더 큰 개념인 ‘합성생물학’에 대해서 먼저 알고 계시면 좋을 것 같습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is necessary to go back to 'systems biology' if one is to understand synthetic biology.
answer: 합성생물학을 알기 위해선 다시 ‘시스템생물학’을 알 필요가 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Studying such interactions of biomaterials to make desired traits was commonly known as 'systems biology'.
answer: 이렇게 생체물질들의 상호작용을 연구해 우리가 원하는 형질을 만드는 학문을 흔히 ‘시스템생물학’이라고 불렀습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although it is not an accurate way to say it, I believe it would be a bit more convenient for you to understand it as 'the work of changing the function of living things by manipulating their genes'.
answer: 정확한 표현은 아니지만 ‘유전자 조작으로 생명체의 기능을 바꾸는 일’이라고 이해하시면 조금 편할 것 같습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The term foundry originated in a factory where metal is melted, poured into molds, and made into castings.
answer: 본래 파운드리라는 용어는 금속을 녹여서 주형에 붓고 주물을 만드는 공장에서 유래한 단어입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An overseas pharmaceutical company called Amiris, for instance, has successfully commercialized 15 substances useful for the life science industry in the past 7 years, after introducing biofoundry.
answer: 예를 들어 아미리스라는 해외 제약 회사는 바이오파운드리를 도입한 이후, 생명과학 분야 산업에 유용한 물질을 지난 7년간 15개나 상용화하는 데 성공했습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The advent of technology to edit and synthesize genes has made it possible to adjust the properties of living things artificially.
answer: 유전자를 편집, 합성하는 기술이 생겨나면서 생명체의 성질을 인위적으로 조정하는 것이 가능해졌습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Introducing robots, ICT, etc. to design them as a single process in this stage is known as 'BioFoundry'.
answer: 이 과정에서 로봇과 ICT 등을 도입해 하나의 공정으로 설계하는 것을 ‘바이오파운드리’라고 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was maybe the tiniest effort that the public was making to reach a social 'consensus' over the course of scientific technology, which had begun to change abruptly.
answer: 급속도로 변화하기 시작한 과학기술의 행보를 놓고 사회적인 ‘합의’를 구하기 위해 대중이 갖는 일말의 노력인지도 몰랐다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There was also an increasing number of people opposing the 'manufacturing of organs for human transplantation'.
answer: 최근엔 ‘인체이식용 장기 제조’에 반대 목소리를 내는 사람들이 부쩍 늘어나고 있었다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Many reports were suggesting that if the side effects of the technology were to be completely controlled, the innovation of 'self-organizing multicellular structure' technology, in which the function of genes was artificially designed into necessary cells, tissues, etc., must be followed.
answer: 기술의 부작용을 완전하게 제어하려면 유전자의 기능을 인위적으로 설계해 필요한 세포, 조직 등으로 만드는 ‘자기조직화 다세포 구조’기술의 혁신이 뒤따라야 한다는 보고가 많았다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It should also be possible to self-organize this cell to adjust the 'multicellular structure', in other words, the process where the cell divides to form a structure.
answer: 이 세포를 완전히 자기조직화해서 ‘다세포 구조물’ 즉 세포가 분열하면서 구조물을 형성해 가는 과정도 조절할 수 있어야 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Professional efforts to study this field using the aforementioned synthetic biological method, in particular, are called 'self-organizing multicellular structure research,’ which is a field that has recently been receiving great attention in the bioengineering world.
answer: 이런 분야를 전문적으로, 특히 앞서 말씀드린 합성생물학적인 방법으로 풀어 보는 노력을 ‘자기조직화 다세포 구조’ 연구라고 하며, 최근 생명공학계에서 큰 관심을 얻고 있는 분야입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It refers to, in simple words, studying the ways to control its occurrence completely at the cellular level, taking a step further than the 'genetic engineering’ of the past.
answer: 쉽게 말해 과거의 ‘유전공학기술’에서 한 발 더 나아가, 그것의 발생을 세포 단위에서 완전히 통제하는 방법을 연구하는 것입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It is also a methodology that uses synthetic genes related to signal transduction to create a kind of artificial 'circuit' and introduces it into the cell system, managing the resulting phenomena to control life phenomena.
answer: 신호 전달에 관련된 합성유전자를 써서 일종의 ‘회로’를 인위적으로 만들어 세포시스템에 도입하고, 이로 인해 초래되는 현상들을 관리해 생명현상을 통제하는 방법론이기도 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The technology to weave the cells made by genes into proper living tissue is also necessary.
answer: 유전자가 만드는 세포를 제대로 된 생체 조직으로 엮어내는 기술 역시 필요합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Using synthetic biological technology to solve this series of processes is called 'self-organizing multicellular structure' research.
answer: 이런 일련의 과정을 합성생물학적 기술을 이용해 풀어 보는 것을 ‘자기조직화 다세포 구조’ 연구라고 부른답니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Now, in 2035, agriculture has already become part of the high-tech scientific technology business.
answer: 2035년이 된 지금, 농업은 이미 첨단 과학기술 사업의 범주에 들어갔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After being absorbed by the small intestine, the alcohol arrives in the liver, where it is primarily broken down by another enzyme called alcohol dehydrogenase, or ADH.
answer: 알코올은 소장에서 흡수돼 간에 도착하는데, 알코올탈수소효소, ADH라는 또 다른 효소가 알코올을 1차로 분해합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. An organelle called 'mitochondria’, which is in the interstitial cell, then starts working.
answer: 이때 간세포 속에 있는 ‘미토콘드리아’라는 소기관이 일을 합니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It keeps ALDH until detaching one hydrogen and one H from acetaldehyde.
answer: ALDH를 가지고 있다가 아세트알데하이드에서 수소, H를 하나 떼어냅니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It cannot be done right now, of course, but 'metabolic control technology through mitochondrial genome editing' is considered one of the new methods to control the characteristics of animals or plants freely.
answer: 물론 지금 당장 이렇게 할 수는 없겠지만 ‘미토콘드리아 유전체 편집을 통한 대사조절기술’은 이처럼 동물이나 식물의 특성을 자유자재로 조절할 수 있는 새로운 방법으로 꼽힙니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. While the key function that regulates the functions of the human body is 'genes', mitochondria also have a highly important role.
answer: 인체의 기능을 조정하는 핵심 기능은 무엇보다 ‘유전자’입니다만, 미토콘드리아 역시 대단히 중요한 역할을 맡고 있습니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Technology to edit the genome of the mitochondria itself is recently being studied.
answer: 최근 미토콘드리아 자체가 가지고 있는 유전체를 편집하는 기술을 연구 중입니다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This led to the Cultural Heritage Administration designating the goat as a natural monument number 217, with the Forest Service classifying it as an endangered wildlife species of class 1, and these designations were made to save the goat from extinction.
answer: 따라서 산양을 멸종으로부터 보호하기 위해 문화재청에서 천연기념물 제217호로 지정하였으며, 산림청에 서는 멸종위기 야생동물 1급으로 지정하였다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The sex distribution and genetic diversity of the goat population must therefore be regularly monitored, but while research on genetic diversity is ongoing, there is not enough data to support the sex ratio.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Not all medical devices require clinical trials in the medical device industry.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Differences between clinical trials in the pharmaceutical industry and the medical device industry Secondly, they have different processes of clinical trials.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Unlike drugs, which normally conduct three human clinical trials before the product goes on sale, medical devices conduct two clinical trials.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. while clinical trials for drugs are called phase 1, 2, or 3 clinical trials, those for the medical device industry are called exploratory trials and confirmatory trials.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The real customers are the doctors authorized to prescribe In most cases, medical devices are used in connection with medical activities like diagnosis and treatment at the doctor's discretion.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. If there is a patient who has an abnormality in the valve of the heart and needs to undergo replacement therapy, a thoracic surgeon may insist on valve replacement through an open chest, while a cardiologist might argue that they should insert a catheter into the blood vessel to replace the valve.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Growth Strategies for the Global Medical Device Industry The basic strategy of large companies is M&A The medical device industry is an oligopolistic market, where the top 10 companies occupy approximately 39% of the entire market.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medtronic signed a mega M&A deal with Covidien in 2014 that was worth $42.9 billion to leap from the world's second place to the first at once.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A comprehensive healthcare company, Abbott, started to concentrate on the medical device business after spinning off its new drug development business to a company called AbbVie in 2013.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Abbott acquired a leading company in the cardiovascular medical device industry, St. Jude Medical, for $250 billion, strengthening its medical device business.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Formerly the world's eighth-largest medical device company, Abbott has developed into the third-largest through two mergers and acquisitions.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Johnson & Johnson has been the no. 1 by an overwhelming margin in the orthopedic market since acquiring Synthes.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Becton Dickinson acquired CareFusion, a manufacturer of injectors, for $12.2 billion in 2014, and two years later, acquired Bard, which makes surgical instruments such as catheters, for $240 billion.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The M&A strategy is strongly preferred by companies in the medical device industry, an oligopolistic market.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Consumables sales that are more important than system sales Once introduced, medical devices can usually be used for 7 to 10 years, which means they have a very long replacement cycle.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Reasons for the emergence of early-stage companies that increase tenfold The medical device industry is experiencing innovation in all directions, in both traditional and new companies.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. I’d like to introduce specific cases of innovation occurring in three areas: circulatory and nervous systems, surgery, and chemotherapy.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A megatrend of innovation in the treatment area The healthcare industry is more than a medical device industry, as it improves, manages, and maintains health.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Percutaneous aortic valve replacement to replace circulatory and nervous system open thoracic surgery If someone asked me to choose the hottest keyword from 2019 in the global medical device industry, I would say percutaneous aortic valve replacement, TAVR.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. It was demonstrated in a clinical trial on 950 patients that percutaneous aortic valve replacement outperformed thoracotomy in mortality, stroke, and readmission rates.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Edwards Life Sciences estimates the market for percutaneous aortic valve replacement, which was $3.5 billion in 2018, to expand to $70 billion by 2024.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Mechanical Thrombectomy Challenges Standard Treatment In the United States, venous thromboembolism is the third most common vascular disease, coming after myocardial infarction and stroke.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Every year, 100 million patients are diagnosed with venous thromboembolism, and 300 thousand die of it; the medical cost is said to amount to $10 billion.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The collagenization of the fibrin composition, which happens only after around 3 weeks, makes it hard to break a venous thrombus with an anticoagulant.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There were 30 patients infected with resistant bacteria after Duodenoscopy in Seattle, U.S., between 2012 to 2014, and 11 of them died.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The fewer infections from endoscopy, the more benefits hospitals get.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Boston Scientific estimates the size of the global disposable duodenum market as $10 billion.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There has been a noticeable change in implantable neuromodulation treatment devices recently, in other words, 'remote monitoring and precision treatment' using data.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. BrainSense technology is the only deep brain stimulator as of now that enables the measurement of a patient's brain signal following a lead line connected to it.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. This treatment provides an analgesic effect for chronic pain by implanting an electric stimulator near the waist or buttocks and interfering with the pain signal that travels between the spinal cord and the brain.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Arrhythmia is a disease that develops when abnormalities in the electrical signals of the heart cause abnormal heartbeat.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medtronic is manufacturing an implantable drug injector called SynchroMed, which can inject neuro-therapeutic agents such as morphine and baclofen directly into the spinal cord in order to treat severe neurological diseases like chronic pain and muscle stiffness.
answer: 메드트로닉은 만성통증과 근육경직 등 중증 신경계 질환 치료를 위해 모르핀과 바크로펜 등 신경치료제를 척수에 직접 주입할 수 있는 이식형 약물주입기인 싱크로메드를 생산하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medtronic launched a cloud software called Episio so that it can more efficiently manage targeted drug delivery therapy through SynchroMed and increase patient compliance.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The words “the history of robotic surgery and the birth of a monopoly” would probably lead you to think of things like drones, combat robots, cartoons, delivery robots, and personal butlers.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Surgical surgery developed into laparoscopic surgery, in which, instead of laparotomy, a small hole of about 2 to 3 centimeters was drilled in the stomach and carbon dioxide was injected to secure an operating space, before an endoscope and various surgical tools were inserted to perform the operation.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Laparoscopic surgical robot consisting of a mechanical part, a control part, and an auxiliary image cart A doctor performing robotic surgery and a surgical tool for robotic surgery The U.S. company Intuitive Surgical has dominated the laparoscopic surgical robot market for several decades.
answer: 기계부, 조종부, 보조영상 카트로 구성된 복강경 수술로봇 로봇수술을 하는 의사와 로봇수술용 수술도구 이 복강경 수술로봇 시장을 몇 십 년째 장악하고 있는 기업이 바로 미국의 인튜이티브서지컬이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Since the acquisition of Computer Moon in 2003, which had been its biggest competitor, Intuitive Surgical has enjoyed a monopoly without facing any proper competition.
answer: 인튜이티브서지컬은 2003년 가장 큰 경쟁사였던 컴퓨터모션을 인수한 이후 이렇다 할 경쟁 없이 독점적 지위를 누려왔다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. After exceeding 10% for the first time in 2012, the proportion of general surgeries accounted for 24% in 2014, which was higher than urology, and then occupied 43% in 2018, overtaking even obstetrics and gynecology.
answer: 일반외과의 수술 비중은 2012년 처음으로 10%를 넘어선 후 2014년 비뇨기과보다 높은 24%를 차지했고 2018년에는 43%로 산부인과마저 넘어섰다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The share of system sales in Intuitive Surgical actually reached 67% in 2003 but declined to 30% in 2019.
answer: 실제로 인튜이티브서지컬의 시스템 매출 비중은 2003년 67%에 달했으나 2019년에는 30%로 감소했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Although the sales of consumables accounted for only 21% of sales in 2003, it increased to 54% in 2019.
answer: 소모품 매출 비중은 2003년 21%에 불과했으나 2019년에는 54% 수준으로 증가했다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The emergence of the strongest challenger in the 20-year history of robotic surgery It is also possible that there will be a change in the competitive landscape of surgical robots in the future.
answer: 로봇수술 20년 역사상 최강의 도전자 등장 앞으로 수술로봇의 경쟁 구도에 변화가 생길 가능성이 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Medtronic has been recording a revenue of $280 billion to $30 billion every year.
answer: 메드트로닉은 1년에 약 280억~300억 달러의 매출을 기록하고 있다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. A surgical robot of Intuitive Surgical costs 1.5 to 30 billion won for its system alone.
answer: 인튜이티브서지컬의 수술로봇은 시스템 가격만 15억~30억 원에 달한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Robotic surgery making its way to brain, spine, and vascular surgery Research and development are underway in various fields such as brain surgery, spinal surgery, joint surgery, vascular catheter surgery, and lung biopsy, in addition to laparoscopic surgery.
answer: 뇌, 척추, 혈관 수술까지 확장하는 로봇수술 수술로봇은 복강경수술 외에도 뇌수술, 척추수술, 관절수술, 혈관카테터 수술, 폐생검 등 다양한 분야에서 연구개발이 진행 중이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. When robot surgery is performed, it establishes a surgical plan in advance by securing 3D data of the surgical site with computed tomography.
answer: 로봇수술은 수술하기 전에 컴퓨터단층촬영으로 수술 부위의 3D 데이터를 확보해 수술 계획을 수립한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. The surgical robot uses the sensor to read the position information transmitted through the marker, matching it with the 3D data of the joint secured in advance.
answer: 마커를 통해 전송되는 위치 정보를 수술로봇이 센서로 읽어서 사전에 확보한 관절의 3D 데이터와 정합한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are currently three standard treatments for cancer: surgery, radiation therapy, and chemotherapy.
answer: 현재 암을 치료하기 위해 3가지 표준치료법으로 외과수술, 방사선 치료, 항암제가 활용된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. There are cases where weight loss surgery is performed to improve the effectiveness of chemotherapy or radiation therapy.
answer: 항암제나 방사선 치료의 효과를 향상하기 위해 감량수술이 시행되기도 한다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Electric field therapy used on 20,000 people to disrupt the division of cancer cells The three standard methods are excellent methods to treat cancer.
answer: 2만 명에게 사용된 암세포 분열을 방해하는 전기장 치료 3대 표준법은 훌륭한 암 치료 수단이다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Attaching the company's wearable device to the periphery of cancer cells forms a low-intensity alternating electric field of 50 to 200 kilohertz, which is called a tumor treatment field.
answer: 동사의 웨어러블 장치를 암세포 주변에 부착하면 종양치료장이라고 하는 50~200킬로헤르츠의 저강도 교번 전기장이 형성된다.

prompt: Translate the following sentence into Korean. Due to the high polarity of the two proteins, the mitotic division of cancer cells will be interrupted and eventually die if they are disturbed about 100,000 to 300,000 times per second with an electric field.
